text: King’s Landing Page : Welcome, Lord Stark. Grand Maester Pycelle has called a meeting of the Small Council. The honor of your presence is requested.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Get the girls settled in. I'll be back in time for supper. And, Jory, you go with them.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jory Cassel : Yes, my Lord.
name: Lord Snow

text: King’s Landing Page : If you'd like to change into something more appropriate...
name: Lord Snow

text: Jaime Lannister : Thank the gods you're here, Stark. About time we had some stern northern leadership.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Glad to see you're protecting the throne.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jaime Lannister : Sturdy old thing. How many kings' asses have polished it, I wonder ? What's the line ? The King sh1ts and the Hand wipes.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Very handsome armor. Not a scratch on it.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jaime Lannister : I know. People have been swinging at me for years, but they always seem to miss.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : You've chosen your opponents wisely then.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jaime Lannister : I have a knack for it. It must be strange for you coming into this room. I was standing right here when it happened. He was very brave, your brother. Your father too. They didn't deserve to die like that. Nobody deserves to die like that.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : But you just stood there and watched.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jaime Lannister : 500 men just stood there and watched. All the great knights of the Seven Kingdoms. You think anyone said a word, lifted a finger ? No, Lord Stark. 500 men and this room was silent as a crypt. Except for the screams, of course, and the Mad King laughing. And later... When I watched the Mad King die, I remembered him laughing as your father burned... It felt like justice.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Is that what you tell yourself at night ? You're a servant of justice ? That you were avenging my father when you shoved your sword in Aerys Targaryen's back ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Jaime Lannister : Tell me... If I'd stabbed the Mad King in the belly instead of the back, would you admire me more ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : You served him well when serving was safe.
name: Lord Snow

text: Varys : Lord Stark.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Lord Varys.
name: Lord Snow

text: Varys : I was grievously sorry to hear of your troubles on the Kingsroad. We are all praying for Prince Joffrey's full recovery.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : A shame you didn't say a prayer for the butcher's son. Renly ! You're looking well.
name: Lord Snow

text: Renly Baratheon : And you look tired from the road. I told them this meeting could wait another day, but...
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : But we have a Kingdom to look after. I've hoped to meet you for some time, Lord Stark. No doubt Lady Catelyn has mentioned me.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : She has, Lord Baelish. I understand you knew my brother Brandon as well.
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : All too well. I still carry a token of his esteem from navel to collarbone.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Perhaps you chose the wrong man to duel with.
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : It wasn't the man that I chose, my Lord. It was Catelyn Tully. A woman worth fighting for, I'm sure you'll agree.
name: Lord Snow

text: Grand Maester Pycelle : I humbly beg your pardon, my Lord Stark.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Grand Maester.
name: Lord Snow

text: Grand Maester Pycelle : How many years has it been ? You were a young man.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : And you served another King.
name: Lord Snow

text: Grand Maester Pycelle : How forgetful of me. This belongs to you, now. Should we begin ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Without the King ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Renly Baratheon : Winter may be coming, but I'm afraid the same cannot be said for my brother.
name: Lord Snow

text: Varys : His Grace has many cares. He entrusts some small matters to us that we might lighten the load.
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : We are the lords of small matters here.
name: Lord Snow

text: Renly Baratheon : My brother instructs us to stage a tournament in honor of Lord Stark's appointment as Hand of the King.
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : Mmm, how much ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : 40 000 gold dragons to the champion, 20 000 to the runner-up, 20 000 to the winning archer.
name: Lord Snow

text: Grand Maester Pycelle : Can the treasury bear such expense ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : I'll have to borrow it. The Lannisters will accommodate, I expect. We already owe Lord Tywin 3 million gold. What's another 80 000 ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Are you telling me the Crown is three million in debt ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : I'm telling you the Crown is six million in debt.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : How could you let this happen ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : The Master of Coin finds the money. The King and the Hand spend it.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : I will not believe Jon Arryn allowed Robert to bankrupt the realm.
name: Lord Snow

text: Grand Maester Pycelle : Lord Arryn gave wise and prudent advice, but I fear His Grace doesn't always listen.
name: Lord Snow

text: Renly Baratheon : "Counting coppers," he calls it.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : I'll speak to him tomorrow. This tournament is an extravagance we cannot afford.
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : As you will. But still, we'd best make our plans.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : There will be no plans until I speak to Robert. Forgive me, my Lords. I had a long ride.
name: Lord Snow

text: Varys : You are the King's Hand, Lord Stark, we serve at your pleasure.
name: Lord Snow

text: Cersei Baratheon : Please, it's nearly healed.
name: Lord Snow

text: Joffrey Baratheon : It's ugly.
name: Lord Snow

text: Cersei Baratheon : A King should have scars, you fought off a direwolf. You're a warrior like your father.
name: Lord Snow

text: Joffrey Baratheon : I'm not like him. I didn't fight off anything. It bit me and all I did was scream. And the two Stark girls saw it, both of them.
name: Lord Snow

text: Cersei Baratheon : That's not true. You killed the beast. You only spared the girl because of the love your father bears her father. When Aerys Targaryen sat on the Iron Throne, your father was a rebel and a traitor. Someday you'll sit on the throne and the truth will be what you make it.
name: Lord Snow

text: Joffrey Baratheon : Do I have to marry her ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Cersei Baratheon : Yes. She's very beautiful and young. If you don't like her, you only need to see her on formal occasions and when the time comes, to make little princes and princesses. And if you'd rather f*ck painted whores, you'll f*ck painted whores. And if you'd rather lie with noble virgins, so be it. You are my darling boy and the world will be exactly as you want it to be. Do something nice for the Stark girl.
name: Lord Snow

text: Joffrey Baratheon : I don't want to.
name: Lord Snow

text: Cersei Baratheon : No, but you will. The occasional kindness will spare you all sorts of trouble down the road.
name: Lord Snow

text: Joffrey Baratheon : We allow the northerners too much power. They consider themselves our equals.
name: Lord Snow

text: Cersei Baratheon : How would you handle them ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Joffrey Baratheon : I'd double their taxes and command them to supply 10 000 men to the royal army.
name: Lord Snow

text: Cersei Baratheon : A royal army ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Joffrey Baratheon : Why should every lord command his own men ? It's primitive, no better than the hill tribes. We should have a standing army of men loyal to the Crown, trained by experienced soldiers... Instead of a mob of peasants who've never held pikes in their lives.
name: Lord Snow

text: Cersei Baratheon : And if the northerners rebel ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Joffrey Baratheon : I'd crush them. Seize Winterfell and install someone loyal to the realm as Warden of the North. Uncle Kevan, maybe.
name: Lord Snow

text: Cersei Baratheon : And these 10 000 northern troops, would they fight for you or their lord ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Joffrey Baratheon : For me. I'm their King.
name: Lord Snow

text: Cersei Baratheon : But you've just invaded their homeland, asked them to kill their brothers.
name: Lord Snow

text: Joffrey Baratheon : I'm not asking.
name: Lord Snow

text: Cersei Baratheon : The North cannot be held... not by an outsider. It's too big and too wild. When the winter comes, the Seven gods together couldn't save you and your royal army. A good King knows when to save his strength... And when to destroy his enemies.
name: Lord Snow

text: Joffrey Baratheon : So you agree... The Starks are enemies ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Cersei Baratheon : Everyone who isn't us is an enemy.
name: Lord Snow

text: Septa Mordane : Enough of that, young lady. Eat your food.
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : I'm practicing.
name: Lord Snow

text: Sansa Stark : Practicing for what ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : The Prince.
name: Lord Snow

text: Septa Mordane : Arya, stop !
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : He's a liar and a coward and he killed my friend.
name: Lord Snow

text: Sansa Stark : The Hound killed your friend.
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : The Hound does whatever the Prince tells him to do.
name: Lord Snow

text: Sansa Stark : You're an idiot.
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : You're a liar. And if you told the truth, Mycah would be alive.
name: Lord Snow

text: Septa Mordane : Enough !
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : What's happening here ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Septa Mordane : Arya would rather act like a beast than a lady.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Go to your room. We'll speak later. That's for you, love. The same dollmaker makes all of Princess Myrcella's toys. Don't you like it ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Sansa Stark : I haven't played with dolls since I was eight. May I be excused ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Septa Mordane : You've barely eaten a thing.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : It's all right. Go on. War was easier than daughters.
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : Go away !
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Arya, open the door. May I come in ? Whose sword is that ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : Mine.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Give it to me. I know this maker's mark. This is Mikken's work. Where did you get this ? This is no toy. Little ladies shouldn't play with swords.
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : I wasn't playing. And I don't want to be a lady.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Come here. Now what do you want with this ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : It's called Needle.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : A blade with a name. And who were you hoping to skewer with Needle ? Your sister ? Do you know the first thing about sword fighting ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : Stick 'em with the pointy end.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : That's the essence of it.
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : I was trying to learn. I asked Mycah to practice with me. I asked him. It was my fault.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : No, sweet girl. You didn't kill the butcher's boy.
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : I hate them ! I hate all of them. The Hound, the Queen and the King and Joffrey and Sansa.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Sansa was dragged before the King and Queen... And asked to call the Prince a liar.
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : So was I ! He is a liar.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Darling, listen to me. Sansa will be married to Joffrey someday. She cannot betray him. She must take his side even when he's wrong.
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : But how you can let her marry someone like that ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Look at me. You're a Stark of Winterfell. You know our words.
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : Winter is coming.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : You were born in the long summer. You've never known anything else. But now winter is truly coming. And in the winter, we must protect ourselves, look after one another. Sansa is your sister.
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : I don't hate her. Not really.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : I don't want to frighten you, but I won't lie to you either. We've come to a dangerous place. We cannot fight a war amongst ourselves. All right ? Go on. It's yours.
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : I can keep it ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Try not to stab your sister with it. If you're going to own a sword, you'd better know how to use it.
name: Lord Snow

text: Old Nan : Don't listen to it. Crows are all liars. I know a story about a crow.
name: Lord Snow

text: Bran Stark : I hate your stories.
name: Lord Snow

text: Old Nan : I know a story about a boy who hated stories. I could tell you about Ser Duncan the Tall. Those were always your favorites.
name: Lord Snow

text: Bran Stark : Those weren't my favorites. My favorites were the scary ones.
name: Lord Snow

text: Old Nan : Oh, my sweet summer child. What do you know about fear ? Fear is for the winter, when the snows fall a hundred feet deep. Fear is for the long night, when the sun hides for years and children are born and live and die all in darkness. That is the time for fear, my little Lord, when the White Walkers move through the woods. Thousands of years ago there came a night that lasted a generation. Kings froze to death in their castles, same as the shepherds in their huts. And women smothered their babies rather than see them starve, and wept and felt the tears freeze on their cheeks. So is this the sort of story that you like ? In that darkness, the White Walkers came for the first time. They swept through cities and kingdoms, riding their dead horses, hunting with their packs of pale spiders big as hounds...
name: Lord Snow

text: Robb Stark : What are you telling him now ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Old Nan : Only what the little Lord wants to hear.
name: Lord Snow

text: Robb Stark : Get your supper. I want some time with him. One time she told me the sky is blue because we live inside the eye of a blue-eyed giant named Macomber.
name: Lord Snow

text: Bran Stark : Maybe we do.
name: Lord Snow

text: Robb Stark : How do you feel ? You still don't remember anything ? I've seen you climb a thousand times. In the wind, in the rain... A thousand times. You never fall.
name: Lord Snow

text: Bran Stark : I did though. It's true, isn't it... what Maester Luwin says about my legs ? I'd rather be dead.
name: Lord Snow

text: Robb Stark : Don't ever say that.
name: Lord Snow

text: Bran Stark : I'd rather be dead.
name: Lord Snow

text: Rodrick Cassel : Fewer eyes back here, my Lady. But still too many.
name: Lord Snow

text: Catelyn Stark : It's nine years since I've set foot in the capital. And no one knew who I was the last time I came either.
name: Lord Snow

text: Rodrick Cassel : My Lady.
name: Lord Snow

text: Guard : Welcome to King's Landing, Lady Stark. Would you mind following us ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Catelyn Stark : I would. We've done nothing wrong.
name: Lord Snow

text: Guard : We've been instructed to escort you into the city.
name: Lord Snow

text: Catelyn Stark : Instructed ? I don't know who's providing your instructions, but...
name: Lord Snow

text: Guard : Follow me, Lady Stark.
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : Cat ! Go on. Go upstairs.
name: Lord Snow

text: Catelyn Stark : You little worm ! You take me for some back-alley Sally you can drag into a...
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : I meant no disrespect to you of all people.
name: Lord Snow

text: Catelyn Stark : How dare you bring me here ! Have you lost your mind ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : No one will come looking for you here. Isn't that what like you wanted ? I'm truly sorry... about the locale.
name: Lord Snow

text: Catelyn Stark : How did you know I was coming to King's Landing ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : A dear friend told me.
name: Lord Snow

text: Varys : Lady Stark.
name: Lord Snow

text: Catelyn Stark : Lord Varys.
name: Lord Snow

text: Varys : To see you again after so many years is a blessing. Your poor hands.
name: Lord Snow

text: Catelyn Stark : How did you know I was coming ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Varys : Knowledge is my trade, my Lady. Did you bring the dagger with you, by any chance ? My little birds are everywhere. Even in the north. They whisper to me the strangest stories. Valyrian steel.
name: Lord Snow

text: Catelyn Stark : Do you know whose dagger this is ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Varys : I must admit I do not.
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : Well well, this is an historic day. Something you don't know that I do. There's only one dagger like this in all of the Seven Kingdoms. It's mine.
name: Lord Snow

text: Catelyn Stark : Yours ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : At least it was, until the tournament on Prince Joffrey's last nameday. I bet on Ser Jaime in the jousting, as any sane man would. When the Knight of the Flowers unseated him, I lost this dagger.
name: Lord Snow

text: Catelyn Stark : To whom ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : Tyrion Lannister. The Imp.
name: Lord Snow

text: Alliser Thorne : Grenn, show him what you farm boys are made of. If that were a real sword, you'd be dead. Lord Snow here grew up in a castle spitting down on the likes of you. Pyp. Do you think Ned Stark's b*st*rd bleeds like the rest of us ? Next ! Next ! Lord Snow, it appears you're the least useless person here. Go clean yourselves up. There's only so much I can stomach in a day.
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : A charming man.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jeor Mormont : I don't need him to be charming. I need him to turn this bunch of thieves and runaways into men of the Night's Watch.
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : And how's that going, Commander Mormont ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Jeor Mormont : Slowly. A raven came for Ned Stark's son.
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : Good news or bad ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Jeor Mormont : Both.
name: Lord Snow

text: Grand Maester Pycelle : Lord Stark. I meant to give you this earlier. So forgetful these days. A raven from Winterfell this morning.
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : Good news ? Perhaps you'd like to share it with your wife ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : My wife is in Winterfell.
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : Is she ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : I thought that she'd be safest in here. One of several such establishments I own.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : You're a funny man. A very funny man.
name: Lord Snow

text: Catelyn Stark : Ned !
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : The Starks... Quick tempers, slow minds.
name: Lord Snow

text: Grenn : You broke my nose, b*st*rd !
name: Lord Snow

text: Jon Snow : It's an improvement.
name: Lord Snow

text: Grenn : If we threw you over the Wall, wonder how long it'd take you to hit.
name: Lord Snow

text: Pyp : I wonder if they'd find you before the wolves did.
name: Lord Snow

text: Grenn : What're you looking at, Half Man ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : I'm looking at you. You've got an interesting face. Very distinctive faces. All of you.
name: Lord Snow

text: Rast : What do you care about our faces ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : It's just I think they would look marvellous decorating spikes in King's Landing. Perhaps I'll write my sister, the Queen, about it.
name: Lord Snow

text: Grenn : We'll talk later, Lord Snow.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jon Snow : Everybody knew what this place was and no one told me. No one but you. My father knew and left me to rot here at the Wall all the same.
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : Grenn's father left him too... Outside a farmhouse when he was three. Pyp was caught stealing a wheel of cheese. His little sister hadn't eaten in three days. He was given a choice: his right hand or the Wall. I've been asking the Lord Commander about them. Fascinating stories.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jon Snow : They hate me because I'm better than they are.
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : It's a lucky thing none of them were trained by a master-at-arms like your Ser Rodrik. I don't imagine any of them have ever held a real sword before they came here. Your brother Bran. He's woken up.
name: Lord Snow

text:
ad=document.getElementById("chitika-ads-1"),ad.getBoundingClientRect().width?adWidth=ad.getBoundingClientRect().width:adWidth=ad.offsetWidth,function(){if(void 0===window.CHITIKA&&(window.CHITIKA={units:[]}),adWidth>=550)var t={publisher:"andjoh",width:550,height:250,sid:"In-Post",color_site_link:"E7CE64",color_text:"ffffff",color_bg:"000033",color_button:"E7CE64",color_button_text:"000033"};else var t={publisher:"andjoh",width:300,height:250,sid:"In-Post",color_site_link:"E7CE64",color_text:"ffffff",color_bg:"000033",color_button:"E7CE64",color_button_text:"000033"};var i=window.CHITIKA.units.length;window.CHITIKA.units.push(t),document.write('
');var e=document.createElement("script");e.type="text/javascript",e.src="//cdn.chitika.net/getads.js";try{document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(e)}catch(o){document.write(e.outerHTML)}}();
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : The mere suggestion that the Queen's brother tried to kill your boy would be considered treason.
name: Lord Snow

text: Catelyn Stark : We have proof. We have the blade.
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : Which Lord Tyrion will say was stolen from him. The only man who could say otherwise has no throat, thanks to your boy's wolf.
name: Lord Snow

text: Catelyn Stark : Petyr has promised to help us find the truth. He's like a little brother to me. He would never betray my trust.
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : I'll try to keep you alive, for her sake. A fool's task, admittedly, but I've never been able to refuse your wife anything.
name: Lord Snow

text: Catelyn Stark : I won't forget this. You're a true friend.
name: Lord Snow

text: Petyr Baelish : Don't tell anyone. I have a reputation to maintain.
name: Lord Snow

text: Cersei Baratheon : How could you be so stupid ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Jaime Lannister : Calm down.
name: Lord Snow

text: Cersei Baratheon : He's a child... 10 years old. What were you thinking ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Jaime Lannister : I was thinking of us. You're a bit late to start complaining about it now. What has the boy told them ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Cersei Baratheon : Nothing. He's said nothing. He remembers nothing.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jaime Lannister : Then what are you raving about ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Cersei Baratheon : What if it comes back to him ? If he tells his father what he saw...
name: Lord Snow

text: Jaime Lannister : We'll say he was lying. We'll say he was dreaming. We'll say whatever we like. I think we can outfox a 10-year-old.
name: Lord Snow

text: Cersei Baratheon : And my husband ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Jaime Lannister : I'll go to war with him if I have to. They can write a ballad about us : "The War for Cersei's c**t."
name: Lord Snow

text: Cersei Baratheon : Let me go.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jaime Lannister : Never.
name: Lord Snow

text: Cersei Baratheon : Let me go.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jaime Lannister : The boy won't talk. And if he does, I'll kill him. Him, Ned Stark, the King... the whole bloody lot of them, until you and I are the only people left in this world.
name: Lord Snow

text: Catelyn Stark : I wish I could see the girls.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : It's too dangerous.
name: Lord Snow

text: Catelyn Stark : Just for a moment.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Until we know who our enemies are...
name: Lord Snow

text: Catelyn Stark : I know they did it, Ned. The Lannisters. In my bones, I know it.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Littlefinger's right. I can't do anything without proof.
name: Lord Snow

text: Cersei Baratheon : And if you find the proof ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Then I bring it to Robert... And hope he's still the man I once knew. You watch yourself on the road, huh ? That temper of yours is a dangerous thing.
name: Lord Snow

text: Catelyn Stark : My temper ? Gods be good, you nearly killed poor Littlefinger yesterday.
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : He still loves you.
name: Lord Snow

text: Catelyn Stark : Does he ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Eddard Stark : Off with you.
name: Lord Snow

text: Robert Baratheon : It's been a long time. But I still remember every face. You remember your first ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Barristan Selmy : Of course, your Grace.
name: Lord Snow

text: Robert Baratheon : Who was it ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Barristan Selmy : A Tyroshi. Never learned the name.
name: Lord Snow

text: Robert Baratheon : How'd you do it ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Barristan Selmy : Lance through the heart.
name: Lord Snow

text: Robert Baratheon : Quick one. Lucky for you. Mine was some Tarly boy at the Battle of Summerhall. My horse took an arrow so I was on foot, slogging through the mud. He came running at me, this dumb high-born lad, thinking he could end the rebellion with the single swing of his sword. I knocked him down with the hammer. Gods, I was strong then. Caved in his breastplate. Probably shattered every rib he had. Stood over him, hammer in the air. Right before I brought it down he shouted, "Wait ! Wait." They never tell you how they all sh1t themselves. They don't put that part in the songs. Stupid boy. Now the Tarlys bend the knee like everyone else. He could have lingered on the edge of the battle with the smart boys and today his wife would be making him miserable, his sons would be ingrates, and he'd be waking three times in the night to piss into a bowl. Wine ! Lancel. Gods, what a stupid name. Lancel Lannister. Who named you ? Some halfwit with a stutter ? What are you doing ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Lancel Lannister : It's empty, your Grace.
name: Lord Snow

text: Robert Baratheon : What do you mean it's empty ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Lancel Lannister : There's no more wine.
name: Lord Snow

text: Robert Baratheon : Is that what empty means ? So get more. Tell your cousin to get in here. Kingslayer ! Get in here. Surrounded by Lannisters. Every time I close my eyes I see their blond hair and their smug, satisfied faces. It must wound your pride, huh ? Standing out there like a glorified sentry. Jaime Lannister, son of the mighty Tywin... Forced to mind the door while your King eats and drinks and sh1ts and f*cks. So come on. We're telling war stories. Who was your first kill, not counting old men ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Jaime Lannister : One of the outlaws in the Brotherhood.
name: Lord Snow

text: Barristan Selmy : I was there that day. You were only a squire, 16 years old.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jaime Lannister : You killed Simon Toyne with a counter riposte. Best move I ever saw.
name: Lord Snow

text: Barristan Selmy : A good fighter, Toyne, but he lacked stamina.
name: Lord Snow

text: Robert Baratheon : Your outlaw... Any last words ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Jaime Lannister : I cut his head off, so no.
name: Lord Snow

text: Robert Baratheon : What about Aerys Targaryen ? What did the Mad King say when you stabbed him in the back ? I never asked. Did he call you a traitor ? Did he plead for a reprieve ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Jaime Lannister : He said the same thing he'd been saying for hours... "Burn them all." If that's all, your Grace...
name: Lord Snow

text: Daenerys Targaryen : Do the Dothrakis buy their slaves ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Jorah Mormont : The Dothraki don't believe in money. Most of their slaves were given to them as gifts.
name: Lord Snow

text: Daenerys Targaryen : From whom ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Jorah Mormont : If you rule a city and you see the horde approaching, you have two choices : pay tribute or fight. An easy choice for most. Of course, sometimes it's not enough. Sometimes a Khal feels insulted by the number of slaves he's given. He might think the men too weak or the women too ugly. Sometimes a Khal decides his riders haven't had a good fight in months and need the practice.
name: Lord Snow

text: Daenerys Targaryen : Tell them all to stop.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jorah Mormont : You want the entire horde to stop ? For how long ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Daenerys Targaryen : Until I command them otherwise.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jorah Mormont : You're learning to talk like a Queen.
name: Lord Snow

text: Daenerys Targaryen : Not a Queen. A Khaleesi.
name: Lord Snow

text: Viserys Targaryen : You dare ! You give commands to me ? To me ? You do not command the dragon. I am Lord of the Seven Kingdoms. I don't take orders from savages or their sluts. Do you hear me ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Irri : Rakharo ask if you want him dead, Khaleesi.
name: Lord Snow

text: Daenerys Targaryen : No !
name: Lord Snow

text: Irri : Rakharo say you should take ear, to teach respect.
name: Lord Snow

text: Daenerys Targaryen : Please please, don't hurt him. Tell him I don't want my brother harmed.
name: Lord Snow

text: Viserys Targaryen : Kill these Dothraki dogs ! I am your King !
name: Lord Snow

text: Jorah Mormont : Shall we return to the Khalasar ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Rakharo : You walk.
name: Lord Snow

text: Benjen Stark : I wanted to be here when you saw it for the first time. I'm leaving this morning.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jon Snow : You're leaving ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Benjen Stark : I'm the First Ranger. My job is out there. There have been disturbing reports.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jon Snow : What kind of reports ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Benjen Stark : The kind I don't want to believe.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jon Snow : I'm ready. I won't let you down.
name: Lord Snow

text: Benjen Stark : You're not going. You're no ranger, Jon.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jon Snow : But I'm better than every...
name: Lord Snow

text: Benjen Stark : Better than no one ! Here... A man gets what he earns, when he earns it. We'll speak when I return.
name: Lord Snow

text: Yoren : A bear's balls.
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : You're joking ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Yoren : And his brains and his guts, his lungs and his heart all fried in his own fat. When you're a hundred miles north of the Wall and you ate your last meal a week ago, you leave nothing for the wolves.
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : And how do a bear's balls taste ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Yoren : A bit chewy. And what about you, my Lord ? What's the strangest thing you've eaten ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : Do Dornish girls count ? So you roam the Seven Kingdoms, collaring pickpockets and horse thieves and bringing them here as eager recruits ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Yoren : But it's not all of 'em's done bad things. Some of 'em's just poor lads looking for steady feed. Some of 'em's high-born lads looking for glory.
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : They have a better chance finding feed than glory.
name: Lord Snow

text: Benjen Stark : The Night's Watch is a joke to you, is it ? Is that what we are, Lannister ? An army of jesters in black ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : You don't have enough men to be an army and aside from Yoren here, none of you are particularly funny.
name: Lord Snow

text: Benjen Stark : I hope we've provided you with some good stories to tell when you're back in King's Landing. But something to think about while you're drinking your wine down there, enjoying your brothels... Half the boys you've seen training will die north of the Wall. Might be a wilding's axe that gets them, might be sickness, might just be the cold. They die in pain. And they do it so plump little lords like you can enjoy their summer afternoons in peace and comfort.
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : Do you think I'm plump ? Listen, Benjen... May I call you Benjen ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Benjen Stark : Call me what you like.
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : I'm not sure what I've done to offend you. I have great admiration for the Night's Watch. I've great admiration for you as First Ranger.
name: Lord Snow

text: Benjen Stark : You know, my brother once told me that nothing someone says before the word "but" really counts.
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : But... I don't believe that giants and ghouls and White Walkers are lurking beyond the Wall. I believe that the only difference between us and the wildlings is that when the Wall went up, our ancestors happened to live on the right side of it.
name: Lord Snow

text: Benjen Stark : You're right. The wildlings are no different from us. A little rougher maybe. But they're made of meat and bone. I know how to track them and I know how to kill them. It's not the wildlings giving me sleepless nights. You've never been north of the Wall, so don't tell me what's out there.
name: Lord Snow

text: Yoren : Are you going below ? Keep well, keep warm.
name: Lord Snow

text: Benjen Stark : Enjoy the capital, brother.
name: Lord Snow

text: Yoren : I always do.
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : I think he's starting to like me. "Going below" ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Yoren : Into the tunnel and out the other side. He'll be north of the Wall for a month or two.
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : So you're heading down to King's Landing too.
name: Lord Snow

text: Yoren : Day after tomorrow. I get about half of my recruits from their dungeons.
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : Let's share the road. I could use some decent company.
name: Lord Snow

text: Yoren : I travel a bit on the grubby side, my Lord.
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : Not this time. We'll be staying at the finest castles and inns. No one turns away a Lannister.
name: Lord Snow

text: Irri : Yes, Khaleesi.
name: Lord Snow

text: Daenerys Targaryen : What are you doing ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Irri : When was last time you bleed, Khaleesi ? You change, Khaleesi. It’s a blessing from the Great Stallion.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jorah Mormont : For a man on horseback, the curved blade is a good thing, easier to handle. It's a good weapon for a Dothrakan. But a man in full plate... the arakh won't get through the steel. That's where the broadsword has the advantage. Designed for piercing plate.
name: Lord Snow

text: Rakharo : Dothraki don’t wear steel dresses.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jorah Mormont : Armor.
name: Lord Snow

text: Rakharo : Armor. Armor make a man... Vroz ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Jorah Mormont : Slow.
name: Lord Snow

text: Rakharo : Slow.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jorah Mormont : It's true, but it also keeps a man alive.
name: Lord Snow

text: Rakharo : My father taught me how to fight. He taught me that speed defeats size.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jorah Mormont : I’ve heard that your father was a famous warrior.
name: Lord Snow

text: Rakharo : He was bloodrider to Khal Bharbo. And your father, Jorah the Andal ? He was a warrior also ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Jorah Mormont : He still is. A man of great honor. And I betrayed him.
name: Lord Snow

text: Irri : The Khaleesi wants to eat something different tonight. Kill some rabbits.
name: Lord Snow

text: Rakharo : There are no rabbits.
name: Lord Snow

text: Irri : Find some ducks, she likes ducks.
name: Lord Snow

text: Rakharo : Have you seen any ducks, woman ? No rabbits, no ducks. Do you have eyes in your head ? Do you ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Irri : Dog then. I have seen many dogs.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jorah Mormont : I don't think she wants to eat dog.
name: Lord Snow

text: Irri : The Khaleesi have baby inside her. It is true. She does not bleed for two moons. Her belly start to swell.
name: Lord Snow

text: Rakharo : A blessing from the Great Stallion.
name: Lord Snow

text: Irri : She does not want to eat horse.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jorah Mormont : I'll have the boys butcher a goat for supper. I need to ride to Qohor.
name: Lord Snow

text: Rhakaro : We ride for Vaes Dothrak.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jorah Mormont : Don't worry. I'll catch you. The horde's easy to find.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jon Snow : Don't stand so still. It's harder to hit a moving target. Except for you. You move too much. I could just hold my sword out and let you do the work for me.
name: Lord Snow

text: Maester Aemon : How many winters have you seen, Lord Tyrion ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : Eight... no, nine.
name: Lord Snow

text: Maester Aemon : All of them brief ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : They say the winter of my birth was three years long, Maester Aemon.
name: Lord Snow

text: Maester Aemon : This summer has lasted nine. But reports from the Citadel tell us the days grow shorter. The Starks are always right eventually : winter is coming. This one will be long and dark things will come with it.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jeor Mormont : We've been capturing wildlings, more every month. They're fleeing south. The ones who flee... say they've seen the White Walkers.
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : Yes, and the fishermen of Lannisport say they see mermaids.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jeor Mormont : One of our own rangers swore he saw them kill his companions. He swore it right up to the moment Ned Stark chopped his head off.
name: Lord Snow

text: Maester Aemon : The Night's Watch is the only thing standing between the realm and what lies beyond. And it has become an army of undisciplined boys and tired old men. There are less than a thousand of us now. We can't man the other castles on the Wall. We can't properly patrol the wilderness. We've barely enough resources to keep our lads armed and fed.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jeor Mormont : Your sister sits by the side the King. Tell her we need help.
name: Lord Snow

text: Maester Aemon : When winter does come, gods help us all if we're not ready.
name: Lord Snow

text: Daenerys Targaryen : It’s a boy.
name: Lord Snow

text: Khal Drogo : How do you know ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Daenerys Targaryen : I know.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jon Snow : I'm sorry to see you leave, Lannister.
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : It's either me or this cold. And it doesn't appear to be going anywhere.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jon Snow : Will you stop at Winterfell on your way South ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : I expect I will. Gods know there aren't many feather beds between here and King's Landing.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jon Snow : If you see my brother Bran, tell him I miss him. Tell him I'd visit if I could.
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : Of course.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jon Snow : He'll never walk again.
name: Lord Snow

text: Tyrion Lannister : If you're going to be a cripple, it's better to be a rich cripple. Take care, Snow.
name: Lord Snow

text: Jon Snow : Farewell, My Lord.
name: Lord Snow

text: Syrio Forel : You are late, boy. Tomorrow you will be here at midday.
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : Who are you ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Syrio Forel : Your dancing master, Syrio Forel. Tomorrow you will catch it. Now pick it up. That is not the way, boy. This is not a great sword that is needing two hands to swing it.
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : It's too heavy.
name: Lord Snow

text: Syrio Forel : It is heavy as it needs to be to make you strong. Just so. One hand is all that is needed. Now you are standing all wrong. Turn your body sideface. So. You are skinny. That is good. The target is smaller. Now the grip... Let me see. The grip must be delicate.
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : What if I drop it ?
name: Lord Snow

text: Syrio Forel : The steel must be part of your arm. Can you drop part of your arm ? No. Nine years Syrio Forel was first sword to the Sealord of Braavos. He knows these things. You must listen to me, boy.
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : I'm a girl.
name: Lord Snow

text: Syrio Forel : Boy, girl... You are a sword, that is all. That is the grip. You are not holding a battle-axe. You are holding...
name: Lord Snow

text: Arya Stark : A needle.
name: Lord Snow

text: Syrio Forel : Just so. Now we will begin the dance. Remember, child, this is not the dance of the Westeros we are learning... The knight's dance, hacking and hammering. This is the Bravo's dance... The water dance. It is swift and sudden. All men are made of water, do you know this ? If you pierce them, the water leaks out and they die. Now you will try to strike me. Up ! Dead. Dead. Very dead. Come. Again, faster.
name: Lord Snow

text: Tell them all to stop.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: For how long?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Until I command them otherwise.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: You're learning to talk like a Queen.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Not a Queen. A Khaleesi.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Lord Snow here grew up in a castle spitting down on the likes of you.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Everybody knew what this place was, but no one told me ... no one but you.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: The Khaleesi have baby inside her.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: It is true. Her belly start to swell.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: I need to ride to Qohor.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: What did Aaerys Targaryen say when you stabbed him in the back?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: He said the same thing he'd been saying for hours ... "burn them all."
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: My brother instructs us to stage a tournament in honor of Lord Stark's appointment as Hand of the King.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: This tournament is an extravagance we cannot afford.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: I'm leaving this morning. My job is out there.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: I won't let you down.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: You're not going.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Here, a man gets what he earns when he earns it.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: I don't take orders from savages or their sluts.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: I don't want my brother harmed.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Mormont, kill these Dothraki dogs!
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: We've come to a dangerous place. We must protect ourselves.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Ah!
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: We allow the Northerners too much power.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: A good King knows when to save his strength and when to destroy his enemies.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: So you agree... The Starks are enemies?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Everyone who isn't us is an enemy.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Do you know whose dagger this is?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Littlefinger: I do.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister's...
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: The imp.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text:
♪ Game of Thrones 1x04 ♪
Cripples, Bastards, and Broken Things
Original Air Date on May 8, 2011
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Old Nan: The little Lord's been dreaming again.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Theon Greyjoy: We have visitors.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Bran Stark: I don't want to see anyone.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Theon Greyjoy: Really? If I was cooped up all day with no one but this old bat for company, I'd go mad. Anyway, you don't have a choice. Robb's waiting.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Bran Stark: I don't want to go.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Theon Greyjoy: Neither do I. But Robb's Lord of Winterfell, which means I do what he says and you do what I say. Hodor! Help Bran down the hall.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: I must say I received a slightly warmer welcome on my last visit.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Robb Stark: Any man of the Night's Watch is welcome at Winterfell.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: Any man of the Night's Watch, but not I, eh, boy?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Robb Stark: I'm not your boy, Lannister. I'm Lord of Winterfell while my father is away.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: Then you might learn a lord's courtesy. So it's true. Hello Bran. Do you remember anything about what happened?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Maester Luwin: He has no memory of that day.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: Curious.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Robb Stark: Why are you here?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: Would your charming companion be so kind as to kneel? My neck is beginning to hurt.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Bran Stark: Kneel, Hodor.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: Do you like to ride, Bran?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Bran Stark: Yes. Well, I mean I did like to.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Maester Luwin: The boy has lost the use of his legs.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: What of it? With the right horse and saddle, even a cripple can ride.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Bran Stark: I'm not a cripple.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: Then I'm not a dwarf. My father will rejoice to hear it. I have a gift for you. Give that to your saddler. He'll provide the rest. You must shape the horse to the rider. Start with a yearling and teach it to respond to the reins and to the boy's voice.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Bran Stark: Will I really be able to ride?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: You will. On horseback you will be as tall as any of them.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Robb Stark: Is this some kind of trick? Why do you want to help him?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: I have a tender spot in my heart for cripples, bastards and broken things.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Robb Stark: You've done my brother a kindness. The hospitality of Winterfell is yours.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: Spare me your false courtesies, Lord Stark. There's a brothel outside your walls. There I'll find a bed and both of us can sleep easier.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Theon Greyjoy: Couldn't resist some northern ass? If you like redheads, ask for Ros.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: Come to see me off, Greyjoy? Kind of you. Your master doesn't seem to like Lannisters.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Theon Greyjoy: He's not my master.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: No, of course not. What happened here? Where is lady Stark? Why didn't she receive me?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Theon Greyjoy: She wasn't feeling well.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: She's not in Winterfell, is she? Where did she go?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Theon Greyjoy: My lady's whereabouts...
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: My lady? Your loyalty to your captors is touching. Tell me, how do you think Balon Greyjoy would feel if he could see his only surviving son has turned lackey? I still remember seeing my father's fleet burn in Lannisport. I believe your uncles were responsible?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Theon Greyjoy: Must have been a pretty sight.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: Nothing prettier than watching sailors burn alive. Yes, a great victory for your people. Shame how it all turned out.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Theon Greyjoy: We were outnumbered 10 to one.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: A stupid rebellion then. I suppose your father realized that when your brothers died in battle. Now here you are, your enemy's squire.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Theon Greyjoy: Careful, Imp.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: I've offended you. Forgive me, it's been a rough morning. Anyway, don't despair. I'm a constant disappointment to my own father and I've learned to live with it. Your next tumble with Ros is on me. I'll try not to wear her out.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: Leg, shoulder, leg. Left foot forward. Good. Now pivot as you deliver the stroke. Put all your weight behind it.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grenn: What in seven hells is that?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Pyp: They'll need an eighth hell to fit him in.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Alliser Thorne: Tell them your name.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: Samwell Tarly, of Horn Hill. I mean, I was of Horn Hill. I've come to take the black.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Rast: Come to take the black pudding.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Alliser Thorne: Well, you couldn't be any worse than you look. See what he can do.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: I yield. Please, no more.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Alliser Thorne: On your feet. Pick up your sword. Hit him till he finds his feet. It seems they've run short of poachers and thieves down south. Now they send us squealing bloody pigs. Again, harder.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: Enough! He yielded.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Alliser Thorne: Looks like the b*st*rd's in love. All right then, lord Snow, you wish to defend your lady love, let's make it an exercise. You two. Three of you ought to be sufficient to make lady piggy squeal. All you've got to do is get past the b*st*rd.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: Are you sure you want to do this?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grenn: No. Yield yield yield! I yield.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Alliser Thorne: We're done for today. Go clean the armory. That's all you're good for.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Pyp: Well fought!
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grenn: Piss off.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: Did he hurt you?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: I've had worse.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: You can call me Sam... If you want. My mother calls me Sam.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: It's not going to get any easier, you know? You'll have to defend yourself.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grenn: Why didn't you get up and fight?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: I wanted to. I just couldn't.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grenn: Why not?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: I'm a coward. My father always says so.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: The Wall's no place for cowards.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: You're right. I'm sorry. I just... Wanted to thank you.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grenn: A bloody coward. People saw us talking to him. Now they'll think we're cowards too.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Pyp: You're too stupid to be a coward.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grenn: You're too stupid to be a...
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Pyp: Quick now, before summer's over.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grenn: Come on here!
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jorah Mormont: Vaes Dothrak. The city of the horselords.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: A pile of mud. Mud and sh1t and twigs - best these savages can do.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Daenerys Targaryen: These are my people now. You shouldn't call them savages.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: I'll call them what I like, because they're my people. This is my army. Khal Drogo is marching the wrong way with my army.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Daenerys Targaryen: If my brother was given an army of Dothraki, could you conquer the Seven Kingdoms?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jorah Mormont: The Dothraki have never crossed the Narrow Sea. They fear any water their horses can't drink.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Daenerys Targaryen: But if they did?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jorah Mormont: King Robert is fool enough to meet them in open battle, but the men advising him are different.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Daenerys Targaryen: And you know these men?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jorah Mormont: I fought beside them once, long ago. Now Ned Stark wants my head. He drove me from my land.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Daenerys Targaryen: You sold slaves. Why?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jorah Mormont: I had no money and an expensive wife.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Daenerys Targaryen: And where is she now?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jorah Mormont: In another place, with another man.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Doreah: Your Grace?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: Yes, my dear?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Doreah: They call you the last dragon...
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: They do.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Doreah: You have dragon's blood in your veins?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: It's entirely possible.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Doreah: What happened to the dragons? I was told that brave men killed them all.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: The brave men didn't kill dragons. The brave men rode them. Rode them from Valyria to build the greatest civilization this world has ever seen. The breath of the greatest dragon forged the Iron Throne, which the Usurper is keeping warm for me. The swords of the vanquished, a thousand of them... melted together like so many candles.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Doreah: I have always wanted to see a dragon. There is nothing in the world that I would rather see.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: Really? Why dragons?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Doreah: They can fly. And wherever they are, just a few flaps of their wings and they're somewhere else... Far away. And they can kill. Anyone or anything that tries to hurt them gets burned away to nothing... melted... like so many candles. Seeing a dragon would make me very happy.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: Well, after 15 years in a pleasure house, I imagine just seeing the sky makes you happy.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Doreah: I was not locked in. I have seen things.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: What have you seen?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Doreah: I've seen... A man from Asshai with a dagger of real dragonglass. I've seen a man who could change his face the way that other men change their clothes. And I've seen a pirate who wore his weight in gold and whose ship had sails of colored silk. So... Have you seen one?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: A pirate ship?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Doreah: A dragon.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: No, the last one died many years before I was born. I'll tell you what I have seen: their skulls. They used to decorate the throne room in the Red Keep. When I was very young, just 3 or 4, my father used to walk me down the rows and I'd recite their names for him. When I got them all right, he'd give me a sweet. The ones closest to the door were the last ones they were able to hatch and they were all stunted and wrong. Skulls no bigger than dog skulls. But as you got closer to the Iron Throne... They got bigger and bigger and bigger. There was Ghiscar and Valryon, Vermithrax, Essovius, Archonel, Meraxes, Vhagar... And Balerion the Dread... whose fire forged the Seven Kingdoms into one.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Doreah: What happened to the skulls?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: I don't know. The Usurper had them smashed to powder, I expect. Scattered to the wind.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Doreah: That's very sad.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: Yes, it is. What did I buy you for? To make me sad?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Doreah: No, your Grace. To teach your sister.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: To teach my sister how to be a better lover? You think I bought you to make Khal Drogo happy? You pretty little idiot. Go on then. Get on with it.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Septa Mordane: Someday your husband will sit there and you will sit by his side. And one day, before too long, you will present your son to the court. All the lords of Westeros will gather here to see the little prince...
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Sansa Stark: What if I have a girl?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Septa Mordane: Gods be good, you'll have boys and girls and plenty of them.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Sansa Stark: What if I only have girls?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Septa Mordane: I wouldn't worry about that.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Sansa Stark: Jeyne Poole's mother had five children, all of them girls.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Septa Mordane: Yes, but it's highly unlikely.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Sansa Stark: But what if?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Septa Mordane: If you only had girls, I suppose the throne would pass to Prince Joffrey's little brother.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Sansa Stark: And everyone would hate me.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Septa Mordane: Nobody could ever hate you.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Sansa Stark: Joffrey does.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Septa Mordane: Nonsense. Why would you say such a thing? That business with the wolves? I've told you a hundred times... A direwolf is not...
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Sansa Stark: Please shut up about it.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Septa Mordane: Do you remember your lessons? Who built the Iron Throne?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Sansa Stark: Aegon the Conqueror.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Septa Mordane: And who built the Red Keep?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Sansa Stark: Maegor the Cruel.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Septa Mordane: And how many years did it take to build...
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Sansa Stark: My grandfather and uncle were murdered here, weren't they?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Septa Mordane: They were killed on the orders of King Aerys, yes.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Sansa Stark: The Mad King.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Septa Mordane: Commonly known as the Mad King.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Sansa Stark: Why were they killed?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Septa Mordane: You should be speak to your father about these matters.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Sansa Stark: I don't want to speak to my father, ever.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Septa Mordane: You will find it in your heart to forgive your father.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Sansa Stark: No, I won't.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Janos Slynt: It's the Hand's tournament that's causing all this trouble, my Lords.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: The King's tournament. I assure you the Hand wants no part of it.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Janos Slynt: Call it what you will, Lord Stark Ser, the city is packed with people and more flooding in every day. Last night we had a tavern riot, a brothel fire, three stabbings and a drunken horse race down the Street of Sisters.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Varys: Dreadful.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Renly Baratheon: If you can't keep the King's peace, perhaps the City Watch should be commanded by someone who can.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Janos Slynt: I need more men.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: You'll get 50. Lord Baelish will see it paid for.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Petyr Baelish: I will?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: You found money for a champion's purse, you can find money to keep the peace. I'll also give you 20 of my household guards till the crowds have left.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Janos Slynt: Thank you, my Lord Hand Ser. They will be put to good use.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: The sooner this is over, the better.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Varys: The realm prospers from such events, my Lord. They give the great a chance at glory, and the lowly a respite from their woes.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Petyr Baelish: And every inn in the city is full and the whores are walking bow-legged.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: I'm sure the tourney puts coins in many a pocket. Now... If there's nothing else, my Lords?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grand Maester Pycelle: This heat. On days like this, I envy you northerners your summer snows. Until tomorrow my Lord.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: I've been hoping to talk to you about Jon Arryn.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grand Maester Pycelle: Lord Arryn? His death was a great sadness to all of us. I took personal charge of his care, but I could not save him. His sickness struck him very hard and very fast. I saw him in my chambers just the night before he passed. Lord Jon often came to me for counsel.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: Why?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grand Maester Pycelle: I have been Grand Maester for many years. Kings and Hands have come to me for advice since...
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: What did Jon want the night before he died?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grand Maester Pycelle: He came inquiring after a book.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: A book? What book?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grand Maester Pycelle: I fear it would be of little interest to you, my Lord. A ponderous tome.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: I'd like to read it.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grand Maester Pycelle: "The lineages and histories of the great houses of the Seven Kingdoms, with descriptions of many high lords and noble ladies and their children."
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: "Harkon Umber, first of his name, born to lord Hother Umber and lady Amaryllis Umber in the 183rd year after Aegon's landing, at the last hearth. Blue of eye, brown of hair and fair complected, died in his 14th year of a wound sustained in a bear hunt."
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grand Maester Pycelle: As I said, my Lord, a ponderous read.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: Did Jon Arryn tell you what he wanted with it?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grand Maester Pycelle: He did not, my Lord. And I did not presume to ask.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: Jon's death...
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grand Maester Pycelle: Such a tragedy.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: Did he say anything to you during his final hours?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grand Maester Pycelle: Nothing of import, my Lord. There was one phrase he kept repeating: "The seed is strong," I think it was.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: "The seed is strong"? What does that mean?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grand Maester Pycelle: The dying mind is a demented mind, Lord Stark. For all the weight they're given, last words are usually as significant as first words.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: And you're quite certain he died of a natural illness?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grand Maester Pycelle: What else could it be?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: Poison.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grand Maester Pycelle: A disturbing thought. I don't think it likely. The Hand was loved by all. What sort of man would dare...
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: I've heard it said that poison is a woman's weapon.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grand Maester Pycelle: Yes. Women, cravens... and eunuchs. Did you know that lord Varys is a eunuch?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: Everybody knows that.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grand Maester Pycelle: Of course. How that sort of person found himself on the King's Council, I will never know.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: I've taken enough of your time.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grand Maester Pycelle: No trouble at all, my Lord. It's a great honor...
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: Thank you. I'll find my own way out.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Arya Stark: Syrio says a water dancer can stand on one toe for hours.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: It's a hard fall down these steps.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Arya Stark: Syrio says every hurt is a lesson and every lesson makes you better. Tomorrow I'm going to be chasing cats.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: Cats? Syrio says…
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Arya Stark: He says every swordsman should study cats. They're quiet as shadows and as light as feathers. You have to be quick to catch them.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: He's right about that.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Arya Stark: Now that Bran's awake will he come live with us?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: He needs to get his strength back first.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Arya Stark: He wants to be a knight of the King’s Guard. He can't be one now, can he?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: No. But someday he could be Lord of a holdfast or sit on the King's Council. Or he might raise castles like Brandon the Builder.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Arya Stark: Can I be Lord of a holdfast?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: You will marry a high Lord and rule his castle. And your sons shall be knights and princes and lords.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Arya Stark: No. That's not me.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: Hello. Ser Alliser said I'm to be your new watch partner. I should warn you, I don't see all that well.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: Come stand by the fire. It's warmer.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: No, that's all right. I'm fine.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: You're not. You're freezing.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: I don't like high places.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: You can't fight. You can't see. You're afraid of heights and almost everything else probably. What are you doing here, Sam?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: On the morning of my 18th nameday, my father came to me. "You're almost a man now," he said, "but you're not worthy of my land and title. Tomorrow, you're going to take the black, forsake all claim to your inheritance and start north. If you do not," he said, "then we'll have a hunt and somewhere in these woods your horse will stumble and you'll be thrown from your saddle to die. Or so I'll tell your mother. Nothing would please me more." Ser Alliser's going to make me fight again tomorrow, isn't he?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: Yes, he is.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: I'm not going to get any better, you know?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: Well… You can't get any worse.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text:
ad=document.getElementById("chitika-ads-1"),ad.getBoundingClientRect().width?adWidth=ad.getBoundingClientRect().width:adWidth=ad.offsetWidth,function(){if(void 0===window.CHITIKA&&(window.CHITIKA={units:[]}),adWidth>=550)var t={publisher:"andjoh",width:550,height:250,sid:"In-Post",color_site_link:"E7CE64",color_text:"ffffff",color_bg:"000033",color_button:"E7CE64",color_button_text:"000033"};else var t={publisher:"andjoh",width:300,height:250,sid:"In-Post",color_site_link:"E7CE64",color_text:"ffffff",color_bg:"000033",color_button:"E7CE64",color_button_text:"000033"};var i=window.CHITIKA.units.length;window.CHITIKA.units.push(t),document.write('
');var e=document.createElement("script");e.type="text/javascript",e.src="//cdn.chitika.net/getads.js";try{document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(e)}catch(o){document.write(e.outerHTML)}}();
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Petyr Baelish: I hear you're reading a boring book.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: Pycelle talks too much.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Petyr Baelish: He never stops. Do you know Ser Hugh of the Vale? Not surprising. Until recently, he was only a squire... Jon Arryn's squire. He was knighted almost immediately after his master's untimely death.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: Knighted for what? Why are you telling me this?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Petyr Baelish: I promised Cat that I'd help you.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: Where is Ser Hugh? I'll speak to him.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Petyr Baelish: A singularly bad idea. Do you see that boy there? One of Varys's little birds. The Spider has taken a great interest in your comings and goings. Now look there. That one belongs to the Queen. And do you see that Septa pretending to read her book?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: Varys or the Queen?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Petyr Baelish: No. She's one of mine. Is there someone in your service whom you trust completely?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: Yes.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Petyr Baelish: The wiser answer was no, my Lord. Get a message to this paragon of yours... Discreetly. Send him to question Ser Hugh. After that, you might want him to visit a certain armorer in the city. He lives in a large house at the top of the street of Steel.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: Why?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Petyr Baelish: I have my observers, as I said, and it's possible that they saw Lord Arryn visit this armorer several times in the weeks before his death.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: Lord Baelish, perhaps I was wrong to distrust you.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Petyr Baelish: Distrusting me was the wisest thing you've done since you climbed off your horse.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jory Cassel: Ser Hugh? Ser Hugh!
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Hugh of the Vale: As you can see, I'm busy.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jory Cassel: I'm here on behalf of Lord Eddard Stark, the Hand of the king. I'm the captain of his guard.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Hugh of the Vale: I'm sorry. I didn't catch your name, Ser...
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jory Cassel: No "ser." I'm not a knight.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Hugh of the Vale: I see. Well, it just so happens that I am.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jory Cassel: He said he'd be glad to talk to the Hand himself. He's a knight, you see.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: A knight. They strut around like roosters down here. Even the ones who've never seen an arrow coming their way.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jory Cassel: You shouldn't be out here, my Lord. There's no telling who has eyes where.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: Let them look.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tobho Mott: The former Hand did call on me, my Lord, several times. I regret to say he did not honor me with his patronage.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: What did Lord Arryn want?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tobho Mott: He always came to see the boy.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: I'd like to see him as well.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tobho Mott: As you wish, my Lord. Gendry! Here he is. Strong for his age. He works hard. Show the Hand the helmet you made, lad.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: This is fine work.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Gendry: It's not for sale.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tobho Mott: Boy, this is the King's Hand! If his lordship wants the helmet...
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Gendry: I made it for me.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tobho Mott: Forgive him, my Lord.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: There's nothing to forgive. When Lord Arryn came to visit you, what would you talk about?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Gendry: He just asked me questions is all, my Lord.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: What kind of questions?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Gendry: About my work at first, if I was being treated well, if I liked it here. But then he started asking me about my mother.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: Your mother?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Gendry: Who she was, what she looked like.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: What did you tell him?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Gendry: She died when I was little. She had yellow hair. She'd sing to me sometimes.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: Look at me. Get back to work, lad. If the day ever comes when that boy'd rather wield a sword than forge one, you send him to me.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jory Cassel: Find anything?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: King Robert's b*st*rd son.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jory Cassel: This is for the King from Lord Stark.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jaime Lannister: Listen. Do you hear them? How many do you think are in there with him? Guess.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jory Cassel: Three? Four?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jaime Lannister: He likes to do this when I'm on duty... He makes me listen as he insults my sister.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jory Cassel: Forgive me, my Lord...
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jaime Lannister: Why do I have to forgive you? Have you wronged me?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jory Cassel: We've met before, you know.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jaime Lannister: Have we? Strange, I've forgotten.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jory Cassel: The siege of Pyke. We fought side by side one afternoon.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jaime Lannister: That's where you got your scar?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jory Cassel: Aye. One of the Greyjoys nearly took my eye.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jaime Lannister: Vicious sons of whores.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jory Cassel: They like their bloodshed.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jaime Lannister: They stopped liking it at the end. That was a proper battle. D'you remember Thoros of Myr charging through the breach?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jory Cassel: With his burning sword? I'll remember that till the day I die.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jaime Lannister: I saw the youngest of the Greyjoy lads at Winterfell. It was like seeing a shark on a mountaintop.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jory Cassel: Theon? He's a good lad.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jaime Lannister: I doubt it.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Robert Baratheon: I'll bet you smell of blackberry jam! Let me smell it. Come here.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jory Cassel: Can I leave this with you? The message from Lord Stark.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things
