text: Jaime Lannister: I don't serve Lord Stark.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grenn: Where have you been?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: Watch duty. With Sam.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Pyp: Prince Porkchop. Where is he?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: He wasn't hungry.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Pyp: Impossible!
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: That's enough. Sam's no different from the rest of us. There was no place for him in the world, so he's come here. We're not going to hurt him in the training yard anymore. Never again, no matter what Thorne says. He's our brother now and we're going to protect him.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Rast: You are in love, Lord Snow. You girls can do as you please. But if Thorne puts me up against Lady Piggy, I'm gonna slice me off a side of bacon.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: No one touches Sam.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Alliser Thorne: What are you waiting for? Attack him! You, get in there.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Grenn: Hit me. Go on, hit me! I yield! Yield yield. I yield.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Alliser Thorne: You think this is funny, do you? When you're out there beyond the Wall with the sun going down, do you want a man at your back? Or a sniveling boy?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: You send this whore to give me commands? I should have sent you back her head!
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Doreah: Forgive me, Khaleesi. I did as you asked.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Daenerys Targaryen: Hush now. It's all right. Irri, take her and leave us.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Irri: Yes, Khaleesi.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Daenerys Targaryen: Why did you hit her?!
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: How many times do I have to tell you? You do not command me.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Daenerys Targaryen: I wasn't commanding you. I just wanted to invite you to supper.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: What's this?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Daenerys Targaryen: It's a gift. I had it made for you.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: Dothraki rags? Are you going to dress me now?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Daenerys Targaryen: Please.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: This stinks of manure. All of it.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Daenerys Targaryen: Stop - stop it.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: You would turn me into one of them, wouldn't you? Next you'll want to braid my hair.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Daenerys Targaryen: You've no right to a braid. You've won no victories yet.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Viserys Targaryen: You do not talk back to me! You are a horselord's slut. And now you've woken the dragon...
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Daenerys Targaryen: I am a Khaleesi of the Dothraki! I am the wife of the great Khal and I carry his son inside me. The next time you raise a hand to me will be the last time you have hands.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: I know for a fact that some of the officers go to that brothel in Mole's Town.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: I wouldn't doubt it.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: Don't you think it's a little bit unfair? Making us take our vows while they sneak off for a little sally on the side?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: Sally on the side?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: It's silly, isn't it? What, we can't defend the Wall unless we're celibate? It's absurd.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: I didn't think you'd be so upset about it.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: Why not? Because I'm fat? But I like girls just as much as you do. They might not like me as much. I've never... been with one. You've probably had hundreds.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: As a matter of fact, I'm the same as you.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: I find that hard to believe.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: I came very close once. I was alone in a room with a naked girl, but...
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: You didn't know where to put it?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: I know where to put it.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: Was she... Old and ugly?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: Young and gorgeous. A whore named Ros.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: What color hair?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: Red.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: I like red hair. And her... Her...
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: You don't want to know.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: That good?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: Better.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: Oh no. So why exactly did you not make love to Ros with the perfect...
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: What's my name?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: Jon Snow?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: And why is my surname Snow?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: Because... You're a b*st*rd from the north.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: I never met my mother. My father wouldn't even tell me her name. I don't know if she's living or dead. I don't know if she's a noblewoman or a fisherman's wife... Or a whore. So I sat there in the brothel as Ros took off her clothes. But I couldn't do it. Because all I could think was what if I got her pregnant and she had a child, another b*st*rd named Snow? It's not a good life for a child.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: So... You didn't know where to put it?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Alliser Thorne: Enjoying yourselves? You look cold, boys.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Samwell Tarly: It is a bit nippy.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Alliser Thorne: A bit nippy, yeah, by the fire, indoors. It's still summer. Do you boys even remember the last winter? How long has it been now? What, 10 years? I remember. Was it uncomfortable at Winterfell? Were there days when you just couldn't get warm, never mind how many fires your servants built?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jon Snow: I build my own fires.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Alliser Thorne: That's admirable. I spent six months out there, beyond the Wall during the last winter. It was supposed to be a two-week mission. We heard a rumor Mance Rayder was planning to attack Eastwatch. So we went out to look for some of his men... Capture them, gather some knowledge. The Wildlings who fight for Mance Rayder are hard men. Harder than you'll ever be. They know their country better than we do. They knew there was a storm coming in. So they hid in their caves and waited for it to pass. And we got caught in the open. Wind so strong it yanked 100-foot trees straight from the ground, roots and all. If you took your gloves off to find your cock to have a piss, you lost a finger to the frost. And all in darkness. You don't know cold. Neither of you do. The horses died first. We didn't have enough to feed them, to keep them warm. Eating the horses was easy. But later when we started to fall... That wasn't easy. We should have had a couple of boys like you along, shouldn't we? Soft, fat boys like you. We'd have lasted a fortnight on you and still had bones leftover for soup. Soon we'll have new recruits and you lot will be passed along to the Lord Commander for assignment and they will call you men of the Night's Watch, but you'd be fools to believe it. You're boys still. And come the winter you will die... Like flies.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Daenerys Targaryen: I hit him. I hit the dragon.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jorah Mormont: Your brother Rhaegar was the last dragon. Viserys is less than the shadow of a snake.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Daenerys Targaryen: He is still the true King.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jorah Mormont: The truth now: do you want to see your brother sitting on the Iron Throne?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Daenerys Targaryen: No. But the common people are waiting for him. Illyrio said they're sewing dragon banners and praying for his return.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jorah Mormont: The common people pray for rain, health and a summer that never ends. They don't care what games the high Lords play.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Daenerys Targaryen: What do you pray for, Ser Jorah?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jorah Mormont: Home.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Daenerys Targaryen: I pray for home too. My brother will never take back the Seven Kingdoms. He couldn't lead an army even if my husband gave him one. He'll never take us home.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Petyr Baelish: Lover's quarrel?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Sansa Stark: I'm sorry. Do I...?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Septa Mordane: Sansa dear, this is Lord Baelish. He's known...
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Petyr Baelish: An old friend of the family. I've known your mother a long long time.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Arya Stark: Why do they call you Littlefinger?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Sansa Stark: Arya!
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Septa Mordane: Don't be rude!
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Petyr Baelish: No, it's quite all right. When I was a child I was very small and I come from a little spit of land called The Fingers, so you see, it's an exceedingly clever nickname.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Robert Baratheon: I've been sitting here for days! Start the damn joust before I piss myself!
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Sansa Stark: Gods, who is that?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Petyr Baelish: Ser Gregor Clegane. They call him the Mountain. The Hound's older brother.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Sansa Stark: And his opponent?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Petyr Baelish: Ser Hugh of the Vale. He was Jon Arryn's squire. Look how far he's come.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Robert Baratheon: Yes, yes. Enough of the bloody pomp. Have at it!
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Petyr Baelish: Not what you were expecting? Has anyone ever told you the story of the Mountain and the Hound? Lovely little tale of brotherly love. The Hound was just a pup, six years old maybe. Gregor a few years older, already a big lad, already getting a bit of a reputation. Some lucky boys just born with a talent for violence. One evening... Gregor found his little brother playing with a toy by the fire... Gregor's toy, a wooden knight. Gregor never said a word, he just grabbed his brother by the scruff of his neck and shoved his face into the burning coals. Held him there while the boy screamed, while his face melted. There aren't very many people who know that story.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Sansa Stark: I won't tell anyone. I promise.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Petyr Baelish: No, please don't. If the Hound so much as heard you mention it, I'm afraid all the knights in King's Landing would not be able to save you.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Jory Cassel: My Lord, Her Grace the Queen.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: Your Grace.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Cersei Baratheon: You're missing your tournament.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: Putting my name on it doesn't make it mine.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Cersei Baratheon: I thought we might put what happened on the Kingsroad behind us – the ugliness with the wolves. And forcing you to kill the beast was extreme. Though sometimes we go to extremes where our children are concerned. How is Sansa?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: She likes it here.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Cersei Baratheon: The only Stark who does. Favors her mother, not much of the north in her.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: What are you doing here?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Cersei Baratheon: I might ask the same of you. What is it you hope to accomplish?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: The King called on me to serve him and the realm, and that's what I'll do until he tells me otherwise.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Cersei Baratheon: You can't change him. You can't help him. He'll do what he wants, which is all he's ever done. You'll try your best to pick up the pieces.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: If that's my job, then so be it.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Cersei Baratheon: You're just a soldier, aren't you? You take your orders and you carry on. I suppose it makes sense. Your older brother was trained to lead and you were trained to follow.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Eddard Stark: I was also trained to kill my enemies, Your Grace.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Cersei Baratheon: As was I.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Marillion: Seven blessings to you, goodfolk!
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Catelyn Stark: And to you.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Rodrick Cassel: Boy! Bread, meat and beer, quickly.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Marillion: Good idea, grandfather. I'm starving. A song while we wait or?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Rodrick Cassel: I'd rather throw myself down a well.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Marillion: Grandfather, may be your last chance if you're heading north. The only music the northerners know is the howling of wolves!
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Masha Heddle: I'm sorry, my Lord, we're full up. Every room.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: My men can sleep in the stable. As for myself, I don't require a large room.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Masha Heddle: Truly, my lord, we have nothing.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: Is there nothing I can do... to remedy this?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Bronn: You can have my room.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: There's a clever man. You can manage food, I trust? Yoren, dine with me.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Yoren: Aye, my Lord.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Marillion: My Lord of Lannister! Might I entertain you while you eat? I can sing of your father's victory at King's Landing!
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: Nothing would more likely ruin my supper. Lady Stark! What an unexpected pleasure. I was sorry to have missed you at Winterfell.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Masha Heddle: Lady Stark.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Catelyn Stark: I was still Catelyn Tully the last time I stayed here. You, Ser... Is that the black bat of Harrenhal I see embroidered on your coat?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Knight of House Whent: It is, my Lady.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Catelyn Stark: And is Lady Whent a true and honest friend to my father... Lord Hoster Tully of Riverrun?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Knight of House Whent: She is.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Catelyn Stark: The Red Stallion was always a welcome sight at Riverrun. My father counts Jonas Bracken amongst his oldest and most loyal bannermen.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Knight of House Bracken: Our lord is honored by his trust.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Tyrion Lannister: I envy your father all his fine friends... but I don't quite see the purpose of this.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Catelyn Stark: I know your sigil as well... The twin towers of Frey. How fares your Lord, Ser?
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Knight of House Frey: Lord Walder is well, my Lady. He has asked your father for the honor of his presence on his 90th nameday. He plans to take another wife.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: Catelyn Stark: This man... came into my house as a guest and there conspired to murder my son, a boy of 10. In the name of King Robert and the good Lords you serve, I call upon you to seize him and help me return him to Winterfell to await the King's justice.
name: Cripples Bastards and Broken Things

text: In this episode: Catelyn has captured Tyrion and plans to bring him to her sister, Lysa Arryn, at The Vale, to be tried for his, supposed, crimes against Bran. Robert plans to have Daenerys killed, but Eddard refuses to be a part of it and quits.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [King's Landing - Ned Stark crosses the stone bridge to the Tourney of the Hand's grounds. He passes workers as they prepare for the day's games and enters the fallen Ser Hugh's tent where he joins Barristan Selmy watching over the dead knight's burial preparations.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Does Ser Hugh have any family in the capital?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BARRISTAN: No. I stood vigil for him myself last night. He had no one else.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: He'd never worn this armor before.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BARRISTAN: Bad luck for him ... going against the Mountain.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Who determines the draw?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BARRISTAN: All the knights draw straws, Lord Stark.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Aye ... but who holds the straws? (addressing the body's attendants) You've done good work, sisters.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Both Ned and Barristan exit the tent and walk along the other tents as they talk.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BARRISTAN: Life is strange. Not so many years ago we fought as enemies at the Trident.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: I'm glad we never met on the field, Ser Barristan ... as is my wife. I don't think the widow's life would suit her.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BARRISTAN: (chuckles) You're too modest. I've seen you cut down a dozen great knights.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: My father once told me you were the best he'd ever seen. I never knew the man to be wrong about matters of combat.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BARRISTAN: He was a fine man, your father. What the Mad King did to him was a terrible crime.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: (pointing back to Ser Hugh's tent) And that lad ... he was a squire until a few months ago. How could he afford a new suit of armor?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BARRISTAN: Perhaps Lord Arryn left him some money? I hear the King wants to joust today.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Yes. That will never happen.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BARRISTAN: (chuckles) Robert tends to do what he wants.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: If the King got what he wanted all the time, we'd still be fighting a damned rebellion.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Ned leaves Barristan's side and enters King Robert Baratheon's tent. Inside, Lancel Lannister is attempting to dress King Robert in his armament.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LANCEL: It's made too small, Your Grace. It won't go.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: Your mother was a dumb whore with a fat ass. Did you know that? (addressing Ned) Look at this idiot! One ball and no brains. He can't even put a man's armor on him properly.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: You're too fat for your armor.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: Fat? Fat, is it? Is that how you speak to your King? (King Robert and Ned Laugh. King Robert turns to Lancel who is grinning.)That was funny, is it?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LANCEL: No, Your Grace.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: No? You don't like the Hand's joke?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: You're torturing the poor boy.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: You heard the Hand. The King's too fat for his armor! Go find the breastplate stretcher -- now!
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: the breastplate stretcher?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Ned leaves]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: How long before he figures it out?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Maybe you should have one invented.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: All right, all right. But you watch me out there. I still know how to point a lance.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: You have no business jousting. Leave that for the young men.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: Why? Because I'm king? Piss on that. I want to hit somebody!
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: And who's going to hit you back?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: Anybody who can. And the last man in his saddle ... will be you!
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: There's not a man in the Seven Kingdoms would risk hurting you.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: Are you telling me those cowards would let me win?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Aye.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: (pours Ned a drink and offers it to him) Drink.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: I'm not thirsty.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: Drink. Your King commands it. Gods! Too fat for my armor.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Your squire ... a Lannister boy?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: hmm ... a bloody idiot ... but Cersei insisted. I have Jon Arryn to thank for her. "Cersei Lannister will make a good match", he told me. "You'll need her father on your side." I thought being King meant I could do whatever I wanted. Enough of this! Let's go watch 'em ride. At least I can smell someone else's blood. (The king rises and starts to leave the tent.)
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Robert?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: What? (Looking down, King Robert sees his naked fat belly protruding from his jacket) (laughing) Oh! An inspiring sight for the people, eh? Come! Bow before your King! Bow, you sh1ts!
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Cheering crowds line both sides of the jousting track as Ser Gregor Clegane (The Mountain) rides down the lane, stops in front of the King's stand, opens his helmet and bows. A tier down from the King's left, Ned is seated next to his daughter, Sansa Stark. Littlefinger (Petyr Baelish) sits directly behind them.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Where's Arya
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: SANSA: At her dancing lessons. (Sansa looks up the jousting track.) The Knight of the Flowers. (aka Ser Loras Tyrell, who rides up to Sansa and hands her a rose.)
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: SANSA: Thank you, Ser Loras.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [After nodding toward Sansa, Loras exchanges a secretive look with the King's brother, Renly Baratheon, who is seated higher up. Then he rides over and joins his opponent, Gregor in front of the King's stand. Gregor's horse becomes skittish and both men ride off in opposite directions toward the ends of the jousting track.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: SANSA: (grabbing her father's arm) Don't let Ser Gregor hurt him.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Hey.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: SANSA: I can't watch.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: (turned around and speaking to Renly) 100 gold dragons on the Mountain.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: I'll take that bet.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: Now what will I buy with 100 gold dragons? A dozen barrels of Dornish wine? Or a girl from the pleasure houses of Lys?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: Or you could even buy a friend.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: SANSA: (to Ned) He's going to die.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Ser Loras rides well.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [The trumpet sounds and both jousters ride toward one another. Loras' lance breaks upon Gregor's shield and knocks Gregor down to the ground. Renly jumps up laughing and clapping.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: Such a shame, Littlefinger. It would have been so nice for you to have a friend.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: And tell me, Lord Renly, when will you be having your friend? (indicating Loras)
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: (now seated, leans forward, speaking to Ned) Loras knew his mare was in heat. Quite crafty, really.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: SANSA: Ser Loras would never do that! There's no honor in tricks.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: No honor but quite a bit of gold.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Gregor rises from the ground, rips off his helmet and shouts for his sword. Gregor grabs the sword from his squire and with one mighty stroke, severs his horse's head. Shocked, the crowd grows quiet. Then Gregor storms over to Loras, knocks him off of his horse and strikes with his sword. Loras' shield protects him from the blows. Sandor Clegane (The Hound) roars, "Leave him be!" Drawing his own sword, The Hound jumps down from the King's stand and engages his brother, Gregor in a sword fight.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: (rising, shouts) Stop this madness in the name of your King!
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [The Hound drops to his knee and bows his head, while Gregor's blade slices the air where The Hound's head was just seconds ago. Gregor throws down his sword and stomps off through the crowd. Loras approaches Sandor the Hound.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: I owe you my life, Ser.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: SANDOR: I'm no Ser.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Loras grabs Sandor's left hand with his right and raises both in the air to the cheers of a standing ovation.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Catelyn Stark, her men and her prisoner, Tyrion Lannister, take a rest stop along the way to The Vale. One of Stark's men roughly pulls a hooded and tied, Tyrion Lannister from his horse.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CATELYN: Remove his hood.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Stark's man yanks the hood off of Tyrion and pushes him along while, Marillion, a troubadour from The Riverlands, strums his flute and sings until Tyrion comes face-to-face with Catelyn.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: MARILLION: (singing) On that eve, the captive Imp down-wards from his horse did limp, no more would he preen and primp, in garb of red and gold.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: TYRION: This isn't the Kings Road. You said we were riding for Winterfell.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CATELYN: I did ... often and loudly.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: TYRION: Very wise. (Tyrion begins turning in circles, making sure to make eye contact as he speaks.) They'll be out in droves, looking for me in the wrong place. Word's probably gotten to my father by now. He'll be offering a handsome reward. Everyone knows a Lannister always pays his debts. Would you be so good as to untie me?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CATELYN: And why would I do that?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: TYRION: Why not? Am I going to run? The hill tribes would kill me for my boots. Unless a Shadowcat ate me first.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CATELYN: Shadowcats and hill tribes are the least of your concerns.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: TYRION: Ah ... the Eastern Road. We're going to The Vale. You're taking me to your sister's to answer for my imagined crimes. Tell me, Lady Stark. When was the last time you saw your sister?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CATELYN: Five years ago.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: TYRION: She's changed. She was always a bit touched, but now ... you might as well kill me here.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CATELYN: I am not a murderer, Lannister.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: TYRION: Neither am I! I had nothing to do with the attempt on your son's life!
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CATELYN: The dagger found
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: TYRION: What sort of imbecile arms an assassin with his own blade?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RODRIK: Should I gag him?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: TYRION: Why? Am I starting to make sense?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Suddenly, a shot rings out and one of Stark's men falls to the ground. Men, brandishes axes, swords and slinging rocks, swoop in on them from all sides. Rodrik grabs Catelyn and guides her to a safer spot.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RODRIK: My Lady, this way.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Tyrion watches the small intense battle as throats are slit and heads bashed in. He sees Catelyn pull out a small dagger and rushes over to her.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: TYRION: Untie me. If I die, what's the point?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Catelyn cuts Tyrion's bonds. He looks around and makes a dash for a shield. Tyrion grabs the shield and holds it up just in time to avoid a well-aimed rock. He looks back toward Catelyn and sees she's under attack. One of her men rushes to save her, but he is felled by the attacker. Tyrion runs over and batters the attacker with the shield. Once the attacker is down, Tyrion repeatedly drives the shield's edge into the man's face and neck, killing him and saving Catelyn. The fight ends; many are dead. Catelyn stumbles over to Winterfell's Master-at-Arms.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CATELYN: Rodrik?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RODRIK: I'll be fine, My Lady. There's no need to bloody yourself.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Bronn sheaths his sword and walks over to Tyrion.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRONN: Your first? (Tyrion nods.) You need a woman. Nothing like a woman after a fight.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: TYRION: (looking at Catelyn) Well, I'm willing if she is.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Winterfell - Theon Greyjoy is practicing his archery skills. Bran Stark and Maester Luwin are seated at a table behind Theon. Bran is supposed to be studying but he can't keep his eyes off Theon's target practice.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: Bran ... (Maester Luwin taps a pointer on a map of Westeros.)
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: The Iron Islands. Sigil -- a Kraken. Words -- "We do not sow".
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: Lords?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: The Greyjoys.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: THEON: (turns to face Bran) Famed for their skills at archery, navigation and lovemaking.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: And failed rebellions. (Maester Luwin taps again.)
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: Sigil -- a stag. -- a crowned stag now that Robert's King.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: Good.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: Words -- "Ours is the fury". Lords -- the Baratheons.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: mm - hmm.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: The Westerlands -- sigil -- a lion.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: hmm ..
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: Words -- "A Lannister always pays his debts."
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: No. A common saying, but not their official motto.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: Lords -- the Lannisters.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: We're still on their words.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: I don't know them.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: You do know them. Think.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: "Unbowed, unbent, unbroken".
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: That's House Martell.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: "Righteous in wrath".
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: House Hornwood.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: "Family, duty, honor".
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: Those are Tully words ... your mother's. Are we playing a game?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: "Family, duty, honor" ... is that the right order?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: You know it is.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: Family comes first?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: Your mother had to leave Winterfell to protect the family.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: How can she protect the family, if she's not with her family?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: Your mother sat by your bed for three weeks while you slept.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: And then she left!
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: When you were born, I was the one who pulled you from your mother. I placed you in her arms. From that moment until the moment she dies, she will love you. Absolutely. Fiercely.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: Why did she leave?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: I still can't tell you, but she will be home soon.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: Do you know where she is now? Today?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: No, I don't.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: Then how can you promise me she'll be home soon?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: Sometimes I worry you're too smart for your own good.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: I'll never shoot another arrow.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: And where is that written?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: You need legs to work a bow.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: hmm ... If the saddle Lord Tyrion designed actually works, you could learn to shoot a bow from horseback.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRAN: Really?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LUWIN: Dothraki boys learn when they're four years old. Why shouldn't you?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Winterfell - Theon Greyjoy's quarters. Theon and Ros (Theon's favorite local whore) are at the end of having s*x.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: THEON: Shh ... Keep it down. You're not supposed to be inside the castle walls.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Theon moves away and Ros walks over a dresser and sits in front of the mirror.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ROS: I thought you were supposed to be an important person around here.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: THEON: Important enough for the likes of you.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ROS: You're not the only nobleman in my life, you know.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: THEON: Who? the Imp? I'd call him half a nobleman.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ROS: Jealous?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: THEON: Why should I be jealous?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Theon walks over and stands directly behind Ros.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: THEON: Anyone with a few coppers in his pocket can own you for the night. What's a dwarf like down below? I've always wondered.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ROS: Might surprise you.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: THEON: hmm?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ROS: He's good with his fingers too. And his tongue.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: THEON: (grabs the necklace around Ros's neck) Generous tipper. I guess gold is cheap for a Lannister.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ROS: You are jealous.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: THEON: I'm a Greyjoy. We've been Lords of the Iron Islands for 300 years. There's not a family in Westeros that can look down on us, not even the Lannisters.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [King's Landing -- Arya Stark chases a cat along the castle hallways.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ARYA: Come on. I'm not gonna hurt you.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [King's Landing -- Chambers of the Hand of the King -- Ned Stark is seated at his desk and listens to Lord Varys as he walks around securing the windows and doors before sitting down for a private conversation.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: How is your son, My Lord?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: He'll never walk again.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: But his mind is sound?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: So they say.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: A blessing then. I suffered an early mutilation myself. Some doors close forever ... others open in the most unexpected places. May I? (Varys indicates a chair and with a nod from Ned, sits down.)
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: If the wrong ears heard what I'm about to tell you, off comes my head. And who would mourn poor Varys then? North or South, they sing no songs for spiders. But there are things you must know. You are the King's Hand and the King is a fool ... your friend, I know, but a fool ... and doomed unless you save him.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: I've been in the capital a month. Why have you waited so long to tell me this?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: I didn't trust you.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: So why do you trust me now?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: The Queen is not the only one who has been watching you closely. There are few men of honor in the capital. You are one of them. I would like to believe I am another, strange as that may seem.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: What sort of doom does the King face?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: The same sort as Jon Arryn. The tears of Lys, they call it. A rare and costly thing, as clear and tasteless as water. It leaves no trace.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Ned quickly rises, turns his back to Varys and walks over to the open-air entrance to the balcony.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Who gave it to him?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: Some dear friend, no doubt. But which one? There were many. Lord Arryn was a kind and trusting man. There was one boy ... all he was he owed to Jon Arryn.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: (turning to look at Vayrs) The squire, Ser Hugh?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: Pity what happened to him, just when his life seemed to be going so nicely.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: If Ser Hugh poisoned him, who paid Ser Hugh?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: Someone who could afford it.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Ned walks back to his desk and places his hands on the chair back.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Jon was a man of peace. He was Hand for 17 years -- 17 good years. Why kill him?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: He started asking questions.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [King's Landing -- Arya Stark chases the cat through the dungeons of the Red Keep. She stops suddenly and stares at a statue of a huge dragon's skull. As she explores, she hears two men approach. Quickly, she hides within the dragon's open jaws and listens. The men are Lord Varys and Magister Illyrio Mopatis.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: He's found one b*st*rd already. He has the book. The rest will come.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ILLYRIO: And when he knows the truth, what will he do?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: The gods alone know. The fools tried to kill his son. What's worse -- they botched it. (Varys closes and locks the corridor gate.) The wolf and the lion will be at each other's throats. We will be at war soon, my friend.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ILLYRIO: What good is war now? We're not ready. If one Hand can die, why not a second?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: This Hand is not the other.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ILLYRIO: We need time. Khal Drogo will not make his move until his son is born. You know how these savages are.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: "Delay," you say. "Move fast, " I reply. This is no longer a game for two players.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ILLYRIO: It never was.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Arya watches as the men leave. She emerges from the dragon's jaws and runs to the gate, only to find it locked. She runs off in another direction.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [King's Landing -- The Throne Room -- Littlefinger stands staring up at the Iron Throne when Lord Varys enters the room.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: The first to arrive and the last to leave. I admire your industry.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: You do move quietly.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: We all have our qualities.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: You look a bit lonely today. You should pay a visit to my brothel this evening. First boy is on the house.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: I think you're mistaking business with pleasure.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: Am I? All those birds that whisper in your ear ... such pretty little things. Trust me, we accommodate all inclinations.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: Oh, I'm sure. Lord Redwyne likes his boys very young, I hear.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: I'm a purveyor of beauty and discretion -- both equally important.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: Though I suppose beauty is a subjective quality, no? Is it true that Ser Marlon of Tumblestone prefers amputees?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: All desires are valid to a man with a full purse.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: And I heard the most awful rumor about a certain lord with a taste for fresh cadavers. Must be enormously difficult to accommodate that inclination. The logistics alone ... to find beautiful corpses before they rot.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: Strictly speaking, such a thing would not be in accordance with the King's laws.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: Strictly speaking.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: Tell me. Does someone, somewhere, keep your balls in a little box? I've often wondered.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: Do you know, I have no idea where they are? And we had been so close. But enough about me. How have you been since we last saw each other?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: Since you last saw me or since I last saw you?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: Now the last time I saw you, you were talking to the Hand of the King.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: Saw me with your own eyes?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: Eyes I own.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: Council business. We all have so much to discuss with Ned Stark.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: Everyone's well aware of your enduring fondness for Lord Stark's wife. If the Lannisters were behind the attempt on the Stark boy's life and it was discovered that you helped the Starks come to that conclusion ... To think a simple word to the Queen ...
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: One shudders at the thought.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: Ooh. (shudders)
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: But you know something? I do believe that I have seen you even more recently than you have seen me.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: Have you?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: Yes. Earlier today, I distinctly recall seeing you talking to Lord Stark in his chambers.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: Was that you under the bed?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: And not long after that when I saw you escorting a certain foreign dignitary ... Council business? Of course you would have friends from across The Narrow Sea. You're from there yourself, after all. We're friends, aren't we, Lord Varys? I'd like to think we are. So you can imagine my burden, wondering if the King might question my friend's sympathies -- to stand at a crossroads where turning left means loyalty to a friend, turning right -- loyalty to the realm.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: Oh, please.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: To find myself in a position where a simple word to the King --
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Renly Baratheon, brother to King Robert, barges into the throne room, and speaks as he cuts across the room to another doorway on the other side.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: What are you two conspiring about? Well, whatever it is, you'd best hurry up. My brother is coming. (exits)
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: To a small council meeting?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VAYRS: Disturbing news from far away. Haven't you heard?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [King's Landing --Arya emerges from a tunnel outside the castle walls. She makes her way to the entrance of the castle, but is stopped by two guards.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: GUARD1: Off with you. No begging.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ARYA: I'm not a beggar. I live here.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: GUARD1: D'you want a smack on your ear to help you with your hearing?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ARYA: I want to see my father.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: GUARD2: I want to f*ck the Queen, for all the good it does me.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: GUARD1: You want your father, boy? He's lying on the floor of some tavern, getting pissed on by his friends.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ARYA: My father is Hand of the King! I'm not a boy. I'm Arya Stark of Winterfell and if you lay a hand on me, my father will have both your heads on spikes! Now are you going to let me by or do I need to smack you on the ear to help with your hearing?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [King's Landing -- Hand of the King (Ned Stark) Chambers]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: You know I had half my guard out searching for you? You promised me this would stop.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ARYA: They said they were going to kill you.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Who did?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ARYA: I didn't see them, but I think one was fat.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Oh, Arya.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ARYA: I'm not lying! They said you found the b*st*rd and the wolves are fighting the lions and the savage ... something about the savage.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Where did you hear this?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ARYA: In the dungeons, near the dragon skulls.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: What were you doing in the dungeons?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ARYA: Chasing a cat.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: JORY: (guard knocks, then enters) Pardon, My Lord. There's a Night's Watchman here begging a word. He says it's urgent. (Ned nods, the visitor enters.)
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Your name, friend?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: YOREN: Yoren, if it please. This must be your son. He has the look.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ARYA: I'm a girl!
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Did Benjen send you?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: YOREN: No one sent me, My Lord. I'm here to find men for The Wall, see if there's any scum in the dungeons that might be fit for service.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Ah, we'll find recruits for you.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: YOREN: Thank you, My Lord. But that's not why I disturb you now. Your brother, Benjen ... his blood runs black -- makes him as much my brother as yours. It's for his sake I rode here so hard I damn near killed my horse! There are others riding too. The whole city will know by tomorrow.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Know what?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: YOREN: Best said in private, My Lord.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: (kisses Arya on the head) Go on. We'll talk more later.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Jory, take her safely to her room.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: JORY: Come along, My Lady. You heard your father.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Jory and Arya exit the chambers and walk down the hall]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ARYA: How many guards does my father have?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: JORY: Here in King's Landing? Fifty.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ARYA: You wouldn't let anyone kill him, would you?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: JORY: No fear on that count, little Lady.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [The Hand of the King's Chambers with door closed.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Well?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: YOREN: It's about your wife, My Lord. She's taken the Imp.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text:
ad=document.getElementById("chitika-ads-1"),ad.getBoundingClientRect().width?adWidth=ad.getBoundingClientRect().width:adWidth=ad.offsetWidth,function(){if(void 0===window.CHITIKA&&(window.CHITIKA={units:[]}),adWidth>=550)var t={publisher:"andjoh",width:550,height:250,sid:"In-Post",color_site_link:"E7CE64",color_text:"ffffff",color_bg:"000033",color_button:"E7CE64",color_button_text:"000033"};else var t={publisher:"andjoh",width:300,height:250,sid:"In-Post",color_site_link:"E7CE64",color_text:"ffffff",color_bg:"000033",color_button:"E7CE64",color_button_text:"000033"};var i=window.CHITIKA.units.length;window.CHITIKA.units.push(t),document.write('
');var e=document.createElement("script");e.type="text/javascript",e.src="//cdn.chitika.net/getads.js";try{document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(e)}catch(o){document.write(e.outerHTML)}}();
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [The Vale -- A short distance from The Eyrie, Catelyn Stark's party is met by a group of armed guards from The Vale.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VARDIS: You're far from home, Lady Stark.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CATELYN: To whom do I speak?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VARDIS: Ser Vardis Egan, Knight of The Vale. Is Lady Arryn expecting your visit?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CATELYN: There was no time to send word.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VARDIS: May I ask, My Lady, why he is with you?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CATELYN: That's why there was no time. He is my prisoner.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VARDIS: He doesn't look like a prisoner.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CATELYN: My sister will decide what he looks like.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VARDIS: Yes, My Lady. She will at that.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [The Eyrie guards turn and head back to the castle. Catelyn Stark's party follows their escorts.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: TYRION: The Eyrie. They say it's impregnable.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: BRONN: Give me 10 good men and some climbing spikes ... I'll impregnate the bitch.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: TYRION: I like you.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [King's Landing -- Castle Courtyard -- The Royal Steward hails Ned Stark as he strides purposefully along a walk.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: STEWARD: Lord Stark, your presence has been requested in the small council chamber. A meeting has been called.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: I need to see the King first -- alone.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: STEWARD: The King is at the small council meeting, My Lord. He has summoned you.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Is it about my wife?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: STEWARD: No, My Lord. I believe it concerns Daenerys Targaryen.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [King's Landing -- The Small Council Chamber -- present are: Ned Stark (who is standing and facing the others seated at the table), King Robert Baratheon, Renly Baratheon, Littlefinger, Lord Varys, Grand Maester Pycelle.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: The whore is pregnant.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: You're speaking of murdering a child.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: I warned you this would happen. Back in the North, I warned you, but you didn't care to hear. Well, hear it now. I want 'em dead, mother and child both -- and that fool, Viserys as well. Is that plain enough for you? I want them both dead.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: you will dishonor yourself forever if you do this.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: Honor?! I've got Seven Kingdoms to rule! One King, Seven Kingdoms. Do you think honor keeps them in line? Do you think it's honor that's keeping the peace? It's fear -- fear and blood.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Then we're no better than the Mad King.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: Careful, Ned. Careful now.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: You want to assassinate a girl ... because the Spider heard a rumor?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VARYS: No rumor, My Lord. The princess is with child.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Based on whose information?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VARYS: Ser Jorah Mormont. He is serving as adviser to the Targaryens.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Mormont? You bring us the whispers of a traitor half a world away and call it fact?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: Jorah Mormont's a slaver, not a traitor. Small difference, I know, to an honorable man.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: He broke the law, betrayed his family, fled our land. We commit murder on the word of this man?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: And if he's right? If she has a son? A Targaryen at the head of a Dothraki army ...What then?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: The Narrow Sea still lies between us. I'll fear the Dothraki the day they teach their horses to run on water.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: Do nothing? That's your wise advice? Do nothing till our enemies are on our shores? You're my council. Counsel! Speak sense to this honorable fool.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: VARYS: I understand your misgivings, My Lord. Truly, I do. It is a terrible thing we must consider, a vile thing. Yet, we who presume to rule must sometimes do vile things for the good of the realm. Should the gods grant Daenerys a son, the realm will bleed.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: PYCELLE: I bear this girl no ill will, but should the Dothraki invade, how many innocents will die? How many towns will burn? Is it not wiser, kinder even, that she should die now so that tens of thousands might live?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: We should have had them both killed years ago.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: When you find yourself in bed with an ugly woman, best close your eyes, get it over with. Cut her throat. Be done with it.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: I followed you into war -- twice -- without doubts, without second thoughts. But I will not follow you now. The Robert I grew up with didn't tremble at the shadow of an unborn child.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: She dies.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: I will have no part in it.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: You're the King's Hand, Lord Stark. You'll do as I command or I'll find me a hand who will.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Ned removes the pin signifying his position as Hand of the King and tosses it onto the table in front of King Robert.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: And good luck to him. I thought you were a better man.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: Out! Out, damn you! I'm done with you. (Ned gives King Robert a slight nod, then turns and leaves.) Go! Run back to Winterfell! I'll have your head on a spike! I'll put it there myself, you fool! You think you're too good for this? Too proud and honorable? This is a war!
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [King's Landing -- Ned Stark's chambers. Ned is quickly packing his belongings when Jory enters his room.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: I'll go ahead with my daughters. Get them ready. Do it yourself. Don't ask anyone for help.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: JORY: Right away, My Lord. Lord Baelish (Littlefinger) is here for you.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: His Grace went on about you at some length after you took your leave. The word "treason" was mentioned.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: What can I do for you?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: When do you return to Winterfell?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Why? What do you care?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: If you're still here come nightfall, I'll take you to see the last person Jon Arryn spoke with before falling ill. If that sort of thing still interests you.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: I don't have the time.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: It won't take more than an hour. But as you please.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Littlefinger turns and walks out into the hall, but he doesn't get very far before Ned grabs his sword and gives Jory some last orders before joining him.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Round up all the men we have and station them outside the girls' chambers. Who are your best two swords?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: JORY: Heward and Wyl.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Find them and meet me at the stables.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [The Eyrie -- The Throne Room -- Lysa Arryn, Catelyn's sister and widow to Jon Arryn, sits high upon her throne. Her son 7 year old son, Robin, still breast feeding, sits on her lap. Catelyn Stark, Tyrion Lannister, Ser Vardis Egan of the Vale and several guards stand in the hall, looking up at Lysa.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LYSA: You bring him here without permission? You pollute my home with his presence? (To Robin) Your aunt has done a bad thing, Robin, a very bad thing. You remember her, don't you? (to Catelyn) Isn't he beautiful? And strong too. Jon knew it. His last words were, "the seed is strong." He wanted everyone to know what a good, strong boy his son would grow up to be. Look at him, the Lord of all the Vale.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CATELYN: Lysa, you wrote me about the Lannisters -- warning me t-
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LYSA: To stay away from them! Not to bring one here!
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ROBIN: Mommy? Is that the bad man?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LYSA: It tis.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ROBIN: He's little.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LYSA: He's Tyrion the Imp of house Lannister. He killed your father. He murdered the Hand of the King!
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: TYRION: Oh? Did I kill him too? I've been a very busy man.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LYSA: You will watch your tongue! These men are knights of the Vale. Every one of the loved John Arryn. Every one of them would die for me.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: TYRION: If any harm comes to me, my brother, Jaime, will see that they do.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ROBIN: (jumping up and shouting) You can't hurt us! No one can hurt us here! Tell him, mommy! Tell him!
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LYSA: Shh ... Shh ... Shh, my sweet boy. (Robin sits back down on his mother's lap.) He's just trying to frighten us. Lannisters are all liars. No one will hurt my baby.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ROBIN: Mommy ... I want to see the bad man fly.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LYSA: Perhaps you will, my little love.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CATELYN: This man is my prisoner. I will not have him harmed.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LYSA: Ser Vardis, my sister's guest is weary. Take him down below so he can rest. Introduce him to Mord.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: ["Down below", Mord throws Tyrion into his cell]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: MORD: (laughing) You go sleep, dwarf man. Sleep good, little dwarf. man!
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Tyrion surveys his three-walled cell. Open sky greets him where the fourth wall should be. The floor slants toward the opening. Tyrion carefully walks over to the edge and looks down at the ground -- far -- far -- far below.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [King's Landing -- Renly Baratheon's Chambers. Renly is seated in a chair and Ser Loras Tyrell (Knight of the Flowers) is kneeling beside him, preparing to shave Renly's chest.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: Lord Stark's lucky he still has a head.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: Robert will rant for a few days, but he won't do anything. He adores the man.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: You're jealous.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: Are you sure this won't hurt?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: Only if I slip.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: And you prefer me like this?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: hm - mmm...
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: If you want hairless, maybe you should find a little boy.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: I want you.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: My brother thinks that anyone who hasn't been to war isn't a man. He treats me as if I'm a spoiled child. Oh, and you're not? Loras Tyrell, the Knight of the Flowers? How many wars have you fought in? Oh, and how much did your father spend on that armor of yours?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: Hold still.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: All I ever hear from Robert and Stannis is how I'm not tough enough, how I squirm at the sight of blood.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: You did vomit when that boy's eye was knocked out in the mêlée.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: His eye was dangling out of the damn socket!
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: He shouldn't have entered the mêlée if he didn't know how to fight.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: Easy for you to say. Not everyone is such a gifted swordsman.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: It's not a gift. No one gave it to me. I'm good because I work at it -- every day of my life since I could hold a stick.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: I could work at fighting all day, every day, and still never be as good as you.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: Yes well, I guess we'll never know.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Loras wipes Renly's chest off and then raises Renly's arm to shave underneath it.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: Everywhere?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: Everywhere. So how did it end up? The Targaryen girl will die?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: It needs to be done, unpleasant as it is. Robert's rather tasteless about it. Every time he talks about killing her, I swear the table rises six inches.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: It's a shame he can't muster the same enthusiasm for his wife.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: He does have a deep, abiding lust for her money. You have to give it to the Lannisters -- they may be the most pompous, ponderous c**ts the gods ever suffered to walk the world, but they do have outrageous amounts of money.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: I have an outrageous amount of money.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: Not as much as the Lannisters.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: But a lot more than you.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: Robert's threatening to take me hunting with him. Last time we were out there for two weeks -- tramping through the trees in the rain, day after day. All so he can stick his spear into something's flesh! Oh. but Robert loves his killing. And he's the King.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: hmm ... How did that ever happen?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: Because he loves his killing and he used to be good at it.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: Do you know who should be King? (Both men exchange looks.)
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: Be serious.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: I am. My father could be your bank. I've never fought in a war before, but I'd fight for you.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: I'm fourth in line.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: And where was Robert in the line of royal succession? Joffrey is a monster. Tommen is eight.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: Stannis?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: Stannis has the personality of a lobster.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: He's still my older brother.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Loras slices a small cut in Renly's side.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: What are you doing?!
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: Look at it.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: RENLY: You cut me!
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: It's just blood. We've all got it in us. Sometimes a little spills. If you become King, you're going to see a lot of this. You need to get used to it. Go on. Look. People love you. They love to serve you because you're kind to them. They want to be near you.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Loras rises and taking Renly by the hand, has him stand up as well.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LORAS: You're willing to do what needs to be done, but you don't gloat over it. You don't love killing. Where is it written that power is the sole province of the worst? That thrones are only made for the hated and the feared. You would be a wonderful King.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Loras kneels down in front of Renly, unfastens Renly's pants and slides them down. After a moment, Renly smiles with pleasure.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [King's Landing -- King Robert's Chambers -- King Robert is seated at his desk, staring pensively at the drink in his hand when Cersei Baratheon enters.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CERSEI: I'm sorry your marriage to Ned Stark didn't work out. You seemed so good together.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: I'm glad I could do something to make you happy.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CERSEI: Without a Hand, everything will fall to pieces.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: I suppose this is where you tell me to give the job to your brother Jaime.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CERSEI: No. He's not serious enough. I'll say this for Ned Stark -- he's serious enough. Was it really worth it? Losing him this way?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: I don't know. But I do know this -- If the Targaryen girl convinces her horse-lord husband to invade and the Dothraki horde crosses The Narrow Sea ... we won't be able to stop them.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CERSEI: The Dothraki don't sail. Every child knows that. They don't have discipline. They don't have armor. They don't have siege weapons.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: It's a neat little trick you do -- you move your lips and your father's voice comes out.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CERSEI: Is my father wrong?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: Let's say Viserys Targaryen lands with forty thousand Dothraki screamers at his back. We hole up in our castles -- a wise move. Only a fool would meet the Dothraki in an open field. They leave us in our castles. They go from town to town, looting and burning, killing every man who can't hide behind a stone wall, stealing all our crops and livestock, enslaving all our women and children. How long do the people of the Seven Kingdoms stand behind their absentee King -- their cowardly King hiding behind high walls? When do the people decide that Viserys Targaryen is the rightful monarch after all.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CERSEI: We still outnumber them.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: Which is the bigger number -- five or one?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CERSEI: Five.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: (holds both hands up in illustration) Five ... one. One army, a real army, united behind one leader with one purpose. Our purpose died with the Mad King. Now we've got as many armies as there are men with gold in their purse. And everybody wants something different. Your father wants to own the world. Ned Stark wants to run away and bury his head in the snow.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CERSEI: What do you want?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: We haven't had a real fight in nine years. Back-stabbing doesn't prepare you for a fight. And that's all the realm is now -- back-stabbing and scheming and arse-licking and money-grubbing. Sometimes I don't know what holds it together.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CERSEI: Our marriage.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [King Robert develops a hearty laugh as Cersei starts laughing as well.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: Ah, so here we sit, seventeen years later, holding it all together. Don't you get tired?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CERSEI: Every day.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: How long can hate hold a thing together?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CERSEI: Well, seventeen years is quite a long time.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: Yes, it is.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CERSEI: Yes, it tis. What was she like?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: You've never asked about her, not once. Why not?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CERSEI: At first, just saying her name, even in private felt like I was breathing life back into her. I thought if I didn't talk about her, she'd just fade away for you. When I realized that wasn't going to happen, I refused to ask out of spite. I didn't want to give you the satisfaction of thinking I cared enough to ask. And eventually it became clear that my spite didn't mean anything to you, as far as I could tell, you actually enjoyed it.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: So why now?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CERSEI: What harm could Lyanna Stark's ghost do to either of us that we haven't done to each other a hundred times over?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: You want to know the horrible truth? I can't even remember what she looked like. I only know she was the one thing I ever wanted ... Someone took her away from me, and Seven Kingdoms couldn't fill the hole she left behind.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CERSEI: I felt something for you once, you know?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: I know.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CERSEI: Even after we lost our first boy -- for quite a while, actually. Was it ever possible for us? Was there ever a time, ever a ... moment?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: KING ROBERT: No. Does that make you feel better or worse?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: CERSEI: It doesn't make me feel anything.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [King's Landing -- Littlefinger's Brothel -- Ned Stark is in a room with Mhaegen, a prostitute and mother of King Robert's illegitimate daughter, who she is holding. In an adjoining room, separated by a curtain of metal hoops, Littlefinger reclines on a sofa between two of his whores. Jory Cassel, Captain of Winterfell's Guard, stands opposite the sofa, next to the curtained doorway.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: MHAEGEN: She looks like him, don't she, My Lord? She has his nose, his black hair.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Aye.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: MHAEGEN: Tell him when you see him, My Lord. If it please you ... tell him how beautiful she is.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: I will.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: MHAEGEN: And tell him I've been with no one else. I swear it, My Lord, by the old gods and new. I don't want no jewels or nothing, just him. The King was always good to me.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: When Jon Arryn came to visit you, what did he want?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: MHAEGEN: He wasn't that sort of man, My Lord. He just wanted to know if the child was happy ... healthy.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: She looks healthy enough to me. The girl shall want for nothing.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Ned leaves the room through the curtain and joins Littlefinger in the adjoining room.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: Brothels make a much better investment than ship, I've found. Whores rarely sink.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: What do you know of King Robert's bastards?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: Well, he has more than you, for a start.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: How many?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: Does it matter? If you f*ck enough women, some of them will give you presents.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: And Jon Arryn tracked them all down. Why?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: He was the King's Hand. Perhaps Robert wanted them looked after. He was overcome with fatherly love.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: (preparing to take his leave - to Jory) Come.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Jory remains transfixed, staring at the whores on the couch as one of them bares her breasts.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: Jory!
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: JORY: (startled out of his trance) My Lord.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Ned and Jory exit the brothel and are joined by a handful of the Stark guard. They are swiftly surrounded by Jaime Lannister's armed guard. Jaime Lannister rides up on horseback to the head of the guard and faces Ned Stark]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: JAIME: Such a small pack of wolves.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: JORY: Stay back, Ser! This is the Hand of the King!
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: JAIME: Was! ... the Hand of the King. Now I'm not sure what he is ... Lord of somewhere very far away.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: (exiting the brothel) What's the meaning of this, Lannister?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: JAIME: Get back inside where it's safe. I'm looking for my brother. You remember my brother, don't you, Lord Stark? Blond hair, sharp tongue, short man.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: I remember him well.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: JAIME: It seems he had some trouble on the road. You wouldn't know what happened to him, would you?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: He was taken at my command to answer for his crimes.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Jaime draws his sword as his men start to move forward. They are stopped when Littlefinger steps up.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: LITTLEFINGER: My Lords! I'll bring the City Watch! (exits)
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: JAIME: Come, Stark. I'd rather you die sword in hand.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: JORY: If you threaten My Lord again --
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: JAIME: Threaten? As in, "I'm going to open your Lord from balls to brains and see what Starks are made of"?
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: NED: You kill me, your brother's a dead man.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: JAIME: You're right. (to his men) Take him alive! Kill his men!
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [A short but fierce fight breaks out between the men. Outnumbered, Stark's men are felled one by one, ending with Jaime driving a dagger into Jory's eye. Ned Stark takes on Jaime while all remaining watch. Their sword fight is brought to an abrupt end when one of Jaime's guards spears the back of Ned's leg, bringing him to his knees. Angry, Jaime approaches the offending guard and knocks him out with one hard blow from the blunt end of his sword. Jaime mounts his horse and addresses Ned Stark.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: JAIME: My brother, Lord Stark ... we want him back.
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [Jaime Lannister rides away as Ned Stark falls to his back on the ground.]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: [END]
name: The Wolf and The Lion

text: Original Air Date on May 22, 2011
name: A Golden Crown

text: Previously~
name: You Win or You Die

text: He's attacked one of my brothers and abducted the other.
name: You Win or You Die

text: Tell your wife to return that little sh1t of an Imp to King's Landing.
name: You Win or You Die

text: What about Jaime Lannister?
name: You Win or You Die

text: I'm half a kingdom in debt to his bloody father.
name: You Win or You Die

text: We'll talk when I return from the hunt.
name: You Win or You Die

text: The hunt?
name: You Win or You Die

text: You'll have to sit on the throne while I'm away.
name: You Win or You Die

text: You are accused of hiring a man to slay my son Bran in his bed.
name: You Win or You Die

text: I demand a trial by combat.
name: You Win or You Die

text: You have that right.
name: You Win or You Die

text: Do I have a volunteer?
name: You Win or You Die

text: I'll stand for the dwarf.
name: You Win or You Die

text: Grand Maester Pycelle. Send a raven to Casterly Rock.
name: You Win or You Die

text: Inform Tywin Lannister that he has been summoned to court to answer for the crimes of Gregor Clegane or be branded an enemy of the Crown
name: You Win or You Die

text: and a traitor to the realm.
name: You Win or You Die

text: Fight!
name: You Win or You Die

text: I'm sending you both back to Winterfell.
name: You Win or You Die

text: What? I'm supposed to marry Prince Joffrey.
name: You Win or You Die

text: He'll be the greatest king that ever was, a golden lion.
name: You Win or You Die

text: And I'll give him sons with beautiful blond hair.
name: You Win or You Die

text: "Lord Orys Baratheon, black of hair."
name: You Win or You Die
