text: I promise you it isn't poisoned.
name: The Pointy End

text: Why is it no one ever trusts the eunuch?
name: The Pointy End

text: Not so much, My Lord.
name: The Pointy End

text: I would save the rest, if I were you.
name: The Pointy End

text: Hide it. Men have been known to die of thirst in these cells.
name: The Pointy End

text: What about my daughters?
name: The Pointy End

text: The younger one seems to have escaped the castle.
name: The Pointy End

text: Even my little birds cannot find her.
name: The Pointy End

text: And Sansa?
name: The Pointy End

text: Still engaged to Joffrey.
name: The Pointy End

text: Cersei will keep her close. The rest of your household though ... all dead, it grieves me to say.
name: The Pointy End

text: I do so hate the sight of blood.
name: The Pointy End

text: You watched my men being slaughtered and did nothing.
name: The Pointy End

text: And would again, My Lord.
name: The Pointy End

text: I was unarmed, unarmored and surrounded by Lannister swords.
name: The Pointy End

text: When you look at me do you see a hero?
name: The Pointy End

text: What madness led you to tell the Queen you had learned the truth about Joffrey's birth?
name: The Pointy End

text: The madness of mercy.
name: The Pointy End

text: That she might save her children.
name: The Pointy End

text: Ah, the children.
name: The Pointy End

text: It is always the innocents who suffer.
name: The Pointy End

text: It wasn't the wine that killed Robert, nor the boar.
name: The Pointy End

text: The wine slowed him down and the boar ripped him open, but it was your mercy that killed the King.
name: The Pointy End

text: I trust you know you are a dead man, Lord Eddard?
name: The Pointy End

text: The Queen can't kill me.
name: The Pointy End

text: Cat holds her brother.
name: The Pointy End

text: The wrong brother sadly.
name: The Pointy End

text: And lost to her.
name: The Pointy End

text: Your wife has let the Imp slip through her fingers.
name: The Pointy End

text: If that's true, then slit my throat and be done with it.
name: The Pointy End

text: Not today, My Lord.
name: The Pointy End

text: Tell me something, Varys.
name: The Pointy End

text: Who do you truly serve?
name: The Pointy End

text: The Realm, My Lord.
name: The Pointy End

text: Someone must.
name: The Pointy End

text: It's Othor, without a doubt.
name: The Pointy End

text: The other one is Jafer Flowers, My Lord,
name: The Pointy End

text: less the hand
name: The Pointy End

text: the wolf tore off.
name: The Pointy End

text: Any sign of Benjen or the rest of his party?
name: The Pointy End

text: Just these two, My Lord.
name: The Pointy End

text: Been dead awhile, I'd say.
name: The Pointy End

text: Mmm.
name: The Pointy End

text: The smell.
name: The Pointy End

text: What smell?
name: The Pointy End

text: There is none.
name: The Pointy End

text: If they'd be dead for a long time, wouldn't there be rot?
name: The Pointy End

text: We should burn them.
name: The Pointy End

text: Snow's not wrong, My Lord. Fire will do for them.
name: The Pointy End

text: The Wildling way.
name: The Pointy End

text: I want Maester Aemon to examine them first.
name: The Pointy End

text: You may be a coward, Tarly,
name: The Pointy End

text: but you're not stupid.
name: The Pointy End

text: Get them inside.
name: The Pointy End

text: You heard him.
name: The Pointy End

text: Lord Commander, Maester Aemon awaits you in his chambers ... a raven from King's Landing.
name: The Pointy End

text: Come on, move 'em out.
name: The Pointy End

text: Bring me a horn of ale, Snow,
name: The Pointy End

text: and pour one
name: The Pointy End

text: for yourself.
name: The Pointy End

text: The King is dead.
name: The Pointy End

text: Is there any word of my father?
name: The Pointy End

text: Sit.
name: The Pointy End

text: Lord Stark has been charged with treason.
name: The Pointy End

text: They say he conspired with Robert's brothers to deny the throne to Prince Joffrey.
name: The Pointy End

text: I hope you're not thinking
name: The Pointy End

text: of doing anything stupid.
name: The Pointy End

text: Your duty lies here now.
name: The Pointy End

text: My sisters were in King's Landing too.
name: The Pointy End

text: I'm sure they'll be treated gently.
name: The Pointy End

text: Your father has proved to be an awful traitor, dear.
name: The Pointy End

text: King Robert's body was still warm when Lord Eddard began plotting to steal Joffrey's rightful throne.
name: The Pointy End

text: He wouldn't do that.
name: The Pointy End

text: He knows how much I love Joffrey. He wouldn't.
name: The Pointy End

text: Please, Your Grace, there's been a mistake.
name: The Pointy End

text: Send for my father. He'll tell you ... the King was his friend.
name: The Pointy End

text: Sansa sweetling, you are innocent of any wrong. We know that.
name: The Pointy End

text: Yet you are the daughter
name: The Pointy End

text: of a traitor.
name: The Pointy End

text: How can I allow you to marry my son?
name: The Pointy End

text: A child born
name: The Pointy End

text: of a traitor's seed is no fit consort for our King.
name: The Pointy End

text: She is a sweet thing now,
name: The Pointy End

text: Your Grace, but in 10 years who knows what treasons she may hatch?
name: The Pointy End

text: No, I'm not. I'll be a good wife to him, you'll see.
name: The Pointy End

text: I'll be a Queen just like you, I promise. I won't hatch anything.
name: The Pointy End

text: The girl is innocent, Your Grace.
name: The Pointy End

text: She should be given a chance to prove her loyalty.
name: The Pointy End

text: Little dove, you must write to Lady Catelyn and your brother, the eldest, what's his name?
name: The Pointy End

text: Robb.
name: The Pointy End

text: Word of your father's arrest will reach him soon, no doubt.
name: The Pointy End

text: Best it comes from you.
name: The Pointy End

text: If you would help your father, urge your brother to keep the King's peace.
name: The Pointy End

text: Tell him to come to King's Landing and swear his fealty to Joffrey.
name: The Pointy End

text: If ... if I could see my father, talk to him about ...
name: The Pointy End

text: You disappoint me, child.
name: The Pointy End

text: We have told you of your father's treason.
name: The Pointy End

text: Why would you want to speak to a traitor?
name: The Pointy End

text: I only meant that ... what will happen to him?
name: The Pointy End

text: That depends.
name: The Pointy End

text: On ... on what?
name: The Pointy End

text: On your brother.
name: The Pointy End

text: And on you.
name: The Pointy End

text: Treason?
name: The Pointy End

text: Sansa wrote this?
name: The Pointy End

text: It is your sister's hand, but the Queen's words.
name: The Pointy End

text: You are summoned to King's Landing to swear fealty to the new King.
name: The Pointy End

text: Joffrey puts my father in chains, now he wants his ass kissed?
name: The Pointy End

text: This is a royal command, My Lord.
name: The Pointy End

text: If you should refuse to obey ...
name: The Pointy End

text: I won't refuse.
name: The Pointy End

text: His Grace summons me to King's Landing, I'll go to King's Landing.
name: The Pointy End

text: But not alone.
name: The Pointy End

text: Call the banners.
name: The Pointy End

text: All of them, My Lord?
name: The Pointy End

text: They've all sworn to defend my father, have they not?
name: The Pointy End

text: They have.
name: The Pointy End

text: Now we see what their words are worth.
name: The Pointy End

text: Yeah.
name: The Pointy End

text: Are you afraid?
name: The Pointy End

text: I must be.
name: The Pointy End

text: Good.
name: The Pointy End

text: Why is that good?
name: The Pointy End

text: It means you're not stupid.
name: The Pointy End

text: You've had this since dawn?
name: The Pointy End

text: He sent it to me, not you.
name: The Pointy End

text: I've only shown it to you as a courtesy.
name: The Pointy End

text: A courtesy?!
name: The Pointy End

text: My husband has been taken prisoner.
name: The Pointy End

text: My son intends to declare war.
name: The Pointy End

text: A war?
name: The Pointy End

text: Your son against the Lannisters?
name: The Pointy End

text: You should go to him. Teach him patience.
name: The Pointy End

text: Ned rots in a dungeon and you speak of patience?
name: The Pointy End

text: He is your brother by law!
name: The Pointy End

text: Does family mean nothing to you?
name: The Pointy End

text: Family means everything to me.
name: The Pointy End

text: And I will not risk Robin's life to get caught up in another of your husband's wars.
name: The Pointy End

text: I'm hungry.
name: The Pointy End

text: Hush now, darling.
name: The Pointy End

text: You just ate.
name: The Pointy End

text: You will not support us then? Do I understand you correctly?
name: The Pointy End

text: But I'm hungry!
name: The Pointy End

text: Soon, love, soon.
name: The Pointy End

text: You're always welcome here, sister.
name: The Pointy End

text: But if you're asking me to send men from the Vale to fight ...
name: The Pointy End

text: That is what I ask.
name: The Pointy End

text: Go on, sweet. Time for your bath.
name: The Pointy End

text: I'll feed you after.
name: The Pointy End

text: If you fear for the safety of your son ...
name: The Pointy End

text: Of course I fear for the safety of my son!
name: The Pointy End

text: Are you an idiot?
name: The Pointy End

text: They killed my husband.
name: The Pointy End

text: You say they shoved
name: The Pointy End

text: your boy from a window.
name: The Pointy End

text: These people will do anything.
name: The Pointy End

text: And that is why we have to stop them.
name: The Pointy End

text: The knights of the Vale will stay in the Vale where they belong, to protect their Lord.
name: The Pointy End

text: Will you shut up?
name: The Pointy End

text: There's hill tribes all around here.
name: The Pointy End

text: If I'm going to die, it may as well be with a song in my heart.
name: The Pointy End

text: I should just take your food and leave you here.
name: The Pointy End

text: Eh? What would you do then?
name: The Pointy End

text: Starve, most likely.
name: The Pointy End

text: You don't think I'd do it, do you?
name: The Pointy End

text: What do you want, Bronn? Gold? Women?
name: The Pointy End

text: Golden women?
name: The Pointy End

text: Stick with me and you'll have them all, for as long as I'm around and not for a moment longer.
name: The Pointy End

text: But you knew that.
name: The Pointy End

text: That is why you so valiantly took up arms to defend my honor.
name: The Pointy End

text: Fair enough.
name: The Pointy End

text: But don't go looking for me to bend the knee and "My Lord" you every time you take a sh1t.
name: The Pointy End

text: I'm not your toady and I'm not your friend.
name: The Pointy End

text: Though I would treasure your friendship, I'm mainly interested in your facility with murder.
name: The Pointy End

text: And if the day ever comes when you're tempted to sell me out, remember this:
name: The Pointy End

text: Whatever their price, I'll beat it.
name: The Pointy End

text: I like living.
name: The Pointy End

text: Tyrion.
name: The Pointy End

text: Tyrion.
name: The Pointy End

text: Tyrion.
name: The Pointy End

text: Come, share our fire.
name: The Pointy End

text: Help yourselves to our goat.
name: The Pointy End

text: When you meet your Gods, you tell them Shagga Son of Dolf of the Stone Crows sent you.
name: The Pointy End

text: I am Tyrion son of Tywin of Clan Lannister.
name: The Pointy End

text: How would you like to die, Tyrion son of Tywin?
name: The Pointy End

text: In my own bed, at the age of 80 with a bellyful of wine and a girl's mouth around my cock.
name: The Pointy End

text: Take the half man.
name: The Pointy End

text: He can dance for the children. Kill the other one.
name: The Pointy End

text: No no no no no!
name: The Pointy End

text: My ... my House is rich and powerful.
name: The Pointy End

text: If you see us through these mountains, my father will shower you with gold.
name: The Pointy End

text: We have no use for a half man's promises.
name: The Pointy End

text: Half a man maybe, but at least I have the courage to face my enemies.
name: The Pointy End

text: What do the Stone Crows do?
name: The Pointy End

text: Hide behind rocks and shiver when the knights of the Vale ride by?
name: The Pointy End

text: Are those the best weapons you could steal?
name: The Pointy End

text: Good enough for killing sheep, if the sheep don't fight back.
name: The Pointy End

text: Lannister smiths sh1t better steel.
name: The Pointy End

text: You think you can win us over with your trinkets?
name: The Pointy End

text: That trinket is worth more than everything your tribe owns.
name: The Pointy End

text: But if you help us, Shagga Son of Dolf, I will not give you trinkets.
name: The Pointy End

text: I will give you this.
name: The Pointy End

text: What is "this"?
name: The Pointy End

text: The Vale of Arryn.
name: The Pointy End

text: The Lords of the Vale have always spat upon the hill tribes.
name: The Pointy End

text: The Lords of the Vale want me dead.
name: The Pointy End

text: I believe it is time for new Lords of the Vale.
name: The Pointy End

text: Ser Alliser:
name: The Pointy End

text: Now there's a rare sight ...  not only a b*st*rd, but a traitor's b*st*rd.
name: The Pointy End

text: Jon, no!
name: The Pointy End

text: Jon, stop, put it down!
name: The Pointy End

text: Blood will always tell.
name: The Pointy End

text: You'll hang for this, b*st*rd.
name: The Pointy End

text: I told you not to do anything stupid.
name: The Pointy End

text: You're confined to quarters. Go.
name: The Pointy End

text: Ghost, what's wrong?
name: The Pointy End

text: Is something out there?
name: The Pointy End

text: Commander?
name: The Pointy End

text: Stay.
name: The Pointy End

text: Hello?
name: The Pointy End

text: Who's there?
name: The Pointy End

text: Lord Commander?
name: The Pointy End

text: Snow?
name: The Pointy End

text: Commander!
name: The Pointy End

text: Move move!
name: The Pointy End

text: What did they do?
name: The Pointy End

text: I thought the Dothraki didn't believe in money.
name: The Pointy End

text: Gold to hire ships, Princess, ships to sail to Westeros.
name: The Pointy End

text: Jorah, make them stop.
name: The Pointy End

text: Khaleesi?
name: The Pointy End

text: You heard me.
name: The Pointy End

text: These men have shed blood for their Khal. Now they claim their rewards.
name: The Pointy End

text: Princess, you have a gentle heart,
name: The Pointy End

text: but this is how
name: The Pointy End

text: it's always been.
name: The Pointy End

text: I do not have a gentle heart, Ser.
name: The Pointy End

text: Kash qoy qoyi thira disse.
name: The Pointy End

text: Me qorasokh anni!
name: The Pointy End

text: Come.
name: The Pointy End

text: Man: Anha afichak mae m'arakhoon!
name: The Pointy End

text: What do you want done with them?
name: The Pointy End

text: Bring her to me. And those women there.
name: The Pointy End

text: You cannot claim them all, Princess.
name: The Pointy End

text: I can, and I will.
name: The Pointy End

text: Me Fati!
name: The Pointy End

text: Khaleesi vazha anhaan qorasokh anni, ch'anha afichak mae m'arakhoon anni!
name: The Pointy End

text: Me vastoe hatif anni;
name: The Pointy End

text: ahhazaan
name: The Pointy End

text: yer Nemo vacchaki.
name: The Pointy End

text: Ohos.
name: The Pointy End

text: Os.
name: The Pointy End

text: Thank you, silver lady.
name: The Pointy End

text: Who are you?
name: The Pointy End

text: I am named Mirri Maz Duur. I was the Godswife of this Temple.
name: The Pointy End

text: My mother was Godswife here before me.
name: The Pointy End

text: She taught me how to make healing smokes and ointments.
name: The Pointy End

text: All men are of one flock,
name: The Pointy End

text: so my people believe.
name: The Pointy End

text: The Great Shepherd sent me to Earth to heal his ... lamb or lion, his wound must be washed and sewn
name: The Pointy End

text: or it will fester.
name: The Pointy End

text: For 30 years I've been making corpses out of men, boy.
name: The Pointy End

text: I'm the man you want leading the Vanguard.
name: The Pointy End

text: Galbart Glover will lead the Van.
name: The Pointy End

text: The bloody Wall will melt before an Umber marches behind a Glover.
name: The Pointy End

text: I will lead the Van or I will take my men and march them home.
name: The Pointy End

text: You are welcome to do so, Lord Umber.
name: The Pointy End

text: And when I am done with the Lannisters I will march back North, root you out of your Keep and hang you for an oathbreaker.
name: The Pointy End

text: Oathbreaker, is it?!
name: The Pointy End

text: I'll not sit here and swallow insults from a boy so green he pisses grass.
name: The Pointy End

text: My Lord father taught me it was death to bare steel against your Liege Lord. But doubtless the Greatjon only meant to cut my meat for me.
name: The Pointy End

text: Your meat... is bloody tough.
name: The Pointy End

name: The Pointy End

text: What is it? What's happened?
name: The Pointy End

text: Shh, it's all right.
name: The Pointy End

text: Where are you going?
name: The Pointy End

text: South. For father.
name: The Pointy End

text: But it's the middle of the night.
name: The Pointy End

text: The Lannisters have spies everywhere.
name: The Pointy End

text: I don't want them to know we're coming.
name: The Pointy End

text: They have more men than we do.
name: The Pointy End

text: Aye, they do.
name: The Pointy End

text: Can't I come with you?
name: The Pointy End

text: I can ride now. You've seen me riding.
name: The Pointy End

text: And I won't get in the way, I ...
name: The Pointy End

text: There must always be a Stark at Winterfell.
name: The Pointy End

text: Until I return that will be you.
name: The Pointy End

text: You are not to leave the castle walls while we are gone. Do you understand?
name: The Pointy End

text: Listen to Maester Luwin. Look after your little brother.
name: The Pointy End

text: I will.
name: The Pointy End

text: I'll send letters whenever I can, but if you don't hear from me, don't be scared.
name: The Pointy End

text: Until I return.
name: The Pointy End

text: How long have you been hiding out there?
name: The Pointy End

text: Robb will be looking for you to say goodbye.
name: The Pointy End

text: They've all gone away.
name: The Pointy End

text: They'll be back soon. Robb will free father and they'll come back with mother.
name: The Pointy End

text: No, they won't.
name: The Pointy End

text: Please watch
name: The Pointy End

text: over Robb.
name: The Pointy End

text: And watch over all the other men from Winterfell.
name: The Pointy End

text: And Theon too, I suppose.
name: The Pointy End

text: You hear them, boy?
name: The Pointy End

text: The Old Gods are answering you.
name: The Pointy End

text: What are you doing here?
name: The Pointy End

text: They're my Gods too.
name: The Pointy End

text: Beyond the Wall, they're the only Gods.
name: The Pointy End

text: Even slaves are allowed to pray.
name: The Pointy End

text: You're not a slave.
name: The Pointy End

text: Well, your friend did put a knife to my throat.
name: The Pointy End

text: I'm not complaining, Little Lord, just telling truths.
name: The Pointy End

text: What did you mean about hearing the Gods?
name: The Pointy End

text: You asked them, they're answering you.
name: The Pointy End

text: Shh.
name: The Pointy End

text: Open your ears.
name: The Pointy End

text: It's only the wind.
name: The Pointy End

text: Who do you think sends the wind if not the Gods?
name: The Pointy End

text: They see you, boy.
name: The Pointy End

text: They hear you.
name: The Pointy End

text: Your brother will get no help from them where he's going.
name: The Pointy End

text: The Old Gods have no power in the South.
name: The Pointy End

text: The Weirwoods there were all cut down a long time ago.
name: The Pointy End

text: How can they watch when they have no eyes?
name: The Pointy End

text: Well, there's a big man.
name: The Pointy End

text: He has giants' blood in him or I'm the Queen.
name: The Pointy End

text: Go back and find your clothes, Hodor.
name: The Pointy End

text: Go dress.
name: The Pointy End

text: Hodor.
name: The Pointy End

text: Are there really giants beyond the Wall?
name: The Pointy End

text: Giants and worse than giants.
name: The Pointy End

text: I tried telling your brother, he's marching the wrong way.
name: The Pointy End

text: All these swords, they should be going North, boy.
name: The Pointy End

text: North, not south!
name: The Pointy End

text: The cold winds are rising.
name: The Pointy End

text: They were touched by White Walkers.
name: The Pointy End

text: That's why they came back.
name: The Pointy End

text: That's why their eyes turned blue.
name: The Pointy End

text: Only fire will stop them.
name: The Pointy End

text: How do you know that?
name: The Pointy End

text: I read about it in a book ... a very old book in Maester Aemon's library.
name: The Pointy End

text: What else did the book say?
name: The Pointy End

text: The White Walkers sleep beneath the ice for thousands of years.
name: The Pointy End

text: And when they wake up ...
name: The Pointy End

text: And when they wake up, what?
name: The Pointy End

text: I hope The Wall is high enough.
name: The Pointy End

text: Summer snows, My Lady.
name: The Pointy End

text: Robb's brought the North with him.
name: The Pointy End

text: The River Lords are falling back with Jaime Lannister at their heels.
name: The Pointy End

text: And Lord Tywin is bringing around a second Lannister army from the South.
name: The Pointy End

text: Our scouts confirm it's even larger than the Kingslayer's.
name: The Pointy End

text: One army or two, the Kings in the North threw back hosts
name: The Pointy End

text: 10 times as large.
name: The Pointy End

text: Mother!
name: The Pointy End

text: You look well.
name: The Pointy End

text: Lady Catelyn, you're a welcome sight in these troubled times.
name: The Pointy End

text: The Mormonts have carried it for five centuries.
name: Baelor

text: It was meant for my son Jorah.
name: Baelor

text: He brought dishonor to our House, but he had the grace to leave the sword before he fled from Westeros.
name: Baelor

text: My Lord, you honor me, but I can't ...
name: Baelor

text: Oh, you can and you will.
name: Baelor

text: I wouldn't be standing here if it wasn't for you and your beast.
name: Baelor

text: A bloody dead man tried to kill me...
name: Baelor

text: So you'll take it. I'll hear no more about it.
name: Baelor

text: Is that understood?
name: Baelor

text: Yes, My Lord.
name: Baelor

text: Right. Now don't think this means I approve of this nonsense with you and Alliser Thorne.
name: Baelor

text: That's a man's sword, it'll take a man to wield it.
name: Baelor

text: I'll apologize to Ser Alliser tonight.
name: Baelor

text: No you won't!
name: Baelor

text: I sent him to King's Landing yesterday.
name: Baelor

text: The hand that your wolf tore off that thing's wrist ...
name: Baelor

text: I've ordered Thorne to lay it at the feet of this...
name: Baelor

text: Boy King.
name: Baelor

text: That should get young Joffrey's attention.
name: Baelor

text: And it puts a thousand leagues between you and Thorne.
name: Baelor

text: Now go and put your sword somewhere safe and bring me my supper.
name: Baelor

text: Yes, My Lord.
name: Baelor

text: Well done.
name: Baelor

text: Well done.
name: Baelor

text: You earned that, Snow.
name: Baelor

text: Well done.
name: Baelor

text: Go on, let's have a look.
name: Baelor

text: At what?
name: Baelor

text: Grenn: The sword! Show us the sword.
name: Baelor

text: Sword! Sword! Sword! Sword!
name: Baelor

text: Let's have a look.
name: Baelor

text: Piss off.
name: Baelor

text: Get off of it. Piss off.
name: Baelor

text: Come on, I want to have a look at it in the light.
name: Baelor

text: Give it here!
name: Baelor

text: What is it?
name: Baelor

text: Look at its eyes.
name: Baelor

text: Give it.
name: Baelor

text: I can't.
name: Baelor

text: You can't what?
name: Baelor

text: I ... I'm really not supposed to say.
name: Baelor

text: And yet you really want to say.
name: Baelor

text: You want to say that...?
name: Baelor

text: There was a raven.
name: Baelor

text: I read the message to Maester Aemon.
name: Baelor

text: It's your brother Robb.
name: Baelor

text: What?
name: Baelor

text: What about him?
name: Baelor

text: He's heading south.
name: Baelor

text: To war.
name: Baelor

text: All his bannermen have rallied to his side. They'll keep him safe.
name: Baelor

text: I should be there.
name: Baelor

text: I should be with him.
name: Baelor

text: ...If we do that, they'll never get back across.
name: Baelor

text: Well?
name: Baelor

text: What did he say?
name: Baelor

text: Lord Walder has granted your crossing.
name: Baelor

text: His men are yours as well ...
name: Baelor

text: Greatjon: Huh.
name: Baelor

text: ... Less the 400 he will keep here to hold the crossing against any who would pursue you.
name: Baelor

text: And what does he want in return?
name: Baelor

text: You will be taking on his son Olyvar as your personal squire.
name: Baelor

text: He expects a knighthood in good time.
name: Baelor

text: Fine fine.
name: Baelor

text: And?
name: Baelor

text: And Arya will marry his son Waldron
name: Baelor

text: [i]when they both come of age.
name: Baelor

text: ♪ Game of Thrones 01x10 ♪ Fire and Blood Original Air Date on June 19, 2011
name: Fire and Blood

text: Look at me. Look at me!
name: Fire and Blood

text: Do you remember me now, boy, eh?

text: Do you want to live, boy?!

text: North, boy, we're going north.

text: It had three eyes.
name: Fire and Blood

name: Fire and Blood

name: Fire and Blood

name: Fire and Blood

name: Fire and Blood

name: Fire and Blood

text: Here, Shaggydog.

text: You knew what I was buying and you knew the price.
name: Fire and Blood

text: It was wrong of them to burn my temple.
name: Fire and Blood

text: It angered the Great Shepherd.
name: Fire and Blood

text: This is not God's work.
name: Fire and Blood

text: My child was innocent.
name: Fire and Blood

text: Innocent?
name: Fire and Blood

text: He would have been the stallion who mounts the world.
name: Fire and Blood

text: Now he will burn no cities.
name: Fire and Blood

text: Now his Khalasar will trample no nations into dust.
name: Fire and Blood

text: I spoke for you.
name: Fire and Blood

text: I saved you.
name: Fire and Blood

text: Saved me?
name: Fire and Blood

text: Three of those riders had already raped me before you saved me, girl.
name: Fire and Blood

text: I saw my God's house burn, there where I had healed men and women beyond counting.
name: Fire and Blood

text: In the streets I saw piles of heads ... the head of the Baker who makes my bread, the head of a young boy that I had cured of fever just three moons past.
name: Fire and Blood

text: So tell me again exactly what it was that you saved.
name: Fire and Blood

text: Your life.
name: Fire and Blood

text: Hmph.
name: Fire and Blood

text: Why don't you take a look at your Khal...
name: Fire and Blood

text: Then you will see exactly what life is worth when all the rest has gone.
name: Fire and Blood

text: You can't!
name: Fire and Blood

text: Get out of my way, Sam.
name: Fire and Blood

text: They'll put out the word.
name: Fire and Blood

text: They'll send out ravens. People will come after you.
name: Fire and Blood

text: Do you know what happens to deserters?
name: Fire and Blood

text: Better than you do.
name: Fire and Blood

text: What are you going to do?

name: Fire and Blood

name: Fire and Blood

text: When the sun rises in the west and sets in the east...
name: Fire and Blood

text: Then you shall return to me, my sun and stars.
name: Fire and Blood

text: Kings?
name: Fire and Blood

text: Oh, I can tell you all there is to know about Kings.
name: Fire and Blood

text: The thing you need to understand about Kings is...
name: Fire and Blood

text: For the past 67 years, I've known ... truly known more Kings than any man alive.
name: Fire and Blood

text: They're complicated men, but I know how to serve them.
name: Fire and Blood

text: Yes.
name: Fire and Blood

text: And keep on serving them.
name: Fire and Blood

text: Aerys Targaryen... of all the thousand thousand maladies the Gods visit on us, madness is the worst.
name: Fire and Blood

text: He was a good man, such a charmer.
name: Fire and Blood

text: To watch him melt away before my eyes, consumed by dreams of fire and blood...
name: Fire and Blood

text: Robert Baratheon was an entirely different animal ... powerful man, a great warrior ... but alas, winning a Kingdom and ruling a Kingdom are rather different things.
name: Fire and Blood

text: They say that if a man goes through life with his battle visor down, he can often be blind to the enemies at his side.
name: Fire and Blood

text: Now I serve his son King Joffrey, may the Gods bless his reign.
name: Fire and Blood

text: He is a capable young man ... strong military mind.
name: Fire and Blood

text: Stern...
name: Fire and Blood

text: But sternness in defense of the realm is no vice.
name: Fire and Blood

text: It's far too soon to know what manner of King he will be, but I sense true greatness on the horizon for our new King.
name: Fire and Blood

text: True greatness.
name: Fire and Blood

text: So what's the thing?
name: Fire and Blood

text: What thing?
name: Fire and Blood

text: About Kings.
name: Fire and Blood

text: You said, "the thing you need to understand about Kings..."
name: Fire and Blood

text: What? Things? What?
name: Fire and Blood

text: When you started, you ... never mind.
name: Fire and Blood

text: Let me see you out, my dear.
name: Fire and Blood

text: It's all right. No need.
name: Fire and Blood

text: Yes yes.
name: Fire and Blood

text: Till the next time.
name: Fire and Blood

text: Right.
name: Fire and Blood

text: When you imagine yourself up there, how do you look?
name: Fire and Blood

text: Does the crown fit? Do all the lords and ladies simper and bow, the ones who sneered at you for years?
name: Fire and Blood

text: It's hard for them to simper and bow without heads.
name: Fire and Blood

text: A man with great ambition and no morals ...
name: Fire and Blood

text: I wouldn't bet against you.
name: Fire and Blood

text: And what would you do, my friend, if you found yourself sitting up there?
name: Fire and Blood

text: I must be one of the few men in this city who doesn't want to be King.
name: Fire and Blood

text: You must be one of the few men in the city who isn't a man.
name: Fire and Blood

text: Oh, you can do better than that.
name: Fire and Blood

text: When they castrated you, did they take the pillar with the stones?
name: Fire and Blood

name: Fire and Blood

name: Fire and Blood

text: Do you spend a lot of time wondering what's between my legs?
name: Fire and Blood

text: I picture a gash like a woman's. Is that about right?
name: Fire and Blood

text: I am flattered, of course, to be pictured at all.
name: Fire and Blood

text: Must be strange for you, even after all these years ... a man from another land, despised by most, feared by all ... am I? That is good to know.
name: Fire and Blood

text: Do you lie awake at night fearing my gash?
name: Fire and Blood

text: But you carry on, whispering in one King's ear and then the next.
name: Fire and Blood

text: I admire you.
name: Fire and Blood

text: And I admire you, Lord Baelish.
name: Fire and Blood

name: Fire and Blood

text: powerful men ...  and women.
name: Fire and Blood

name: Fire and Blood

name: Fire and Blood

name: Fire and Blood

name: The North Remembers

text: Or do you want to trade gossip like a couple of fishwives?
name: The North Remembers

text: I'm sending one of your cousins down to King's Landing with my peace terms.
name: The North Remembers

text: You think my father's going to negotiate with you?
name: The North Remembers

text: You don't know him very well.
name: The North Remembers

text: No, but he's starting to know me.
name: The North Remembers

text: Three victories don't make you a conqueror.
name: The North Remembers

text: It's better than three defeats.
name: The North Remembers

text: This city stinks...
name: The North Remembers

text: Like dead bodies.
name: The North Remembers

text: A bit corpsey, yes.
name: The North Remembers

text: And sh1t.
name: The North Remembers

text: I thought you wanted to come here.
name: The North Remembers

text: I love it.
name: The North Remembers

text: You love the smell of dead bodies and sh1t?
name: The North Remembers

text: And cum and garlic and rum.
name: The North Remembers

text: You can smell cum from the balcony?
name: The North Remembers

text: I love the stink. I love the noise.
name: The North Remembers

text: Cities make me want to f*ck.
name: The North Remembers

text: And so did the country.
name: The North Remembers

text: This is where I belong.
name: The North Remembers

text: Yes, well, you need to be careful.
name: The North Remembers

text: No one can know you're here.
name: The North Remembers

text: No one will know.
name: The North Remembers

text: You can't trust anyone in King's Landing.
name: The North Remembers

text: They're all liars ...  good liars, bad liars, one or two great liars.
name: The North Remembers

text: What about you?
name: The North Remembers

text: Me? I'm not from here. I'm a slave to the truth.
name: The North Remembers

text: Truth?
name: The North Remembers

text: You are the biggest little liar I have ever met.
name: The North Remembers

text: Why do you think I am so little?
name: The North Remembers

text: I'm being crushed beneath the weight of all that truth.
name: The North Remembers

text: Oh!
name: The North Remembers

text: Ned Stark actually slept on this.
name: The North Remembers

text: As if the poor man didn't suffer enough.
name: The North Remembers

text: One of the many changes we'll have to make around here.
name: The North Remembers

text: Lord Baelish.
name: The North Remembers

text: Your Grace.
name: The North Remembers

text: I wonder if I might ask you for a favor.
name: The North Remembers

text: Of course, Your Grace.
name: The North Remembers

text: Ned Stark's youngest daughter Arya ... we can't seem to locate her.
name: The North Remembers

text: If she's escaped the capital, Winterfell seems the logical destination.
name: The North Remembers

text: And yet my friends in the North report no sign of her.
name: The North Remembers

text: Curious.
name: The North Remembers

text: If we choose to negotiate with the Starks, the girl has some value. Whoever finds her ... well, you know what they say about Lannisters and debts.
name: The North Remembers

text: Well, you could ask Varys where she is.
name: The North Remembers

text: He'll have an answer for you.
name: The North Remembers

text: Whether you believe it...
name: The North Remembers

text: Myself, I have always had a hard time trusting eunuchs.
name: The North Remembers

text: Who knows what they want?
name: The North Remembers

text: A mockingbird.
name: The North Remembers

text: You created your own Sigil, didn't you?
name: The North Remembers

text: Yes.
name: The North Remembers

text: Appropriate... for a self-made man with so many songs to sing.
name: The North Remembers

text: I'm glad you like it.
name: The North Remembers

text: Some people are fortunate enough to be born into the right family.
name: The North Remembers

text: Others have to find their own way.
name: The North Remembers

text: I heard a song once about a boy of modest means who found his way into the home of a very prominent family.
name: The North Remembers

text: He loved the eldest daughter.
name: The North Remembers

text: Sadly, she had eyes for another.
name: The North Remembers

text: When boys and girls live in the same home, awkward situations can arise.
name: The North Remembers

text: Sometimes, I've heard, even brothers and sisters develop certain affections.
name: The North Remembers

text: And when these affections become common knowledge, well, that is an awkward situation indeed, especially in a prominent family.
name: The North Remembers

text: But prominent families often forget a simple truth, I've found.
name: The North Remembers

text: And which truth is that?
name: The North Remembers

text: Knowledge is power.
name: The North Remembers

text: Seize him.
name: The North Remembers

text: Cut his throat.
name: The North Remembers

text: Stop. Wait.
name: The North Remembers

text: I've changed my mind. Let him go.
name: The North Remembers

text: Step back three paces.
name: The North Remembers

text: Turn around.
name: The North Remembers

text: Close your eyes.
name: The North Remembers

text: Power is power.
name: The North Remembers

text: Do see if you can take some time away from your coins and your whores to locate the Stark girl for me.
name: The North Remembers

text: I would very much appreciate it.
name: The North Remembers

text: You're Ser Alton Lannister?
name: The North Remembers

text: I am, Your Grace.
name: The North Remembers

text: I offer your cousins peace if they meet my terms.
name: The North Remembers

text: First, your family must release my sisters.
name: The North Remembers

text: Second, my father's bones must be returned to us so he may rest beside his brother and sister in the crypts beneath Winterfell.
name: The North Remembers

text: And the remains of all those who died in his service must also be returned.
name: The North Remembers

text: Their families can honor them with proper funerals.
name: The North Remembers

text: An honorable request, Your Grace.
name: The North Remembers

text: Third...
name: The North Remembers

text: Joffrey and the Queen Regent must renounce all claim to dominion of the North.
name: The North Remembers

text: From this time till the end of time, we are a free and independent kingdom.
name: The North Remembers

text: The King in the North.
name: The North Remembers

text: King in the North.
name: The North Remembers

text: Neither Joffrey nor any of his men shall set foot in our lands again.
name: The North Remembers

text: If he disregards this command, he shall suffer the same fate as my father, only I don't need a servant to do my beheading for me.
name: The North Remembers

text: These are ... Your Grace, these are ... these are my terms.
name: The North Remembers

text: If the Queen Regent and her son meet them, I'll give them peace.
name: The North Remembers

text: If not...
name: The North Remembers

text: I will litter the south with Lannister dead.
name: The North Remembers

text: King Joffrey is a Baratheon, Your Grace.
name: The North Remembers

text: Oh, is he?
name: The North Remembers

text: You'll ride at daybreak, Ser Alton.
name: The North Remembers

text: That will be all for tonight.
name: The North Remembers

text: A word, Your Grace?
name: The North Remembers

text: You don't have to call me "Your Grace" when no one's around.
name: The North Remembers

text: It's not so bad once you get used to it.
name: The North Remembers

text: I'm glad someone's gotten used to it.
name: The North Remembers

text: The Lannisters are going to reject your terms, you know?
name: The North Remembers

text: Of course they are.
name: The North Remembers

text: We can fight them in the fields as long as you like, but we won't beat them until you take King's Landing.
name: The North Remembers

text: And we can't take King's Landing without ships.
name: The North Remembers

text: My father has ships and men who know how to sail them.
name: The North Remembers

text: Men who fought my father.
name: The North Remembers

text: Men who fought King Robert to free themselves from the yoke of the South, just like you're doing now.
name: The North Remembers

text: I'm his only living son.
name: The North Remembers

text: He'll listen to me. I know he will.
name: The North Remembers

text: I'm not a Stark. I know that.
name: The North Remembers

text: But your father raised me to be an honorable man.
name: The North Remembers

text: We can avenge him together.
name: The North Remembers

text: You don't want Balon Greyjoy for an ally.
name: The North Remembers

text: I need his ships. They say he has 200.
name: The North Remembers

text: They say a million rats live in the sewers of King's Landing.
name: The North Remembers

text: Shall we rally them to fight for us?
name: The North Remembers

text: I understand you don't trust Lord Greyjoy.
name: The North Remembers

text: I don't trust Lord Greyjoy because he is not trustworthy.
name: The North Remembers

text: Your father had to go to war to end his rebellion.
name: The North Remembers

text: Yes. And now I'm the one rebelling against the throne.
name: The North Remembers

text: Before me, it was father.
name: The North Remembers

text: You married one rebel and mothered another.
name: The North Remembers

name: The North Remembers

name: The Night Lands

name: The Night Lands

text: ( Seagulls screeching )
name: The Night Lands

text: ( Chatter )
name: The Night Lands

text: ( Hammers banging )
name: The Night Lands

text: What's she carrying?
name: The Night Lands

text: Myrish oranges, wine from the Arbor...
name: The Night Lands

text: And the heir to Pyke and the Iron Islands.
name: The Night Lands

text: The only living son of Balon Greyjoy.
name: The Night Lands

text: Me.
name: The Night Lands

text: I don't like wine.
name: The Night Lands

text: Woman's drink.
name: The Night Lands

text: I need to get to Pyke.
name: The Night Lands

text: I'll find you a horse.
name: The Night Lands

text: I'm heading that way. I can take you there.
name: The Night Lands

text: I bet you can.
name: The Night Lands

text: Have you been at sea long?
name: The Night Lands

text: Or were there just no women where you came from?
name: The Night Lands

text: None like you.
name: The Night Lands

text: You don't know what I'm like.
name: The Night Lands

text: Maybe you don't know what you're like.
name: The Night Lands

text: Maybe you need someone to teach you.
name: The Night Lands

text: Do you know who I am?
name: The Night Lands

text: You think I offer free rides to every man in jewelry, Lord Greyjoy?
name: The Night Lands

text: Have my things sent up to the castle.
name: The Night Lands

text: You should give me the reins.
name: The Night Lands

text: I'm a better rider than you.
name: The Night Lands

text: I've been on horseback for the past nine years.
name: The Night Lands

text: Nine years?
name: The Night Lands

text: Do you still know your way around a ship?
name: The Night Lands

text: Have these hands ever touched a rope?
name: The Night Lands

text: Don't you worry about my hands.
name: The Night Lands

text: The sea is in my blood.
name: The Night Lands

text: Your blood will be in the sea if I don't watch where I'm going.
name: The Night Lands

text: I have a proposal for my father, one that will make him king again, and me after him.
name: The Night Lands

text: You may get to stay in a castle tonight if you're lucky.
name: The Night Lands

text: Is that an offer from my future king?
name: The Night Lands

text: An order from your future king.
name: The Night Lands

text: You can tell your grandchildren about this night.
name: The Night Lands

text: Woman: I don't imagine it will be a story fit for children.
name: The Night Lands

text: ( Footsteps approaching )
name: The Night Lands

text: Theon: Father.
name: The Night Lands

text: Nine years, is it?
name: The Night Lands

text: They took a frightened boy.
name: The Night Lands

text: What have they given back?
name: The Night Lands

text: A man.
name: The Night Lands

text: Your blood and your heir.
name: The Night Lands

text: We shall see.
name: The Night Lands

text: Stark had you longer than I did.
name: The Night Lands

text: Lord Stark is gone.
name: The Night Lands

text: And how do you feel about that?
name: The Night Lands

text: What's done is done.
name: The Night Lands

text: I've brought you a proposal from Robb Stark.
name: The Night Lands

text: Who gave you those clothes?
name: The Night Lands

text: Was it Ned Stark's pleasure to make you his daughter?
name: The Night Lands

text: If my clothes offend you, I will change them.
name: The Night Lands

text: You will.
name: The Night Lands

text: That bauble
name: The Night Lands

text: 'round your neck ... did you pay the iron price for it or the gold?
name: The Night Lands

text: I asked a question.
name: The Night Lands

text: Did you pull it from the neck of a corpse you made or did you buy it to match your fine clothes?
name: The Night Lands

text: Iron or gold?
name: The Night Lands

text: Gold.
name: The Night Lands

text: I'll not have my son dressed as a whore.
name: The Night Lands

text: ( Necklace clinks )
name: The Night Lands

text: My fears have come true ... the Starks have made you theirs.
name: The Night Lands

text: My blood is salt and iron.
name: The Night Lands

text: Yet the Stark boy sends you to me like a trained raven clutching his message.
name: The Night Lands

text: The offer he makes is one I proposed.
name: The Night Lands

text: He heeds your counsel?
name: The Night Lands

text: I've lived with him, hunted with him, fought at his side.
name: The Night Lands

text: He thinks of me as a brother.
name: The Night Lands

text: No, not here, not in my hearing.
name: The Night Lands

text: You will not name him brother, this son of the man who put your true brothers to the sword.
name: The Night Lands

text: Or have you forgotten your own blood?
name: The Night Lands

text: I forget nothing.
name: The Night Lands

text: I remember my brothers.
name: The Night Lands

text: And I remember when my father was a king.
name: The Night Lands

text: I see.
name: The Night Lands

text: I destroy Robb Stark's enemies for him and he will make me king of the Iron Islands once again.
name: The Night Lands

text: I will lead the attack myself.
name: The Night Lands

text: Oh, you will?
name: The Night Lands

text: I'm your son, your only living heir.
name: The Night Lands

text: Who else?
name: The Night Lands

text: ( Door opens )
name: The Night Lands

text: I told you to wait outside.
name: The Night Lands

text: How did you get past the guards?
name: The Night Lands

text: Anything with a cock is easy to fool.
name: The Night Lands

text: My dear.
name: The Night Lands

text: Yara?
name: The Night Lands

text: So good to see you, brother.
name: The Night Lands

text: This is a homecoming I'll tell my grandchildren about.
name: The Night Lands

text: She can't lead an attack!
name: The Night Lands

text: Balon: And why not?
name: The Night Lands

text: You're a woman!
name: The Night Lands

text: You're the one in skirts.
name: The Night Lands

text: This isn't Winterfell, boy.
name: The Night Lands

text: Your sister took over command of your eldest brother's ship after your new father killed him.
name: The Night Lands

text: All: What's dead may never die.
name: The Night Lands

text: The only nights she's spent off these islands have been spent on the sea.
name: The Night Lands

text: She's commanded men.
name: The Night Lands

text: She's killed men.
name: The Night Lands

text: She knows who she is.
name: The Night Lands

text: No man gives me a crown.
name: The Night Lands

text: I pay the iron price.
name: The Night Lands

text: I will take my crown, for that is who I am.
name: The Night Lands

text: That is who we have always been.
name: The Night Lands

text: You won't stand a chance against the Lannisters on your own.
name: The Night Lands

text: Who said anything about the Lannisters?
name: The Night Lands

text: Davos: You'll have your gold when we take the treasury at King's Landing.
name: The Night Lands

text: Salladhor: All these kings fighting for the throne, and this Stannis has the smallest army.
name: The Night Lands

text: Why would I bet on the man with the worst chance?
name: The Night Lands

text: Because you're a smart gambler.
name: The Night Lands

text: Stannis has proved himself in war twice.
name: The Night Lands

text: His baby brother has never set foot on a battlefield.
name: The Night Lands

text: Neither has the false King Joffrey.
name: The Night Lands

text: And yet they both have larger armies.
name: The Night Lands

text: Stannis has just begun the fight.
name: The Night Lands

text: His Bannermen will rally to his cause.
name: The Night Lands

text: There's no man in the Seven Kingdoms more honorable than Stannis Baratheon or more worthy of loyalty.
name: The Night Lands

text: What is the world coming to when smugglers must vouch for the honor of kings?
name: The Night Lands

text: Mind your words, pirate.
name: The Night Lands

text: Matthos.
name: The Night Lands

text: You think I'm insulted?
name: The Night Lands

text: I am a pirate. I'm an excellent pirate.
name: The Night Lands

text: I don't sail for promises.
name: The Night Lands

text: Of course you do.
name: The Night Lands

text: Every time you leave harbor, you're leaving on a promise ... a promise that somewhere on the sea, somebody's got some gold and you can take it from him.
name: The Night Lands

text: That's a promise that always comes true.
name: The Night Lands

text: As is mine.
name: The Night Lands

text: You're not a young man, Salladhor.
name: The Night Lands

text: And correct me if I'm wrong ... most pirates don't grow old.
name: The Night Lands

text: Only the clever ones.
name: The Night Lands

text: You want to spend your last few years on the sea stealing from Pentoshi cheesemongers and Meereenese silk merchants?
name: The Night Lands

text: Then go. They're out there waiting for you.
name: The Night Lands

text: That's easy.
name: The Night Lands

text: What I'm offering you is hard.
name: The Night Lands

text: Come with me and plunder the greatest city in Westeros.
name: The Night Lands

text: You'll be the richest man in Lys and the most famous.
name: The Night Lands

text: They'll be singing songs about you as long as men have voices to sing.
name: The Night Lands

text: "Salladhor Saan" is a good name for songs.
name: The Night Lands

text: It is.
name: The Night Lands

text: One thing ... I want the queen.
name: The Night Lands

text: The queen?
name: The Night Lands

text: Cersei ... I want her.
name: The Night Lands

text: I'll sail with your fleet, all 30 of my ships.
name: The Night Lands

text: And if we don't drown at the bottom of Blackwater Bay, I will f*ck this blonde queen and I'll f*ck her well.
name: The Night Lands

text: This war isn't about you.
name: The Night Lands

text: We're not attacking King's Landing so that you can rape the queen.
name: The Night Lands

text: I'm not going to rape her. I'm going to f*ck her.
name: The Night Lands

text: As if she would just let you.
name: The Night Lands

text: You don't know how persuasive I am.
name: The Night Lands

text: I've never tried to f*ck you.
name: The Night Lands

text: Stannis is the rightful king and the Lord of Light, the one true God ...
name: The Night Lands

text: ( Groans )
name: The Night Lands

text: I've been all over the world, my boy, and everywhere I go, people tell me about the true Gods.
name: The Night Lands

text: They all think they found the right one.
name: The Night Lands

text: The one true God is what's between a woman's legs, and better yet, a queen's legs.
name: The Night Lands

text: I never thought you'd have a true believer for a son.
name: The Night Lands

text: Eh, he's young yet.
name: The Night Lands

text: I promise you the gold. I promise you the glory.
name: The Night Lands

text: I cannot promise you the queen.
name: The Night Lands

text: You believe your king can win?
name: The Night Lands

text: He is the one true king.
name: The Night Lands

text: You Westerosi are funny people.
name: The Night Lands

text: A man chops off your fingers and you fall in love with him.
name: The Night Lands

text: ( Laughs )
name: The Night Lands

text: I'll sail with you, Davos Seaworth.
name: The Night Lands

text: You're the most honest smuggler I ever met.
name: The Night Lands

text: Make me rich.
name: The Night Lands

text: Get me to the gates of King's Landing and I will.
name: The Night Lands

text: Matthos: When will the king have us sail?
name: The Night Lands

text: As soon as his God wills it.
name: The Night Lands

text: He's my God, too, and yours, but you are too blind to see.
name: The Night Lands

text: Let me teach you how to read.
name: The Night Lands

text: Oh, you and your mother.
name: The Night Lands

text: It won't take long. You already know the letters.
name: The Night Lands

text: The holy books are much more persuasive than I can be.
name: The Night Lands

text: I wish I had a God, truly.
name: The Night Lands

text: I'm not mocking you, but I've seen men pray to every God there is ... pray for wind, pray for rain, pray for home.
name: The Night Lands

text: None of it works.
name: The Night Lands

text: But you always came home.
name: The Night Lands

text: I wasn't praying.
name: The Night Lands

text: No, but I was.
name: The Night Lands

text: Every night that you were at sea, I lit a candle and I prayed for you.
name: The Night Lands

text: You want me to have a God?
name: The Night Lands

text: Fine. King Stannis is my God.
name: The Night Lands

text: He raised me up and blessed me with his trust.
name: The Night Lands

text: He gave you a future I could never have imagined.
name: The Night Lands

text: You know how to read. You'll be a knight someday.
name: The Night Lands

text: You think a fire God commanded all that?
name: The Night Lands

text: It was Stannis, only Stannis.
name: The Night Lands

text: Stannis is my king, but he's only a man.
name: The Night Lands

text: Don't tell him that.
name: The Night Lands

text: ( Laughs )
name: The Night Lands

text: Cersei: Lord Janos Slynt was commander of the City Watch.
name: The Night Lands

text: You had no right to exile him.
name: The Night Lands

text: I have every right. I am the King's Hand.
name: The Night Lands

text: You're serving as the King's Hand till father gets here.
name: The Night Lands

text: I am Queen Regent.
name: The Night Lands

text: Listen to me, Queen Regent.
name: The Night Lands

text: You're losing the people.
name: The Night Lands

text: Do you hear me?
name: The Night Lands

text: ( Laughs ) The people.
name: The Night Lands

text: You think I care?
name: The Night Lands

text: You might find it difficult to rule over millions who want you dead.
name: The Night Lands

text: Half the city will starve when winter comes.
name: The Night Lands

text: The other half will plot to overthrow you.
name: The Night Lands

text: And your gold-plated thugs
name: The Night Lands

text: just gave them their rallying cry ...
name: The Night Lands

text: "The Queen slaughters babies."
name: The Night Lands

text: You don't even have the decency to deny it.
name: The Night Lands

text: It wasn't you who gave the order, was it?
name: The Night Lands

text: Joffrey didn't even tell you.
name: The Night Lands

text: Did he tell you?
name: The Night Lands

text: I imagine that would be even worse.
name: The Night Lands

text: He did what needed to be done.
name: The Night Lands

text: You want to be Hand of the King? You want to rule?
name: The Night Lands

text: This is what ruling is ... lying on a bed of weeds, ripping them out by the root, one by one, before they strangle you in your sleep.
name: The Night Lands

text: I'm no king, but I think there's more to ruling than that.
name: The Night Lands

text: I don't care what you think!
name: The Night Lands

text: You've never taken it seriously.
name: The Night Lands

text: You haven't, Jaime hasn't.
name: The Night Lands

text: It's all fallen on me.
name: The Night Lands

text: As has Jaime repeatedly, according to Stannis Baratheon.
name: The Night Lands

text: You're funny.
name: The Night Lands

text: You've always been funny...
name: The Night Lands

text: But none of your jokes will ever match the first one, will they?
name: The Night Lands

text: You remember?
name: The Night Lands

text: Back when you ripped my mother open on your way out of her and she bled to death?
name: The Night Lands

text: She was my mother, too.
name: The Night Lands

text: Mother gone...
name: The Night Lands

text: For the sake of you.
name: The Night Lands

text: There's no bigger joke in the world than that.
name: The Night Lands

text: ( Waves crashing,
name: The Night Lands

text: seagulls screeching )
name: The Night Lands

text: ( Door opens )
name: The Night Lands

text: Your Grace.
name: The Night Lands

text: Your Grace.
name: The Night Lands

text: Stannis: How did you fare with your pirate?
name: The Night Lands

text: Salladhor Saan will join our fleet ... 30 ships.
name: The Night Lands

text: His men know how to fight.
name: The Night Lands

text: In my experience, pirates prefer fighting unarmed men.
name: The Night Lands

text: It does seem the wiser choice.
name: The Night Lands

text: There won't be a choice this time.
name: The Night Lands

text: Do you trust him?
name: The Night Lands

text: Salladhor Saan is an old friend.
name: The Night Lands

text: I've known him 30 years.
name: The Night Lands

text: I've never trusted him, but once he gets the smell of gold, he never stops.
name: The Night Lands

text: Well, if he does his job, he'll have his share.
name: The Night Lands

text: Leave us.
name: The Night Lands

text: At once, Your Grace.
name: The Night Lands

text: The Lord of Light shines through you, young warrior.
name: The Night Lands

text: ( Whispering )
name: The Night Lands

text: Come.
name: The Night Lands

text: ( Doors close )
name: The Night Lands

text: What did you say to him?
name: The Night Lands

text: I told him death by fire is the purest death.
name: The Night Lands

text: Why?
name: The Night Lands

text: Because it is true.
name: The Night Lands

text: You're troubled, my king.
name: The Night Lands

text: Yeah.
name: The Night Lands

text: These armies are toys for the Lord of Light.
name: The Night Lands

text: Tell your lord to burn them, then.
name: The Night Lands

text: I tell him nothing.
name: The Night Lands

text: I pray for his commands and I obey.
name: The Night Lands

text: My little brother has 100,000 men according to the scouts, men whose allegiance rightly belongs to me.
name: The Night Lands

text: You must have faith.
name: The Night Lands

text: Faith?
name: The Night Lands

text: In a real war, the side with the greater number wins nine times out of 10.
name: The Night Lands

text: Then we must be the 10th.
name: The Night Lands

text: I cannot defeat my brother in the field.
name: The Night Lands

text: And I can't take King's Landing without the men he's stolen.
name: The Night Lands

text: I have seen the path to victory in the flames.
name: The Night Lands

text: But first, you must give yourself to the Lord of Light.
name: The Night Lands

text: I've said the words, damn you.
name: The Night Lands

text: I burnt the idols.
name: The Night Lands

text: You must give all of yourself.
name: The Night Lands

text: I have a wife.
name: The Night Lands

text: I took a vow.
name: The Night Lands

text: She's sickly, weak...
name: The Night Lands

text: Shut away in a tower.
name: The Night Lands

text: She disgusts you.
name: The Night Lands

text: And she's given you nothing ... no sons, only stillborns, only death.
name: The Night Lands

text: I will give you a son, my king.
name: The Night Lands

text: A son?
name: The Night Lands

text: Robb: Tomorrow you'll ride south to the Stormlands. I need you to negotiate with Renly Baratheon.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: If Renly sides with us, we'll outnumber them two to one.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: I am glad your new friend was able to accompany you to the capital.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: But I am very good at keeping secrets from my good friends.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: Your discretion is legendary.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: You in command here? I have a royal warrant for one of these gutter rats you're transporting.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: We're looking for a boy named Gendry.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: We'll be back with more men.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: This is Gilly. She's one of Craster's daughters.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: We have to take her with us when we leave.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: I'm going to have a baby. If it's a boy...
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: If it's a boy, what?
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: Seeing as you betrayed the last Hand of the King, well, I just wouldn't feel safe with you lurking about.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: The queen herself ...
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: The queen regent.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: And you're a fool to believe she is your friend.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: I hope you enjoy the Wall.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: I have friends at court!
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: To the new Commander.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: I need to get to Pyke.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: I'm heading that way, Lord Greyjoy.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: Balon: I destroy Robb Stark's enemies for him and he will make me king of the Iron Islands once again.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: I will lead the attack myself.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: Oh, you will?
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: I'm your son, who else? Yara?
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: So good to see you, brother.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: She can't lead an attack.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: She's commanded men. She's killed men.

text: No man gives me a crown. I will take my crown.

text: ♪ Game of Thrones 2x03 ♪ What Is Dead May Never Die Original Air Date on April 15, 2012 ♪
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: ( Grunts )
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: Out, all of you.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: b*st*rd's been meddling where he shouldn't!
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: I want you and your men gone.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: And you will make this right.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: ( Spits )
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: Wait outside.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: Lord Commander.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: Now!
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: Lord Commander.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: Leave us.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: What did you do?
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: I followed him.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: He took the baby into the woods, the newborn.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: What business is that of yours?
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: No, you don't understand.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: He's killing them, all the boys.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: You know.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: The wildlings serve crueler Gods than you or I.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: Those boys are Craster's offerings.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: Offerings?
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: He's murdering his own children. He's a monster.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: Aye, many a time that monster has been the difference between life and death for our Rangers.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: Your Uncle among them.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: We have other wars to fight out there.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: Like it or not, we need men like Craster.
name: What is Dead May Never Die
What is Dead May Never Die

text: I saw it.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: I saw...
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: Something take that child.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: Yeah.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: Whatever it was, I daresay you'll see it again.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: Now ready my horse.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: We leave at dawn.
name: What is Dead May Never Die

text: Don't lose it again.
