name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Ride back to Highgarden, sister.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I'm not running from Stannis.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Brienne of Tarth murdered Renly.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I don't believe that. You don't believe that.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Who gained the most from our king's death?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Stannis.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I will put a sword through his righteous face.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: You can't stay here.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: He would have been a true king, a good king.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Tell me, Ser Loras, what do you desire most in this world?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Revenge.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I have always found that to be the purest of motivations, but you won't have a chance to put your sword through Stannis, not today.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: You'll be cut to pieces before he sets foot on solid ground.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: If it is justice that you want, be smart about it.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: You can't avenge him from the grave.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Bring the horses.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Please.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: He was very handsome.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: He was, Your Grace.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: "Your Grace."
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Calling yourself king doesn't make you one.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And if Renly wasn't a king, I wasn't a queen.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Do you want to be a queen?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: No.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I want to be the queen.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Killed? By whom?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Accounts differ.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Most seem to implicate Catelyn Stark in some way.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Really? Who'd have thought?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Some say it was one of his own Kingsguard, while still others say it was Stannis himself who did it after negotiations went sour.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Whomever did it, I say well done.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: It's not what Varys says.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: He says Renly's army is flocking to support Stannis, which would give Stannis superiority over us on both land and sea.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Littlefinger says we can outspend him three to one.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And I say father raised you to have too much respect for money.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Stannis Baratheon is coming for us, sooner rather than later.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Aren't there other things you should be doing, like sealing my daughter in a crate so you can ship her away?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: She'll be safer in Dorne.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Yes, I know how concerned you are for her safety.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: It so happens that I am.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Myrcella is a sweet, innocent girl and I don't blame her at all for you.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: So clever.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Aren't you always so clever with your schemes and your plots?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Schemes and plots are the same thing.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: They are going to attack us.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: We need to be ready.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: No need to concern yourself over it.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: The King is taking personal charge of siege preparations.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: May I ask specifically what the King has in mind?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: You may specifically or you may ask vaguely.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: The answer will be the same.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: It's important that we talk about this.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: It's the King's royal prerogative to withhold sensitive information from his councilors.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: It's wildfire.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Wildfire?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: You wouldn't lie to me, would you, cousin?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: No.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: That's a lie right there.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: It is not a lie. Why would I lie?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Tell me, if the vile allegations against my brother and sister are true, do you think it will make Jaime more likely to kill you or less likely?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: When I tell him you're f*cking her, I mean.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I'm telling you the truth.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: The smart money would be on more likely.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: She's making wildfire.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: But then perhaps his own unnatural urges will give him sympathy for yours.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: The alchemists' guild is being commissioned.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I suppose there's only one way to find out.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: They have thousands of pots already stored in their vaults.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: They are planning to launch them from the city walls into Stannis's ships and armies.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Please.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: When did she tell you this?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I heard her talking with the Pyromancer.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And the other night after I left her, she went to meet him.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I swear to you.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Swear to me on what?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: On my life.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: But I don't care about your life.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: In the Light of the Seven, by all that is holy and right, I, Lancel Lannister, do solemnly vow ...
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: All right, all right. Enough.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Even torturing you is boring.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Just get out.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Oh, Lancel, tell my friend Bronn to please kill you if anything should happen to me.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Please kill me if anything should happen to Lord Tyrion.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: It will be my pleasure.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Your Grace.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: What is it?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Your Grace.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I'm sorry about your brother, Your Grace.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I wanted to let you know that people grieve for him.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Your Grace.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Fools love a fool.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Your Grace.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I grieve for him as well ... for the boy he was, not the man he grew to be.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I need to speak to you about what I saw in that cave.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I thought I made it clear to you there'd be no need to speak to me on this matter.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Your Grace, I ...
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I've never known you to need to hear a thing twice.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And I've never known you to hide from the truth.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: You've come to lecture me on truth?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I've come to tell you that what I saw ...
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: All my brother's bannermen have come to my side.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Except the Tyrells, who fled like cowards.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: They won't be able to resist us now.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Soon I shall be sitting on the Iron Throne.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Nothing is worth what this will cost you, not even the Iron ...
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I'll hear no more about it.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Take a company of men, secure the perimeter.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: When do we sail for King's Landing?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: As soon as I've consolidated my troops.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: We'll make short work of the Lannisters' fleet.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Once Blackwater Bay is cleared, we'll deliver our troops to their doorstep and take the city.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And will you bring Lady Melisandre with you?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: That's not your concern.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: If you take King's Landing with her by your side, the victory will be hers.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I never thought I'd have reason to doubt your loyalty. Was I wrong?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Loyal service means telling hard truths.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Oh, truth again.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: All right, what's the truth?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: The hard truth?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: She's a foreigner preaching her foreign religion.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Some believe she whispers orders in your ear and you obey.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: What do you believe?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: You won those bannermen from Renly.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Don't lose them to her.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: We set out for King's Landing without Lady Melisandre.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And you lead the fleet into Blackwater Bay.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Your Grace, I'm honored, but my time on the sea was spent evading ships, not attacking them.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: The other lords won't be happy.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Most of those lords should consider themselves lucky I don't hang them for treason.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Hard truths cut both ways, Ser Davos.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I've got it!
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I've got it!
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: So it's that one there at the top, on the right.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Buy my fruit, My Lord. Fresh fruit.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Stannis has more infantry, more ships, more horses.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: What do we have?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: There's that mind of yours you keep going on about.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Well, I've never actually been able to kill people with it.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Good thing. I'd be out of a job.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: What about your father?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: He hasn't sent a raven in weeks.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: He's very busy.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Being repeatedly humiliated by Robb Stark is time-consuming.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: We won't be able to hold the city against Stannis, not the way Joffrey's planning on holding it.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Corruption, yes.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: We are swollen, bloated, foul.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Brother fornicates with sister in the bed of Kings and we're surprised when the fruit of their incest is rotten?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Yes, a rotten king.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: It's hard to argue with his assessment.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Not after what he did to your birthday present.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: The King is a lost cause.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: It's the rest of us I'm worried about now.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: A dancing king, prancing down his bloodstained halls to the tune of a twisted demon monkey.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: You have to admire his imagination.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: He's talking about you.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: What?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Demon monkey?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: People think you're pulling the King's strings.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: They blame you for the city's ills.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Blame me? I'm trying to save them.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: You don't need to convince me.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Demon monkey.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: ( Seagulls screeching
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Yeah, come on.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: You're the crew of the sea bitch?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I'm your commander. Welcome.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Stop.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Stop!
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Your Captain commands you to stop.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Where are we heading, Captain?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: The Stony Shore to raid their villages.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: There'll be spoils in it for you, and women, if you do your jobs well.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And who decides if we've done our jobs well?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I do.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Your Captain.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I have been reaving and raping since before you left Balon's balls, Captain.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Don't reckon I've got much use for your ideas on how to do it.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Don't reckon I've got much use for a captain at all.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I'm thinking I can do the job of captain real well myself.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: All I need is a ship.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: You wouldn't know where I could find myself a ship now, would you?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: You could do that, take the ship, head out on your own.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And I will hunt you down, drag you back here in chains, and hang you for a traitor.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Stop. We yield.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Congratulations on your first command.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Thank you. Kind of you to come see me off.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Oh, I'm not here for you.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I was just on my way to Red Harbor.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I've got 30 ships. There's nowhere to put them here.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Too narrow.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: You'd better get out there.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Wouldn't want them to set sail without you.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: That would never happen.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: My crew would wait on deck for a year if I asked them to.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: This lot, though...
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Enjoy the Stony Shore.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Come on, I'll take you out.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Who are you?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Dagmer, your first mate.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Why aren't you with the rest of them?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Or did they send you to row me out and dump me halfway in the sea?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: That would be good for a laugh.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: They're not gonna respect you until you prove yourself.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And how am I supposed to prove myself by pillaging piss-poor fishing villages?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: You're not.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And yet that's the task my father has given me to prove that I'm a true Iron Islander.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: They're all Iron Islanders.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Do they do as they're told or do they do as they like?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: The Stony Shore's not far from Torrhen's Square.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: The seat of the House of Tallhart ... a more impressive prize than a few fishermen's daughters.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: What, you don't think we could take it?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: No, we could.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: We could never hold it for more than a few days.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: As soon as Winterfell got word that we'd taken Torrhen's Square, the Starks would send their men to take it back.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And then ... take me to my ship.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: The Starks have overextended their lines.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Now that summer's over, they'll have a hard time keeping their men and horses fed.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: The Starks understand winter better than we ever will.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: The cold won't beat them.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Our spies report growing discontent among the northern lords.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: They want to return home and gather the harvest before the crops turn.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And I'm sure if those same spies snuck into our own encampments, they would report growing discontent amongst the southern lords.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: This is war; No one's content.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: We've underestimated the Stark boy for too long.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: He has a good mind for warfare, his men worship him.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And as long as he keeps winning battles, they'll keep believing he is King in the North.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: You've been waiting for him to fail.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: He is not going to fail, not without our help.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: So how do we stop him?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: We've worked through the night, My Lord.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Perhaps we'd profit from some sleep.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: As I think you would, Reginald.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And because you're my cousin, I might even let you wake from that sleep.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Go, I'm sure your wife must miss you.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: My wife's in Lannisport.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Well, then you'd better start riding.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Go before I change my mind and send her your head.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: If your name wasn't Lannister, you'd be scrubbing out pots in the cook's tent. Go!
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Not wine, water.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: We'll be here for some time.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Girl.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Where are you from?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Maidenpool, My Lord.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And who are the Lords of Maidenpool?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Remind me.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: House Mooton, My Lord.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And what is their Sigil?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: A red salmon.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I think a Maidenpool girl would remember that.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: You're a northerner, aren't you?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Good. One more time, where are you from?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Barrowton, My Lord. House Dustin.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Two crossed longaxes beneath a black crown.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And what do they say of Robb Stark in the North?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: They call him the young wolf.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: They say he rides into battle on the back of a giant Direwolf.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: They say he can turn into a wolf himself when he wants.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: They say he can't be killed.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And do you believe them?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: No, My Lord.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Anyone can be killed.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Fetch that water.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: A girl says nothing.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: A girl keeps her mouth closed.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: No one hears, and friends may talk in secret, yes?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: A boy becomes a girl.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I was always a girl.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And I was always aware.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: But the girl keeps secrets.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: It is not for a man to spoil them.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: You're one of them now.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I should have let you burn.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And you fetch water for one of them now.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Why is this right for you and wrong for me?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I didn't have a choice.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: You did. I did.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And here we are.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: A man pays his debts.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: A man owes three.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Three what?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: The Red God takes what is his, lovely girl.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And only death may pay for life.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: You saved me and the two I was with.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: You stole three deaths from the Red God.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: We have to give them back.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Speak three names and the man will do the rest.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Three lives I will give you ... no more, no less, and we're done.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I can name anyone and you'll kill him?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: A man has said.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: The one who tortures everyone.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: A man needs a name.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I don't know his name.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: They call him the Tickler.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: That is enough.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Go now, girl. Your master is thirsty.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: He's not here yet.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: He'd have seen us, blown the horn.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: When will he come?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: The Halfhand does things in his own time.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: My uncle told me stories about him.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Most of them are true.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I heard the Halfhand spent half of last winter beyond the wall.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: The whole winter.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: He was north of the Skirling Pass when the snows came.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Had to wait for the thaw.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: So it is possible for someone to survive out here on their own.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Well, possible for the Halfhand.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Beautiful, isn't it?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Gilly would love it here.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: There's nothing more sickening than a man in love.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: About time you did something.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: At least you'll keep warm.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: The fist of the First Men.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Think of how old this place is ... before the Targaryens defeated the Hendals, before the Andals took Westeros from the First Men.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Before I die, please, stop talking.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Thousands and thousands of years ago, the First Men stood here where we're standing all through the long night.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: What do you think they were like, the First Men?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Stupid.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Smart people don't find themselves in places like this.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I think they were afraid.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: I think they came here to get away from something.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: And I don't think it worked.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Wildlings?
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: One blast is for rangers returning.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

text: Wildlings is two blasts.
name: The Ghost Of Harrenhal

name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You never killed a woman before, did you?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You don't need to do it.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Mance would take you. I know he would.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: There's secret ways.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: The Crows would never catch us.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I'm as much a Crow as they are.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Will you burn me... after?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Can't.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Someone might see the smoke.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Strike hard and true, Jon Snow, or I'll come back and haunt you.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: That's cold.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Go on.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Be quick about it.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Do it.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: b*st*rd, do it!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You can't do it. We both know it.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: The sun's going down, Jon Snow.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: And your friends are nowhere close.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I'll find them.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Call for the go on.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Call loudly.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: May the Seven guide the princess on her journey.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: May the mother give her health.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: May the crone give her wisdom.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: May the warrior give her courage.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: One day I pray you love someone.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I pray you love her so much, when you close your eyes, you see her face.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I want that for you.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I want you to know what it's like to love someone, to truly love someone, before I take her from you.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You sound like a little cat mewling for his mother.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Princes don't cry.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I saw you cry.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Did you say something, My Lady?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: My little brother cried when I left Winterfell.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: So?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: It seems a normal thing.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Is your little brother a prince?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: No.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Not really relevant, then, is it?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Come, dog.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Hail, Joffrey!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Hail to the king.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Seven blessings on you, Your Grace.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Murderer! b*st*rd!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: All hail the king.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: He's no king.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: He's a b*st*rd!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Please, Your Grace, we're hungry.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Freak!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Get the prince back to the keep now.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Yes, My Lord. Come, quickly.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Please, Your Grace, give us some food!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Bread, Your Grace,
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: please!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Who threw that?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I want the man who threw that.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Find who did that and bring him to me!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Hold on!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Hold them back!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Just kill them!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Kill them all!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Move. Move!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: - Pull back!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Tear him to pieces!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: What are you doing? I want these people executed!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: And they want the same for you.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Where's Sansa?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Through the door!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Come on!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Protect the king!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Get back!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Fall back!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Move!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: To the gates!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Come in! Come in!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Keep him safe!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: m*therf*cker!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Watch out. Hold them back.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Come on.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Hey!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Traitors!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I'll have all their heads.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Oh, you blind, bloody fool.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You can't insult me.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: We've had vicious kings and we've had idiot kings, but I don't know if we've ever been cursed with a vicious idiot for a king.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You can't ...
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I can, I am.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: They attacked me!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: They threw a cow pie at you, so you decided to kill them all?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: They're starving, you fool.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: All because of a war you started.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You're talking to a king!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: And now I've struck a king.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Did my hand fall from my wrist?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Where is the Stark girl?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Let them have her.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: If she dies, you'll never get your Uncle Jaime back.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You owe him quite a bit, you know.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Where are you going?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You ever been f*cked, little girl?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Come here.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Take some men and go and find the Stark girl.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I take my orders from the king.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: This way!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Please!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: No, no.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Please!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You're all right now, little bird.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You're all right.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: We'll get you. We'll get you.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: This way.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Are you hurt, My Lady?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: The little bird's bleeding.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Someone take her back to her cage, see to that cut.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Well done, Clegane.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I didn't do it for you.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: He shouldn't make me wait.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: The Spice King is the second wealthiest man in Qarth.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: He makes everyone wait.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Of course, you could have avoided this embarrassment if you married the wealthiest man in Qarth.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I already have a husband.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Khal Drogo is gone, Khaleesi.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You are far too young to be a widow forever and far too beautiful.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: And you are far too smart to think that I will succumb to flattery.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I have travelled very far in my life and met many women, but none that are immune to flattery.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: The Mother of Dragons!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Ah.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Here he comes.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Forgive me. I had terrible dreams last night.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Terrible dreams.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I could not sleep until the sun was shining and the birds were singing.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Look what a beauty you are now the Red Waste has been washed off you.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I am sorry about all that unpleasantness.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: The silver hair of a true Targaryen.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Xaro Xhoan Daxos, she is far too lovely for a glorified dockworker like yourself.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Very true, and yet they say that your grandfather, who sold pepper off the back of a wagon, married a lady far lovelier and higher born than himself.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Every lady alive was lovelier and higher born than my grandfather.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Ahem.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Did my servants not offer you something to eat, to drink?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I'll have them flogged in the square.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Thank you, My Lord. You are a gracious host, but there is no servant alive that can bring me what I want.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Oh, she has a talent for drama, this one.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: So, my little princess, what is it you want?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: My birthright ... the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I fear I'm no better than a servant in this regard.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I cannot give you what I do not have.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I'm not asking you for the Kingdoms.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I'm asking you for ships.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I need to cross the Narrow Sea.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I need my ships as well.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I use them, you see, to bring spices from one port to another.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Whatever you grant me now will be repaid three times over when I retake the Iron Throne.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Retake?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Did you once sit on the Iron Throne?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: My father sat there before he was murdered.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: But if you did not sit on it yourself, would it not be correct to say take the Iron Throne?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I didn't come here to argue grammar.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Of course not. You came to take my ships.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: So let me explain my position, little princess.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Unlike you, I do not have exalted ancestors.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I make my living by trade.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: And I judge every trade on its merits.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You ask for ships.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You say I shall be repaid triple.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I do not doubt your honesty or your intentions.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: But before you repay your debts, you must seize the Seven Kingdoms.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Do you have an army?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Not yet.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You do not have an army.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Do you have powerful allies in Westeros?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: There are many there that support my claim.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: When were you there last?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I left when I was a baby.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: So, in truth, you have no allies.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: The people will rise to fight for their rightful Queen when I return.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Ah.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Forgive me, little princess, but I cannot make an investment based on wishes and dreams.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Now if you'll pardon me.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Do you know Illyrio Mopatis, Magister of Pentos?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Yes, we've met. A shrewd man.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: For my wedding he gave me three petrified dragon eggs.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: He believed ...  the world believed ...  that the ages had turned them to stone.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: How many centuries has it been since dragons roamed the skies?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: But I dreamt that if I carried those eggs into a great fire, they would hatch.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: When I stepped into the fire, my own people thought I was mad.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: But when the fire burned out, I was unhurt, the Mother of Dragons.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Do you understand?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I'm no ordinary woman.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: My dreams come true.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I admire your passion.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: But in business, I trust in logic, not passion.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I'm sorry, little princess.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I am not your little princess.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I am Daenerys Stormborn of the blood of old Valyria and I will take what is mine.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: With fire and blood, I will take it.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Yes, My Lady, but not with my ships.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Who taught you to read?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: My father, My Lord.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Hmm.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I taught my son Jaime to read.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: The Maester came to me one day, told me he wasn't learning.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: He couldn't make sense of the letters.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: He reversed them in his head.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: The Maester said he'd heard tell of this affliction and that we simply must accept it.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Ha!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: After that, I sat Jaime down for four hours every day until he learned.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: He hated me for it, for a time.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: For a long time, but he learned.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Where is your father? Is he alive?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Who was he?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: A stonemason.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: A stonemason who could read?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Hmm.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: He taught himself.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Quite a man.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: What killed him?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Loyalty.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You're a sharp little thing, aren't you?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Did...
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Forgive me, My Lord. I shouldn't ask questions.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: No...
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: But you've already begun.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Did you know your father, My Lord?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I did.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I grew up with him.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I watched him grow old.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: He loved us.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: He was a good man, but a weak man, a weak man who nearly destroyed our House and name.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I'm cold.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I'll fetch more wood for the fire, My Lord.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Mmm.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Where are you going, girl?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: The armory, My Lord.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Why?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Lord Tywin sent me.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: What might this be?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Lord Tywin gave it to me.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: What for?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: To take to the armory.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Why would he do that?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Let's go and ask him.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Move!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Get out of the way!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Amory Lorch.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: A girl has named a second name.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: A man will do what must be done.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Now!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: A girl cannot tell a man when exactly he must do a thing.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: A man cannot make a thing happen before its time.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: But he's going to tell Tywin. He's getting away.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: It has to be now.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Guard!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Your Grace.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Your Grace.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: My honor, Your Grace.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Your Grace.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Your Grace.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Quent.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Lady Talisa.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Your Grace.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I'm not sure I'm a lady.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Westerosi customs are still a bit foreign to me.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: It's hard to keep all the rules straight.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: But if I remember my lessons, a woman of noble birth is always called a lady unless she's a queen or a princess.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I could find someone who knows.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Why are you so sure I'm of noble birth?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Because it's obvious.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: What if I told you my father sold lace on the long bridge and my mother, my brother, and I lived with him above our shop?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I'd call you a liar.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Not very noble to accuse a lady of dishonesty.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I always thought I was a brilliant liar.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Better at amputations, I'm afraid.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Quite a pretty spot.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Will we be here long?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I couldn't really discuss troop movements with you.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I'm not a spy.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Of course a spy would deny being a spy.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You're right. You've found me out.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I'm writing a letter to the Lannisters.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: "The young wolf is on the move."
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Perhaps you'd join me...
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: If you've got time, of course, for, well...
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Robb.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Mother.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Mother, this is Lady Talisa.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: She's been helping with the wounded.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: She's been very... helpful.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Lady Talisa.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Lady Stark.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Lady Talisa...?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Maegyr.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Maegyr?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Forgive me, I do not know this name.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: An uncommon name here. An old name in Volantis.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Excuse me, My Lady. Your Grace.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I've missed you.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Yes, you look positively forlorn.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You surprised me, that's all.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I didn't think I'd see you today.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I wish that you were free to follow your heart.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I know.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You have inherited your father's responsibilities.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I'm afraid they come at a cost.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I know.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You are promised to another ... a debt that must be paid.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I haven't forgotten.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Your Grace.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: My Lady. News from Winterfell.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Your brothers desert you?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I can tell you which way to go.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: We'll stop here.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Too dark to go any farther today.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Here? There's no shelter here.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: There's no shelter anywhere.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: There is if you know where to look.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: The cold could kill us both.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: If you light a fire ...
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: No fire.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: But a fire is ...
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: No fire.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Have it your way.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: We'll stay warmer if we stay close.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Bet you freeze to death before I do.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Bet your life.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Think they're out looking for you?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Yes.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Think they'll find you?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Yes.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You're brave.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Stupid, but brave.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: We start again at first light. Get some sleep.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Stop moving.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I'm just trying to get comfortable.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Stop it!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You're still moving.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Was I?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I didn't notice that time.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: This cannot be true.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: We've had ravens from White Harbor, Barrowton and the Dreadfort.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I'm afraid it is true.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Why? Why would Theon ...
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Because the Greyjoys are treasonous whores.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: My brothers?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: We've heard nothing of them.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: But Rodrik Cassel is dead.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I told you, never trust a Greyjoy!
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: I must go North at once.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: There's still a war to win, Your Grace.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: How can I call myself king if I can't hold my own castle?
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: How can I ask men to follow me if I can't ...
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: You are a king.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: And that means you don't have to do everything yourself.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Let me go and talk to Theon.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: There will be no talk. He will die for this.
name: The Old Gods And The New

text: Theon holds the castle with a skeleton crew.

name: A Man Without Honor

text: Build yourself a cabin and find a woman to lie with in the night.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You're a pretty lad.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: The girls would claw each other's eyes out to get naked with you.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Walk.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I could teach you how to do it.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I know how to do it.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You know nothing, Jon Snow.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Chatter )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: And what did she say?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: She admired your spirit, Your Grace.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: And what then?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: She, uh...
name: A Man Without Honor

text: If every man were held accountable for the actions of every distant relative, Ser Alton, we'd all hang.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: She tore the paper in half, Your Grace.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You've acted with honor.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I thank you for it.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Lord Karstark, see that Ser Alton's pen is clean.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: And give him a hot supper.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Ser Alton's pen is occupied, Your Grace.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: The prisoners from the Yellow Fork.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Too many prisoners.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Is there room for Ser Alton?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Does he need to lie down?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Have the men build him a new pen.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Put him in with the Kingslayer for now.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Have your boy watch over them.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Torrhen.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: That will be all.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Your Grace.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: A minute of your time?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I've been treating your wounded men.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: And my enemies as some of my bannermen are fond of mentioning.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: They're not my enemies.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: That's what I tell my bannermen.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I've already run through the supplies I brought with me.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Some are easily replaced ... egg yolks, turpentine, oil of roses.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: But some are not.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I need silk for stitching.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I need fennel root for those with fever, willow bark.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Mostly I need milk of the poppy.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You saw what it was like to amputate a foot without any.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I assume there will be more loss of limb before this war is over.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: If you need help finding these ...
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I know where to find them.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I'm sorry, I shouldn't interrupt you.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Continue, My Lady.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You're riding to the Crag to negotiate a surrender?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Yes.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: The Crag will have a Maester and he will have what I need.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I expect he will.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: If I could write a list ... come with me to the Crag.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I don't think that will be ...
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Let the Maester show you his stores.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I want the wounded men to be treated well ... all the wounded men.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Dog barking )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Woman: Children, come inside, quick.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Hurry up!
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Dog barking )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Man: Can't find anything, Ser.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: They've lost the scent.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Try again.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: We've circled this farmhouse twice.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: There's no sign of them.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: We could start the search fresh in the morning, My Lord.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I'm looking at spending the rest of life being treated like a fool and a eunuch by my own people.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Ask yourself, "Is there anything I wouldn't do to stop that from happening?"
name: A Man Without Honor

text: The hounds will find the scent again.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I'll beat them until they do.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I'll whip every man here until I have both those boys in hand.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: And once I've got them, the pampered little sh1ts...
name: A Man Without Honor

text: It's better to be cruel than weak.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Prince Theon.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Where are they?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Who, m'lord?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: The Stark boys. Where are they?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I don't know. I seen no one.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Oh!
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Think harder.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I swear, m'lord, I don't know.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: My Lord, over here.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I think I've found what we're looking for.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Send the old man home.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Go back to Winterfell.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Take him back.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Theon, don't do this.
name: A Man Without Honor

text:

name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Birds chirping )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You came back.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: As soon as I heard.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Do you know anything?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Irri is dead.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I know.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: She was a good ... she's dead.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: She died alone.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: She died for me and I couldn't protect her.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Doreah?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: We can't find her.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: She must be dead, too.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I led my people out of the Red Waste and into the slaughterhouse.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I should have been here.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You went to find me a ship.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: My place is by your side.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I shouldn't have left you alone with these people.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: These people?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: They are not to be trusted.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: And who is to be trusted?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Who are my people?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: The Targaryens?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I only knew one ... my brother, and he would have let 1,000 men rape me if it had got him the crown.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: The Dothraki?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Most of them turned on me the day that Khal Drogo fell from his horse.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Your people are in Westeros.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: The people in Westeros don't know I'm alive.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: They will soon enough.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: And then what?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: They'll pray for my return?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: They'll wave dragon banners and shout my name?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: That's what my brother believed and he was a fool.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You are not your brother.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Trust me, Khaleesi.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: There it is ...
name: A Man Without Honor

text: "trust me."
name: A Man Without Honor

text: And it's you I should trust, Ser Jorah?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Only you?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I don't need trust any longer.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I don't want it and I don't have room for it.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You are too young to be so ...
name: A Man Without Honor

text: And you are too familiar.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Forgive me, Khaleesi.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: No one can survive in this world without help.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: No one.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Let me help you, please.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Tell me how.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Find my dragons.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Ygritte: How long till we get back to your crows?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: We're close.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: What, a day? A half-day?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You don't know, do you?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Do you even know where they are?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: We're close.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: What do you think they'll say when they hear about you and me?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Nothing happened between you and me.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: "I swear it, old master king crow, Ser, we were only close together for warmth.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: And then I felt it, right up against me backside like a club.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I can show you the bruise on me tailbone.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: And before I knew what was where, his ... his ... well, it was all out in the open, all angry as you like.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: And I didn't want to want it, but, oh, I did!
name: A Man Without Honor

text: And he spread me legs and ... ruined.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: The shame of it.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Now I can never marry a perfumed lord.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: What will me poor savage father say?"
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Turn back around.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: "And I thought that we were done, but he said,
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( deep voice )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: 'Turn back around.'"
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( normal voice ) I'll tell you what, Jon Snow, since it's going to be your word against mine, and since you can't talk about it without blushing, we may as well just.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: What, right here in the muck?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I'll keep you warm enough.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Are you that afraid of it?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: That's enough.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Oh, it's nice and wet and warm.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Enough it don't have teeth.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: All right!
name: A Man Without Honor

text: All right.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Gods, you're dull.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Grunting )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Sword rings )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Ygritte whistles )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Should have took me while you had the chance.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Sansa crying )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Sansa crying )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: No, no!
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Screams )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Laughs )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Screams )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: No. Oh, no.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Whimpering )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: It's all right. Give me that.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: If the queen sees I can have Joffrey's children now...
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Help me flip it over.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Where are you going?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: To tell her Grace.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You'll say nothing to anyone.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Do you understand?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Your mother might have prepared you.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You flowered, my dear. No more.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: My mother told me, but I thought it would be different.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: In what way?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I thought it would be less ... less messy.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Wait until you bear the child.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You're a woman now.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Do you have any idea what that means?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I'm fit to bear children for the king?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: A prospect that once delighted you ... bringing little princes and princesses into the world, the greatest honor for a queen.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Joffrey has always been difficult.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Even his birth, I labored a day and a half to bring him into this world.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You cannot imagine the pain.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I screamed so loudly, I was sure Robert would hear me in the Kingswood.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: His Grace was not with you?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Robert was hunting.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: That was his custom.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Whenever my time was near, my royal husband would flee to the trees with his huntsmen and his hounds.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: And when he returned, he would present me with some pelts or a stag's head, and I would present him with a baby.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Not that I wanted him there, mind you.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I had Grand Maester Pycelle, an army of midwives, and I had my brother.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: When they told Jaime he wasn't allowed in the birthing room, he smiled and asked which one of them proposed to keep him out.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Joffrey will show you no such devotion.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You may never love the king, but you will love his children.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I love his Grace with all my heart.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: That's so very touching to hear.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Permit me to share some womanly wisdom with you on this very special day.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: The more people you love, the weaker you are.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You'll do things for them that you know you shouldn't do.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You'll act the fool to make them happy, to keep them safe.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Love no one but your children.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: On that front, a mother has no choice.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: But... shouldn't I love Joffrey, Your Grace?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You can try, little dove.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Chatter )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Who did you say your mother was again?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Cinda Lannister.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Is she the fat one?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Well, perhaps she's gotten a little larger than she ...
name: A Man Without Honor

text: No, no. There's only one fat Lannister.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: If she was your mother, you'd know it.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I ... I squired for you once, you know?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: When?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: The tournament the day of Willem Frey's wedding.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I went to Willem Frey's wedding?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You did.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Your squire had gotten so drunk the night before that he ...
name: A Man Without Honor

text: He threw up on his horse on the way to the tourney grounds.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: What was his name?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Bryan.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Laughs ) Poor lad.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: That was my brother's doing, I seem to recall.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I remember you.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You had never squired for anyone before.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: That's right. I ran up and volunteered.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: "Let me, My Lord. Let me."
name: A Man Without Honor

text: My father was furious, afraid I'd embarrass our family in front of the family.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You didn't, though.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You really remember?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Mm.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You knew when you were needed and when to go away.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: It's a rare talent.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Most of my squires, they mean well, but young men with big jobs, they tend to overdo them.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Well, when I think back to that day ...
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( hisses )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You were saying?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I ... never mind. It's embarrassing.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: More embarrassing than being chained to a post covered in your own sh1t?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I remember everything about that day ... your helmet, your horse, the rake line in the dirt along the list, where the sun was in the sky when you knocked Balon Swann from his horse, and the dent in your shield when you handed it back to me.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I'll remember it all until I die.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: That was the best day of my life.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: And I remember being on the field after it was over.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: All the competitors were done.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I was the last one out there.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: And I couldn't leave.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I couldn't bring myself to go and sit with my family at a table so far on the edge of the feast you could barely even see the bride.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: And I couldn't bear to tell them what it had been like squiring for you when I knew that they could never have the faintest idea what I was talking about.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I understand completely.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: How could you?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: S-sorry, I ... I didn't mean to doubt you.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: It's just that I ...
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I was 16 once.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I also had to replace someone's squire on short notice.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Which knight was it?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Barristan Selmy.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: The fight against the Kingswood outlaws.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Before your time.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: What was he like?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Sighs )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: He was a painter, a painter who only used red.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I couldn't imagine being able to fight like that, not back then.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: And to help him do that, to be a part of something that perfect...
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I don't need to explain how that felt, not to you.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: It's hard to put into words.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: It's like stepping into a dream you've been dreaming for as long as you can remember and finding out that the dream is more real than your life.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Leaving that battlefield was like being dragged off to prison.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Did you squire for him again?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: No.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I didn't have your gift.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: He couldn't take a step without stepping on me.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I was awful, a complete liability... until one of the outlaws decided to take on a 16-year-old squire.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: It's a good thing I am who I am.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Chuckles ) I'd have been useless at anything else.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I'm not well-suited for imprisonment.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Shocking, I know.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Some men are.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Ned Stark ... I imagine he made an excellent prisoner right up until the end.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: But me, though ... my life has left me uniquely unfit for constraint.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Have you thought about...?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Of course.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Every day.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: And?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Good prisoners breed good jailers, apparently.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: The Starks are very careful.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: But there is a way, I think.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: It wasn't possible until now.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: What is it?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: It's actually quite simple.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Well, let me help you.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You'll only have to do one thing.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Tell me.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You'll have to die.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Crunching )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Choking )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Bone breaks )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Bird screeching )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Jorah the Andal.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: This man must sail past old Valyria.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: All who travel too close to the Doom must have protection.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I didn't come here for lessons.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: No, you came for the dragons.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You have them?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Where are they?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Draw your sword.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: See what your steel is worth.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You want to please the Mother of Dragons.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You love her.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Where are the dragons?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Will you betray her again, Jorah the Andal?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Will you betray her again?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Never.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: The thief you seek is with her now.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Spice King: I did not leave the comfort of my home to come to yours and be called a thief.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: No one is calling you a thief.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Who is she to accuse us?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Please, they're my children.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I'm begging you.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Begging us?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: It wasn't very long ago you were threatening us.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Without me, the dragons will die.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: It will be for the best.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Your dragons will bring the world nothing but death and misery, my dear.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: If I knew where they were, I would not tell you.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Pyat Pree: You are cruel, my friend.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: The mother of dragons is in the right.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: She must be reunited with her babies.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I will help you, Khaleesi.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: How?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I will take you to the House of the Undying where I have put them.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You have my dragons?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: When I learned you were coming to our city, I made an arrangement with the King of Qarth.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: ( Laughter )
name: A Man Without Honor

text: He procured them for me.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: But there is no King of Qarth.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Xaro: There is now.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: That was the other half of the arrangement.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: You would keep your gates and your minds closed to everything outside your walls, but Qarth cannot remain the greatest city that ever was if it refuses to change.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: I will open Qarth to the world as I have forced it to open itself to me.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Your ambition is an inspiration.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: But like all upstarts, you overreach.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Three dragons the size of cats and an alliance with a charlatan do not make you a king.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: An upstart and a charlatan?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Empires have been built by less.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Those on the margins often come to control the center, and those in the center make room for them, willingly or otherwise.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: The Mother of Dragons will be with her babies.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: She will give them her love and they will thrive by her side... forever.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: A mother should be with her children.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Where will you run to, Daenerys Stormborn?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Your dragons wait for you in the House of the Undying.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Come see them.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Lady Stark!
name: A Man Without Honor

text: No farther.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Keep your hands off me, woman.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Don't enter without an invitation, man.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Forgive me. Lady Stark.
name: A Man Without Honor

text: Catelyn: What is it?
name: A Man Without Honor

text: They caught the Kingslayer.
