name: The Climb

text: Bran: Stop it!
name: The Climb

text: Hodor.
name: The Climb

text: You've been fighting since you met. Just stop it.
name: The Climb

text: Lady Reed here's got a stick so far up her ass, it's a wonder her feet touch the ground.
name: The Climb

text: You've been nasty to her every day.
name: The Climb

text: Of course she's nasty back.
name: The Climb

text: Me? It's my fault?
name: The Climb

text: First time I met her, she put a knife to my throat.
name: The Climb

text: First time I met you, you held a knife at me.
name: The Climb

text: We can't fight each other.
name: The Climb

text: We'll never make it to the Wall.
name: The Climb

text: I want you both to make peace.
name: The Climb

text: Your way of skinning rabbits is quicker than mine.
name: The Climb

text: I said so, didn't I?
name: The Climb

text: Osha!
name: The Climb

text: You're a good little hunter.
name: The Climb

text: Thank you.
name: The Climb

text: See?
name: The Climb

text: Not so hard, is it? Thank you.
name: The Climb

text: Don't push me.
name: The Climb

text: ( Jojen gasping )
name: The Climb

text: Shh.
name: The Climb

text: I'm right here with you.
name: The Climb

text: What's happening?
name: The Climb

text: I'm right here with you.
name: The Climb

text: What's wrong with him?
name: The Climb

text: The visions take their toll.
name: The Climb

text: He's having one now?
name: The Climb

text: I saw Jon Snow.
name: The Climb

text: You saw him?
name: The Climb

text: At Castle Black?
name: The Climb

text: He was on the wrong side of the Wall... surrounded by enemies.
name: The Climb

text: Used to be you couldn't find a tree within a mile of the Wall.
name: The Climb

text: Crows would come out every morning with axes.
name: The Climb

text: Your flock gets smaller every year.
name: The Climb

text: You ever climbed it before?
name: The Climb

text: No.
name: The Climb

text: But Tormund's done it half a hundred times.
name: The Climb

text: You're afraid.
name: The Climb

text: Aren't you?
name: The Climb

text: Aye.
name: The Climb

text: It's a long way up and a long way down.
name: The Climb

text: But I've waited my whole life to see the world from up there.
name: The Climb

text: Here, sit down. I brought a pair for you.
name: The Climb

text: They're too big for you, but they're good.
name: The Climb

text: You kill someone for them?
name: The Climb

text: Nah. I didn't kill him, but I bet his balls are still bruised.
name: The Climb

text: He wasn't good to me the way you're good to me.
name: The Climb

text: He didn't do that thing you do with your tongue.
name: The Climb

text: Can we not talk about that here?
name: The Climb

text: ( mocking ) "Can we not talk about that here?
name: The Climb

text: I'm Jon Snow.
name: The Climb

text: I've killed dead men and Qhorin Halfhand, but I'm scared of naked girls."
name: The Climb

text: Did I seem scared the other day?
name: The Climb

text: You were trembling like a leaf.
name: The Climb

text: Only in the beginning.
name: The Climb

text: ( chuckles )
name: The Climb

text: Only in the beginning.
name: The Climb

text: You're a proper lover, Jon Snow. And don't worry. Your secret's safe with me.
name: The Climb

text: What secret?
name: The Climb

text: Do you think I'm as dumb as all those girls in silk dresses you knew growing up?
name: The Climb

text: You're loyal and you're brave. You didn't stop being a crow the day you walked into Mance Rayder's tent.
name: The Climb

text: But I'm your woman now, Jon Snow.
name: The Climb

text: You're going to be loyal to your woman.
name: The Climb

text: The Night's Watch don't care if you live or die.
name: The Climb

text: Mance Rayder don't care if I live or die.
name: The Climb

text: We're just soldiers in their armies and there's plenty more to carry on if we go down.
name: The Climb

text: It's you and me that matters to me and you.
name: The Climb

text: Don't ever betray me.
name: The Climb

text: I won't.
name: The Climb

text: 'Cause I'll cut your pretty cock right off and wear it 'round my neck.
name: The Climb

text: Sink your metal deep and make sure it holds before taking your next step.
name: The Climb

text: And if you fall, don't scream.
name: The Climb

text: You don't want that to be the last thing she remembers.
name: The Climb

text: ( laughs )
name: The Climb

text: Arya: Joffrey.
name: The Climb

text: Cersei.
name: The Climb

text: Ilyn Payne.
name: The Climb

text: You're good.
name: The Climb

text: You're not as good as you think you are.
name: The Climb

text: Face, tits, balls-- I hit 'em right where I wanted to.
name: The Climb

text: Aye, but you took your sweet time of it.
name: The Climb

text: You won't be fighting straw men, little lady.
name: The Climb

text: Show me your position.
name: The Climb

text: Keep your elbow high.
name: The Climb

text: You want your back doing the hard labor.
name: The Climb

text: You're holding.
name: The Climb

text: Never hold.
name: The Climb

text: What?
name: The Climb

text: Your muscles tense up when you hold.
name: The Climb

text: Pull the string back to the center of your chin and release.
name: The Climb

text: Never hold.
name: The Climb

text: But I have to aim.
name: The Climb

text: Never aim.
name: The Climb

text: Never aim?
name: The Climb

text: Your eye knows where it wants the arrow to go. Trust your eye.
name: The Climb

text: There's someone out there.
name: The Climb

text: That's about far enough.
name: The Climb

text: We come as friends.
name: The Climb

text: Anguy: Begging your pardon, m'lady, but we'll be the judge of that. Valar morghulis.
name: The Climb

text: Thoros:
name: The Climb

text: Valar dohaeris.
name: The Climb

text: My friends here don't speak High Valyrian.
name: The Climb

text: Why are you here, my lady?
name: The Climb

text: Forgive my manners.
name: The Climb

text: I don't see many ladies these days.
name: The Climb

text: Lucky for the ladies.
name: The Climb

text: How many times has the Lord brought him back?
name: The Climb

text: Six.
name: The Climb

text: I've always been a terrible priest.
name: The Climb

text: Drank too much rum.
name: The Climb

text: f*cked all the whores in King's Landing.
name: The Climb

text: It's a terrible thing to say, but by the time I came to Westeros, I didn't believe in our Lord.
name: The Climb

text: I decided that He, that all the gods, were stories we told the children to make them behave.
name: The Climb

text: So I wore the robes and every now and then I'd recite the prayers, but it was just for show.
name: The Climb

text: A spectacle for the locals.
name: The Climb

text: Until the Mountain drove a lance through this one's heart. I knelt beside his cold body and said the old words. Not because I believed in them, but... he was my friend and he was dead. And they were the only words I knew.
name: The Climb

text: And for the first time in my life, the Lord replied.
name: The Climb

text: Beric's eyes opened and I knew the truth.
name: The Climb

text: Our god is the one true god. And all men must serve Him.
name: The Climb

text: You've been to the other side.
name: The Climb

text: The other side?
name: The Climb

text: There is no other side.
name: The Climb

text: I have been to the darkness, my lady.
name: The Climb

text: He sent you to us for a reason.
name: The Climb

text: You have someone He needs.
name: The Climb

text: Anguy: Bodkin point.
name: The Climb

text: Penetrates plate at 200 yards.
name: The Climb

text: Can you make 'em?
name: The Climb

text: Yeah, nothing tricky about it.
name: The Climb

text: Just need decent steel.
name: The Climb

text: I'll get you the steel.
name: The Climb

text: Man: Come on.
name: The Climb

text: Arya: I don't like that woman.
name: The Climb

text: That's 'cause you're a girl.
name: The Climb

text: What does that have to do with anything?
name: The Climb

text: Forgive me, lad.
name: The Climb

text: What are you doing? Let go of him.
name: The Climb

text: Tell them to stop.
name: The Climb

text: Come on.
name: The Climb

text: He wants to be one of you.
name: The Climb

text: He wants to join the Brotherhood. Stop them!
name: The Climb

name: The Climb

text: We serve the Lord of Light and the Lord of Light needs this boy.
name: The Climb

text: Did the Lord of Light tell you that or did she?
name: The Climb

text: You're not doing this for your god.
name: The Climb

text: You're doing it for gold.
name: The Climb

text: We're doing it for both, girl.
name: The Climb

text: We can't defend the people without weapons and horses and food. And we can't get weapons and horses and food without gold.
name: The Climb

text: Gendry: You told me this was a Brotherhood.
name: The Climb

text: You told me I could be one of you.
name: The Climb

text: You are more than they can ever be.
name: The Climb

text: They're just foot soldiers in the great war.
name: The Climb

text: You will make kings rise and fall.
name: The Climb

text: You're a witch. You're going to hurt him.
name: The Climb

text: I see a darkness in you.
name: The Climb

text: And in that darkness, eyes staring back at me-- brown eyes, blue eyes, green eyes.
name: The Climb

text: Eyes you'll shut forever.
name: The Climb

text: We will meet again.
name: The Climb

text: ( horse neighs )
name: The Climb

text: ( wheels squeaking )
name: The Climb

text: ( pickaxes clanging )
name: The Climb

text: You staring at my ass, Jon Snow?
name: The Climb

text: You all right?
name: The Climb

text: Just seeing if you can take a hit, lad.
name: The Climb

text: ( laughing )
name: The Climb

text: ( horn blowing )
name: The Climb

text: ( gasps )
name: The Climb

text: Sorry. Were you sleeping?
name: The Climb

text: Wa--
name: The Climb

text: Wa--? Wa--?
name: The Climb

text: Water?
name: The Climb

text: You want some water.
name: The Climb

text: I wish I had some for you.
name: The Climb

text: ( whimpering )
name: The Climb

text: So let's play a game.
name: The Climb

text: Which body part do you need the least?
name: The Climb

text: Please.
name: The Climb

text: Please is not a body part.
name: The Climb

text: I'll tell you everything, please.
name: The Climb

text: But you've already told me everything. Remember? Your daddy was mean to you. The Starks didn't
name: The Climb

text: appreciate you.
name: The Climb

text: One good bit, though.
name: The Climb

text: The Stark boys, they're still alive.
name: The Climb

text: Wouldn't that be a hunt to remember?
name: The Climb

text: You failed, but I'm a better hunter than you.
name: The Climb

text: Now... how about your little finger?
name: The Climb

text: You don't use that for much, do you?
name: The Climb

text: No? Good.
name: The Climb

text: Let's start with that.
name: The Climb

text: ( groans )
name: The Climb

text: You've been wondering why you're here. Haven't you?
name: The Climb

text: Where you are. Who I am. Why I'm doing this to you. So guess. If you guess right,
name: The Climb

text: I'll tell you. By the old gods and the new, I swear it. You win the game if you can figure out who I am
name: The Climb

text: and why I'm torturing you and I win the game if you beg me to cut off your finger.
name: The Climb

text: If I win, you'll let me go?
name: The Climb

text: If you think this has a happy ending, you haven't been paying attention.
name: The Climb

text: Please.
name: The Climb

text: You say please again and you'll wish you hadn't.
name: The Climb

text: You first.
name: The Climb

text: Where are we?
name: The Climb

text: The North.
name: The Climb

text: Too vague.
name: The Climb

text: Deepwood Motte.
name: The Climb

text: ( laughing )
name: The Climb

text: Terrible guess.
name: The Climb

text: ( crying out )
name: The Climb

text: Now, where?
name: The Climb

text: Last Hearth.
name: The Climb

text: Do I look like a f*cking Umber to you?
name: The Climb

text: ( screams )
name: The Climb

text: Karhold!
name: The Climb

text: Karhold?
name: The Climb

text: How did you know that?
name: The Climb

text: Did you see any banners flying when we came in?
name: The Climb

text: No. It was just a guess.
name: The Climb

text: Very good, Lord Theon.
name: The Climb

text: And who am I?
name: The Climb

text: Torrhen Karstark.
name: The Climb

text: He's dead. Strangled by the Kingslayer.
name: The Climb

text: He was your brother.
name: The Climb

text: Your father is Lord Rickard Karstark.
name: The Climb

text: You swore to tell me if I--
name: The Climb

text: You're right.
name: The Climb

text: Lord Rickard Karstark is Robb Stark's bannerman.
name: The Climb

text: I betrayed Robb. That's why you're torturing me.
name: The Climb

text: Yes.
name: The Climb

text: You win.
name: The Climb

text: Of course, you forgot to ask one question. You forgot to ask if I'm a liar.
name: The Climb

text: ( screams )
name: The Climb

text: I'm afraid I am.
name: The Climb

text: ( screaming )
name: The Climb

text: Everything I told you is a lie.
name: The Climb

text: ( screaming )
name: The Climb

text: This isn't happening to you for a reason.
name: The Climb

text: Well, one reason-- I enjoy it.
name: The Climb

text: Please, cut it off! Cut it off! Cut it off!
name: The Climb

text: ( screaming )
name: The Climb

text: I win.
name: The Climb

text: Robb: Thank you for riding here so quickly.
name: The Climb

text: I know travel isn't easy in these times.
name: The Climb

text: The roads are crawling with cutthroats and bandits.
name: The Climb

text: But when the King of the North summons us, we come.
name: The Climb

text: Lothar: Our father has instructed us to tell you that his alliance with the North can continue
name: The Climb

text: if his terms are met.
name: The Climb

text: Lord Frey requires a formal apology for your violation of your sacred oath to marry one of his daughters.
name: The Climb

text: Of course. He deserves as much. I was in the wrong.
name: The Climb

text: As restitution for this betrayal, he demands Harrenhal and all its attendant lands.
name: The Climb

text: I don't think that's--
name: The Climb

text: We are fighting for the North.
name: The Climb

text: Harrenhal is not in the North.
name: The Climb

text: It is his once the war is over and we have no further strategic need for it.
name: The Climb

text: And there's something else.
name: The Climb

text: We will do whatever we can to give Lord Frey what he needs.
name: The Climb

text: Not what, whom.
name: The Climb

text: What?
name: The Climb

text: ( chuckles ) No.
name: The Climb

text: Our father requires Lord Edmure to wed one of his daughters-- Roslin.
name: The Climb

text: How old is she?
name: The Climb

text: Could I see her first?
name: The Climb

text: You want to count her teeth?
name: The Climb

text: We depart for the Twins in the morning.
name: The Climb

text: We need an answer before we leave and a wedding not more than a fortnight thereafter or this alliance is at an end.
name: The Climb

text: Your father does realize we're in the middle of a war?
name: The Climb

text: Father is old.
name: The Climb

text: It will put his heart at peace if he could see her wed to a good husband.
name: The Climb

text: And his recent experience has made him wary of long engagements.
name: The Climb

text: He has every right to be.
name: The Climb

text: Please excuse us while we discuss it.
name: The Climb

text: Why should I let that old ferret choose my bride for me?
name: The Climb

text: At the very least, I should be offered the same choice you were.
name: The Climb

text: I'm his liege lord.
name: The Climb

text: Robb: He's a proud man and we've wounded him.
name: The Climb

text: I didn't wound him.
name: The Climb

text: My answer is no.
name: The Climb

text: Listen to me and listen very carefully. You-- The laws of gods and men are very clear.
name: The Climb

text: No man can compel another man to marry.
name: The Climb

text: The laws of my fist are about to compel your teeth.
name: The Climb

text: It's all right. You heard him.
name: The Climb

text: If you refuse, our alliance with the Freys is dead.
name: The Climb

text: He's wanted me for one of his daughters since I was 12.
name: The Climb

text: He's not gonna stop wanting it now.
name: The Climb

text: When I say no, he will come back and offer me a daughter of my choosing.
name: The Climb

text: You're willing to risk our freedom and our lives for a chance at a prettier wife?
name: The Climb

text: I have a war to fight.
name: The Climb

text: We can't win it without them.
name: The Climb

text: I have no time to haggle.
name: The Climb

text: You said you wanted to make amends for the Stone Mill.
name: The Climb

text: You recall that heroic engagement?
name: The Climb

text: I had something less permanent in mind.
name: The Climb

text: I've won every battle, but I'm losing this war.
name: The Climb

text: If we don't do this and do it now, we're lost.
name: The Climb

text: I'll marry her.
name: The Climb

text: You're paying for my sins, Uncle.
name: The Climb

text: It's not fair or right.
name: The Climb

text: I'll remember it.
name: The Climb

text: Roose: I see my men have finally found you something appropriate to wear.
name: The Climb

text: Brienne: Yes. Most kind of them.
name: The Climb

text: You're a Stark bannerman, Lord Bolton.
name: The Climb

text: I am acting on Lady Stark's orders to return Jaime Lannister to King's Landing.
name: The Climb

text: When King Robb left Harrenhal, his mother was his prisoner.
name: The Climb

text: If she wasn't his mother, he'd have hanged her for treason.
name: The Climb

text: I should send you back to Robb Stark.
name: The Climb

text: You should.
name: The Climb

text: But instead, you're sitting here watching me fail at dinner.
name: The Climb

text: Why might that be?
name: The Climb

text: Wars cost money.
name: The Climb

text: Many people would pay a great deal for you.
name: The Climb

text: We both know who would pay the most.
name: The Climb

text: Or make you pay the most if he found out you had captured me and sent me back up north
name: The Climb

text: for a summary execution.
name: The Climb

text: You're right.
name: The Climb

text: Perhaps the safest thing to do is to kill you both and burn your bodies.
name: The Climb

text: It would be, if you honestly believed my father would never find out about it.
name: The Climb

text: King Robb is keeping your father quite busy.
name: The Climb

text: He doesn't have time for anything else.
name: The Climb

text: He'll make time for you.
name: The Climb

text: As soon as you're well enough to travel, I will allow you to go to King's Landing
name: The Climb

text: as restitution for the mistakes my soldiers made.
name: The Climb

text: And you will swear to tell your father the truth, that I had nothing to do with your maiming.
name: The Climb

text: Shall we drink on it?
name: The Climb

text: I don't partake.
name: The Climb

text: You do understand how suspicious that is to ordinary people?
name: The Climb

text: Very well.
name: The Climb

text: My lady, may our journey continue without further incident.
name: The Climb

text: Oh, she won't be going with you.
name: The Climb

text: I am charged with bringing Ser Jaime to--
name: The Climb

text: You are charged with abetting treason.
name: The Climb

text: I'm afraid I must insist.
name: The Climb

text: You're in no place to insist on anything.
name: The Climb

text: I would have hoped you'd learned your lesson about overplaying your position.
name: The Climb

text: Olenna: Impossible.
name: The Climb

text: Why?
name: The Climb

text: My grandson is the pride of Highgarden.
name: The Climb

text: The most desirable bachelor in all seven kingdoms.
name: The Climb

text: Your daughter--
name: The Climb

text: Is rich, the most beautiful woman in all seven kingdoms... and the mother of the king.
name: The Climb

text: Old.
name: The Climb

text: Old?
name: The Climb

text: Old.
name: The Climb

text: I'm something of an expert on the subject.
name: The Climb

text: Her change will be upon her before long.
name: The Climb

text: I'll spare you the details of what will happen then.
name: The Climb

text: You men may have a stomach for bloodshed and slaughter, but this is another matter entirely.
name: The Climb

text: The years punish us as well, I promise you that.
name: The Climb

text: My stomach remains quite strong, however.
name: The Climb

text: The only thing that might turn it are details of your grandson's nocturnal activities.
name: The Climb

text: Do you deny them?
name: The Climb

text: Oh, not at all.
name: The Climb

text: A sword swallower through and through.
name: The Climb

text: And a boy with his affliction should be grateful for the opportunity to marry the most beautiful
name: The Climb

text: woman in the kingdoms and remove the stain from his name.
name: The Climb

text: Did you grow up with boy cousins, Lord Tywin?
name: The Climb

text: Sons of your father's bannermen, squires, stable boys?
name: The Climb

text: Of course.
name: The Climb

text: And you never...
name: The Climb

text: No.
name: The Climb

text: Not once? Not in any way?
name: The Climb

text: Never.
name: The Climb

text: I congratulate you upon your restraint.
name: The Climb

text: But it's a natural thing, two boys having a go at each other beneath the sheets.
name: The Climb

text: Perhaps Highgarden has a high tolerance for unnatural behavior.
name: The Climb

text: I wouldn't say that.
name: The Climb

text: True, we don't tie ourselves in knots over a discreet bit of buggery, but...
name: The Climb

text: brothers and sisters-- where I come from, that stain would be very difficult to wash out.
name: The Climb

text: I will not breathe further life into a malicious lie by discussing it.
name: The Climb

text: Lie or not, you must admit many people find it quite convincing.
name: The Climb

text: Convincing enough to put swords in their hands and send them off to kill Lannisters and Tyrells thanks to
name: The Climb

text: our new affiliation.
name: The Climb

text: I don't care what people believe.
name: The Climb

text: And neither do you.
name: The Climb

text: ( chuckles ) As an authority on myself, I must disagree.
name: The Climb

text: Now, if the rumors about my children were true, then Joffrey is no king at all and House Tyrell is throwing its prized flower into the dirt.
name: The Climb

text: And if Cersei is too old to give Loras children, we're throwing another prized flower into the dirt.
name: The Climb

text: It is a chance we simply cannot take.
name: The Climb

text: The uncertainty makes you uncomfortable.
name: The Climb

text: All right.
name: The Climb

text: I'll remove it for you.
name: The Climb

text: If you refuse to marry Loras to Cersei, I will name him to the Kingsguard.
name: The Climb

text: I'm sure you're familiar with the Kingsguard vows.
name: The Climb

text: He will never marry.
name: The Climb

text: He will never have children.
name: The Climb

text: Oh...
name: The Climb

text: The Tyrell name will fade.
name: The Climb

text: And a beauty at that.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: I don't see the problem.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Shae isn't going to like it.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Shae is a whore.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Are you gonna marry her? Eh?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: How did marrying a whore work out for you the first time?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: I should never have told you about that.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: You want Shae, keep her. Wed one and bed the other.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: All you have to do is get a son in the Stark girl.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: He'll be Lord of Winterfell one day.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: You can rule the North in his name.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: You'll have two women and a whole kingdom of your own.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Two women to despise me and a whole kingdom to join them.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: You waste time trying to get people to love you, you'll end up the most popular dead man in town.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: ( chuckling )
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: You want to f*ck that Stark girl.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: You just don't want to admit it.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: I don't pay you to put evil notions in my head.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: The ones already there don't need company.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: You pay me to kill people who bother you.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Evil notions come free.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: ( doors close )
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Your Grace.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Grandfather.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: You wanted to speak to me?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Yes.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: I'd like a report on the meetings of my small council.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: You're welcome to attend the meetings of your small council, Your Grace.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Any or all of them.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: I've been very busy.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Many important matters require a king's attention.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Of course.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: You've been holding the council meetings in the Tower of the Hand instead of the small council chamber.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: I have, yes.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: May I ask why?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: The Tower of the Hand is where I work.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: To walk from there to here would take time, time I could otherwise spend productively.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: So if I wanted to attend a council meeting, I would now have to climb all the stairs in the Tower of the Hand?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: We could arrange to have you carried.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Tell me about the Targaryen girl in the east and her dragons.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Where did you hear about this?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Is it true?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Apparently so.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Don't you think we ought to do something about it?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: When I was Hand of the King under your father's predecessor, the skulls of all the Targaryen dragons
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: were kept in this room.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: The skull of the last of them was right here.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: It was the size of an apple.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: And the biggest was the size of a carriage.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Yes, and the creature to whom it belonged died 300 years ago.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Curiosities on the far side of the world are no threat to us.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: But how do we know these dragons are just curiosities and not the beasts that brought the whole world to heel?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Because we have been told as much by the many experts who serve the realm by counseling the king on matters about which he knows nothing.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: But I haven't been counseled.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: You are being counseled at this very moment.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: I should be consulted about such things.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: From now on, I will see to it that you are appropriately consulted on important matters whenever necessary.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Your Grace.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Yunkai.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: The Yellow City.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Barristan: The Yunkish train bed slaves, not soldiers.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: We can defeat them.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: On the field, with ease.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: But they won't meet us on the field.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: They have provisions, patience, and strong walls.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: If they're wise, they'll hide behind those walls and chip away at us, man by man.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: I don't want half my army killed before I've crossed the Narrow Sea.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: We don't need Yunkai, khaleesi.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Taking this city will not bring you any closer to Westeros or the Iron Throne.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: How many slaves are there in Yunkai?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: 200,000, if not more.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Then we have 200,000 reasons to take the city.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: ( drum beating )
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: ( drumming stops )
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Now comes the noble Razdal mo Eraz of that ancient and honorable house, master of men and speaker to savages,
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: to offer terms of peace.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: ( dragons screech )
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Noble lord, you are in the presence of Daenerys Stormborn of House Targaryen, Queen of the Andals and the First Men, Khaleesi of the Great Grass Sea, Breaker of Chains, and Mother of Dragons.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: You may approach.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Sit.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Will the noble lord take refreshment?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Ancient and glorious is Yunkai.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Our empire was old before dragons stirred in old Valyria.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Many an army has broken against our walls.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: You shall find no easy conquest here, khaleesi.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: ( screeching )
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Good. My Unsullied need practice.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: I was told to blood them early.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: If blood is your desire, blood shall flow.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: But why?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: 'Tis true you have committed savageries in Astapor.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: But the Yunkai are a forgiving and generous people.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: The wise masters of Yunkai have sent a gift for the silver queen.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: There is far more than this awaiting you on the deck of your ship.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: My ship?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Yes, khaleesi.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: As I said, we are a generous people.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: You shall have as many ships as you require.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: And what do you ask in return?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: All we ask is that you make use of these ships. Sail them back to Westeros where you belong and leave us to conduct our affairs in peace.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: I have a gift for you as well.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Your life.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: My life?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: And the lives of your wise masters.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: But I also want something in return. You will release every slave in Yunkai. Every man, woman, and child
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: shall be given as much food, clothing, and property as they can carry as payment for their years of servitude. Reject this gift, and I shall show you no mercy.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: You are mad.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: We are not Astapor or Qarth.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: We are Yunkai and we have powerful friends.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Friends who would take great pleasure in destroying you.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Those who survive, we shall enslave once more.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Perhaps we'll make a slave of you as well.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: ( screeching )
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: You swore me safe conduct.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: I did, but my dragons made no promises. And you threatened their mother.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Take the gold.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: ( screeching )
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: My gold. You gave it to me, remember?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: And I shall put it to good use.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: You'd be wise to do the same with my gift to you.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Now get out.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: ( speaking Valyrian )
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: The Yunkish are a proud people.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: They will not bend.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: And what happens to things that don't bend?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: He said he had powerful friends.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Who was he talking about?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: I don't know.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Find out.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: ( screeches )
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: ( purring )
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Chains?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Solid gold from the mines outside Lannisport.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Smithed in Casterly Rock.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Golden chains.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: You could buy a ship with these.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Do I need a ship?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: What?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Am I going somewhere?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Of course you're not going anywhere.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: So, am I invited to your wedding?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: I didn't want it.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: No?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: She's a beautiful girl. You said so yourself.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: That doesn't mean that-- this is duty, not desire.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Is that what you will tell yourself when you f*ck her?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: I don't have a choice.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: My father-- Does not rule the world.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: We can still go across the Narrow Sea.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: What would I do there?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Juggle?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: I am a Lannister of Casterly Rock.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: And I'm Shae the funny whore.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: My feelings for you have not changed.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: I will marry Sansa Stark and do my duty by her.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: No?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: What will it be like?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: You will have fine clothes, guards to keep you safe, servants.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Any children we might have will be well provided for.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Who would be killed in their sleep if their grandfather found out about them?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Listen.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Haven't you ever wondered where your strength came from?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Your talent for fighting?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: I'm lowborn.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: As low as can be.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: My mother was a tavern wench.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Mine was a slave.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: So was I.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Bought and sold, scourged and branded, until the Lord of Light reached down,
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: took me in his hand and raised me up.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: I was born in Flea Bottom.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Your blood is noble.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Are you saying my father, he was some lord or... There.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Your father's house.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: I'm just a b*st*rd.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: The b*st*rd of Robert of the House Baratheon, First of His Name, King of the Andals and the First Men.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Why do you think the gold cloaks wanted you?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: There is power in a king's blood.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Come sit by the fire, child.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: Not talking, eh?
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: You took the gold and you gave him up.
name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

text: He's not my one true god.

text: No?

name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

name: The Rains of Castamere

text: The Watch protects him.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Not today they don't.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: He's selling horses, he's got some gold in there.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Tormund: And proper steel.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Let's carve him up.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: We just take the horses and go.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: The old man's no threat.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: I keep telling you.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: He's an old man.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: A spear through the heart's a better way to die than coughing up your last with no one but your horses to hear.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: The Watch might send a few men looking for a horse thief.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: They'll send a lot more to hunt down murderers.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: I hope so.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Killing crows in their castle is tough.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Killing them out here in the open, that's what we do.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Spread out.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Surround the hut and move in.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( sword clangs )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( snorts )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( neighing )
name: The Rains of Castamere

name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Ygritte!
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Man:Clear the barn!
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: No one's going to believe you're a hog farmer if you eat them all.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Best part of the animal.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Don't worry. They're still there.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: I know they're still there.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: You check every five minutes like you're afraid they're gonna move.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: I'm not afraid.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Of course you are.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: You're almost there and you're afraid you won't make it.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: The closer you get, the worse the fear gets.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: No point in trying to hide behind that face.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: I know fear when I see it.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Seen it a lot.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: I knew fear when I saw it in you.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: You're afraid of fire.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: When Beric's sword went up in flames, you looked like a scared little girl.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: And I know why, too.I heard whatyour brother did to you.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Pressed your face to the fire like you're a nice juicy mutton chop.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: That give you some ideas?
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Might do.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Go ahead, then.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: You might get away.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Might even make it there on your own.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: They're just over the river.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: The closest you've been to family since Ilyn Payne snipped your daddy's neck.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Someday I'm gonna put a sword through your eye and out the back of your skull.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( thunder rumbling )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( thunder crashes )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: How are we going to get past the Wall?
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: My uncle said it's 700 feet high.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( thunder crashes )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: How did you get past it?
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Got in a boat and rowed past the Bay of Seals.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: It would take us two months to get to the Bay of Seals.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Some climb straight up the ice.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Even Hodor's not strong enough to climb the Wall with me on his back.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Hodor.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: 19 castles guard the Wall.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( thunder booms )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Only three are still manned.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Hodor!
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: One of those abandoned fortresses will give us a way through.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: My uncle said the gates were sealed with ice and stone when the castles were deserted.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Well, we'll have to open them up again.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( hoofbeats, horse neighs )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Whoa, whoa, whoa!
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Meera: There's a rider out there.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Just one?
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( thunder crashes )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Meera: There's more.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Hodor!
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( horses neighing )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Shh. Shh.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: It's just thunder, sweet giant.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Hodor.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Man: I yield.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: =- I yield.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Wildlings.
name: The Rains of Castamere

name: The Rains of Castamere

text: =- Hunting.

name: The Rains of Castamere

text: =- ( thunder crashes )

text: Hodor!

name: The Rains of Castamere

name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Hodor!
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: You need to keep quiet.

text: Ah! Hodor!

text: Hodor, calm down.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Hodor! Hodor!
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Hodor, be quiet!
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: What did you do?
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Nothing.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: I don't know.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( horse screaming )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: What's that?
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: That's a horse dying.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Man:Bring them over here.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Man #2: That was the last of them. The rest are dead.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Orell: I heard shouting up there.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Thunder.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: I know the difference between shouting and thunder.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Maybe it's ghosts.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( laughs )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( eagle screeching )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: That won't help you, grandpa.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Where you riding?
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Doesn't matter now, does it?
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: No, it doesn't matter now.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Cut his throat or he'll tell the crows we're here.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: You understand.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Let me stand at least.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Let me go
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: with a bit of dignity.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Make the crow kill him.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: You're one of us now.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Prove it.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: The wolves are out there.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: I can't do it by choice.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: I don't know how.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: It happens in my dreams.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: You're a warg, Bran.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: It's in your blood.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: I can't.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: You just did with him.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: A wolf is nothing compared to that.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: She looks sharp.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( muttering prayer )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Do it.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Do it.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: I told you.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: He's still one of them.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Go on, boy.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Go on!
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( groans )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: He's a crow.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: He'll always be a crow.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: And here's his crow wife guarding him.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: He'll stab us in the back first chance he gets.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Kill him.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( Jon shouts )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( screaming )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: He's one of them.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: No!
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Do you hear me?
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( screams )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: You're not gonna die for one of them.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Do it.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: They'll find us if you don't.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( swords clanging )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( breathing heavily )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( growling )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( Orell shouts )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( gasps )
name: The Rains of Castamere

name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( Jon screaming )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Hyah!
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Daario: When you hear a songbird's whistle, you come.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: I'm a great whistler. The greatest in the land.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( guard shouts in Valyrian )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Daario Naharis.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( whistling )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Daario: That one was quick.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: There may be others.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: I doubt it.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: The Yunkish prefer to let their slaves do their fighting for them.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( guards shouting )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: That's what you call a few guards?
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( guards shouting )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( men shouting )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Come on!
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: What do you got, huh?
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( cheering )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Lord Edmure...
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: I hope I'm not a disappointment to you.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: ( chuckles )
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: You're a delight to me, my lady.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: You may now cloak the bride and bring her under your protection.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: In the sight of the Seven, I hereby seal these two souls, binding them as one for eternity.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Look upon each other
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: and say the words.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Both:Father, Smith, Warrior, Mother, Maiden, Crone, Stranger...
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: I am hers...
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: I am his...
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: and she is mine...
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: and he is mine...
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Both: ...from this dayuntil the end of my days.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Is that safe?
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: They're long gone.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: You were right. I can get inside Summer's mind whenever I want.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Of course you can.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: North of the Wall there are wildlings who can control all sorts of animals.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: But you did a lotmore than that.You got inside Hodor's mind.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: They can't do that north of the Wall?
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: No one can do that...anywhere.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: When I was looking through Summer's eyes,
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: I saw Jon.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Where?
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: He was with the wildlings.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: They tried to kill him,
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: but he got away.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: Osha: He'll be heading back
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: to Castle Black, then.
name: The Rains of Castamere

text: You will release every slave in Yunkai. Reject this gift and I shall show you no mercy.
name: Mhysa

text: You are mad.
name: Mhysa

text: It was just as you said.
name: Mhysa

text: Their slave soldiers threw down their spears and surrendered.
name: Mhysa

text: Locke: The bitch stays.
name: Mhysa

text: I'm taking her to King's Landing.
name: Mhysa

text: Unless you kill me.
name: Mhysa

text: Well, we must be on our way.
name: Mhysa

text: ( bear roars )
name: Mhysa

text: ( sobbing ) Please.
name: Mhysa

text: I'm not killing you.
name: Mhysa

text: Just making a few alterations.
name: Mhysa

text: No! Don't!
name: Mhysa

text: Sam: The Nightfort's closest to Castle Black.
name: Mhysa

text: It's got a secret sally port, the Black Gate, as old as the Wall itself. It leads through the Wall right down into the Nightfort.
name: Mhysa

text: Stop.
name: Mhysa

text: But your father-- I won't share your bed. Not until you want me to.
name: Mhysa

text: What if I never want you to?
name: Mhysa

text: And so my watch begins.
name: Mhysa

text: He's a crow. He'll stab us in the back first chance he gets.
name: Mhysa

text: Kill him.
name: Mhysa

text: ( grunts )
name: Mhysa

text: The wolves are out there.
name: Mhysa

text: You're a warg, Bran. Do it.
name: Mhysa

text: I'm going beyond the Wall. It won't be safe for Rickon.
name: Mhysa

text: I'm coming with you. You and Osha and Shaggydog head for the Last Hearth.
name: Mhysa

text: She's just going to kill him.
name: Mhysa

text: Sacrifice him.
name: Mhysa

text: The boy's your nephew.
name: Mhysa

text: The usurper Robb Stark...
name: Mhysa

text: She says there's power in king's blood.
name: Mhysa

text: Got salt pork for the feast.
name: Mhysa

text: The feast is over.
name: Mhysa

text: Robb!
name: Mhysa

text: Mother.
name: Mhysa

text: The Lannisters send their regards.
name: Mhysa

text: It's too late.
name: Mhysa

name: Mhysa

text: ( weapons clashing )
name: Mhysa

name: Mhysa

text: ( screaming )
name: Mhysa

text: Yah! Yah!
name: Mhysa

name: Mhysa

name: Mhysa

text: The King in the North!
name: Mhysa

text: The King in the North!
name: Mhysa

text: ( horse neighs )
name: Mhysa

text: The King in the North!
name: Mhysa

text: The King in the North!
name: Mhysa

text: Man: Here comes the King in the North!
name: Mhysa

text: ( knights chanting ) Here comes the King in the North!
name: Mhysa

text: The King in the North! The King in the North!
name: Mhysa

text: Here comes...
name: Mhysa

text: ( all cheering )
name: Mhysa

text: ( men chuckle )
name: Mhysa

text: Hmm.
name: Mhysa

text: Ser Eldrick Sarsfield and Lord Desmond Crakehall.
name: Mhysa

text: What are you doing?
name: Mhysa

text: I have a list.
name: Mhysa

text: A list of people you mean to kill? For laughing at me?
name: Mhysa

text: Do I look like Joffrey to you?
name: Mhysa

text: No, death seems a bit extreme.
name: Mhysa

text: Fear of death, on the other hand... You should learn to ignore them.
name: Mhysa

text: My lady, people have been laughing at me far longer than they've been laughing at you.
name: Mhysa

text: I'm the Halfman, the Demon Monkey, the Imp. You're a Lannister.
name: Mhysa

text: I am the disgraced daughter of the traitor Ned Stark. The disgraced daughter and the Demon Monkey.
name: Mhysa

text: We're perfect for each other.
name: Mhysa

text: ( chuckles )
name: Mhysa

text: So how should we punish them?
name: Mhysa

text: Who? Whom?
name: Mhysa

text: Ser Eldrick Sarsfield and Lord Desmond Crakehall.
name: Mhysa

text: Ah.
name: Mhysa

text: I could speak to Lord Varys and learn their perversions.
name: Mhysa

text: Anyone named Desmond Crakehall must be a pervert.
name: Mhysa

text: I hear that you're a pervert.
name: Mhysa

text: I am the Imp. I have certain standards to maintain.
name: Mhysa

text: ( chuckles )
name: Mhysa

text: We could sheep shift Lord Desmond's bed. You cut a little hole in his mattress and you stuff sheep dung inside. Then you sew up the hole and make his bed again. His room will stink, but he won't know where it's coming from.
name: Mhysa

text: Lady Sansa!
name: Mhysa

text: My sister used to do that when she was angry with me. And she was always angry with me.
name: Mhysa

text: Why sheep shift?
name: Mhysa

text: That's the vulgar word for dung.
name: Mhysa

text: My lady...
name: Mhysa

text: Well, you asked me.
name: Mhysa

text: Women: Oh! ( giggle )
name: Mhysa

text: That's him!
name: Mhysa

text: My lord, my lady. Your father has called a meeting of the small council.
name: Mhysa

text: ( door closes )
name: Mhysa

text: Killed a few puppies today?
name: Mhysa

text: Show him. Come on, show him.
name: Mhysa

text: Oh, apologies, my lord.
name: Mhysa

text: Old fingers.
name: Mhysa

text: "Roslin caught a fine fat trout. Her brothers gave her a pair of wolf pelts for her wedding. Signed Walder Frey."
name: Mhysa

text: Is that bad poetry or is it supposed to mean something?
name: Mhysa

text: Robb Stark is dead.
name: Mhysa

text: ( laughing )
name: Mhysa

text: And his bitch mother.
name: Mhysa

text: Write back to Lord Frey. Thank him for his service and command him to send Robb Stark's head.
name: Mhysa

text: I'm going to serve it to Sansa at my wedding feast.
name: Mhysa

text: Your Grace, Lady Sansa is your aunt by marriage.
name: Mhysa

text: A joke. Joffrey did not mean it.
name: Mhysa

text: Yes, I did.
name: Mhysa

text: I'm going to have it served to Sansa at my wedding feast.
name: Mhysa

text: Tyrion: No.
name: Mhysa

text: She is no longer yours to torment.
name: Mhysa

text: Everyone is mine to torment. You'd do well to remember that, you little monster.
name: Mhysa

text: Oh, I'm a monster. Perhaps you should speak to me more softly, then. Monsters are dangerous and just now kings are dying like flies.
name: Mhysa

text: I could have your tongue out for saying that.
name: Mhysa

text: Let him make his threats. Hmm? He's a bitter little man.
name: Mhysa

text: Lord Tyrion should apologize immediately.
name: Mhysa

text: Unacceptable, disrespectful, and in very bad taste.
name: Mhysa

text: I am the king! I will punish you.
name: Mhysa

text: Any man who must say, "I am the king" is no true king. I'll make sure you understand that when I've won your war for you.
name: Mhysa

text: My father won the real war. He killed Prince Rhaegar. He took the crown while you hid under Casterly Rock!
name: Mhysa

text: The king is tired. See him to his chambers.
name: Mhysa

text: Come along.
name: Mhysa

text: I'm not tired.
name: Mhysa

text: We have so much to celebrate. A wedding to plan. You must rest.
name: Mhysa

text: Grand Maester, perhaps some essence of nightshade to help him sleep.
name: Mhysa

text: I'm not tired!
name: Mhysa

text: Come.
name: Mhysa

text: Not you.
name: Mhysa

text: You just sent the most powerful man in Westeros to bed without his supper.
name: Mhysa

text: You're a fool if you believe he's the most powerful man in Westeros.
name: Mhysa

text: A treasonous statement. Joffrey is king.
name: Mhysa

text: You really think a crown gives you power?
name: Mhysa

text: No.
name: Mhysa

text: I think armies give you power.
name: Mhysa

text: Mm-hmm.
name: Mhysa

text: Robb Stark had one, never lost a battle, and you defeated him all the same.
name: Mhysa

text: Mm-hmm.
name: Mhysa

text: Oh, I know.
name: Mhysa

text: Walder Frey gets all the credit. Or the blame, I suppose, depending on your allegiance.
name: Mhysa

text: Walder Frey is many things, but a brave man?
name: Mhysa

text: No. He never would have risked such an action if he didn't have certain assurances. Which he got from me.
name: Mhysa

text: Do you disapprove?
name: Mhysa

text: I'm all for cheating. This is war.
name: Mhysa

text: But to slaughter them at a wedding... Explain to me why it is more noble to kill 10,000 men in battle than a dozen at dinner.
name: Mhysa

text: So that's why you did it?
name: Mhysa

text: To save lives?
name: Mhysa

text: To end the war. To protect the family.
name: Mhysa

text: Do you want to write a song for the dead Starks? Go ahead, write one.
name: Mhysa

text: I'm in this world a little while longer to defend the Lannisters, to defend my blood.
name: Mhysa

text: The northerners will never forget.
name: Mhysa

text: Good.
name: Mhysa

text: Let them remember what happens when they march on the south.
name: Mhysa

text: All the Stark men are dead.
name: Mhysa

text: Winterfell is a ruin.
name: Mhysa

text: Roose Bolton will be named Warden of the North until your son by Sansa comes of age.
name: Mhysa

text: I believe you still have some work to do on that score.
name: Mhysa

text: Do you think she'll open her legs for me after I tell her how we murdered her mother and brother?
name: Mhysa

text: One way or another, you will get that girl pregnant.
name: Mhysa

text: I will not rape her.
name: Mhysa

text: Shall I explain to you in one easy lesson how the world works?
name: Mhysa

text: Use small words. I'm not as bright as you.
name: Mhysa

text: The house that puts family first will always defeat the house that puts the whims and wishes of its sons and daughters first.
name: Mhysa

text: A good man does everything in his power to better his family's position regardless of his own selfish desires.
name: Mhysa

text: Does that amuse you?
name: Mhysa

text: No, it's a very good lesson.
name: Mhysa

text: Only it's easy for you to preach utter devotion to family when you're making all the decisions.
name: Mhysa

text: Easy for me, is it?
name: Mhysa

text: When have you ever done something that wasn't in your interest but solely for the benefit of the family?
name: Mhysa

text: The day that you were born.
name: Mhysa

text: I wanted to carry you into the sea and let the waves wash you away. Instead, I let you live. And I brought you as my son. Because you're a Lannister.
name: Mhysa

text: Sansa.
name: Mhysa

text: It's empty.
name: Mhysa

text: Let's find a place to sleep.
name: Mhysa

text: ( wind howling )
name: Mhysa

text: ( echoing ) Hodor.
name: Mhysa

text: Hodor.
name: Mhysa

text: Don't, Hodor.
name: Mhysa

text: Maybe we shouldn't stay.
name: Mhysa

text: You'd rather be out there?
name: Mhysa

text: There are a lot of stories about this place. Horrible stories.
name: Mhysa

text: I always quite liked the horrible stories.
name: Mhysa

text: So did I.
name: Mhysa

text: Once.
name: Mhysa

text: You ever heard about the Rat Cook?
name: Mhysa

text: No. Who's he?
name: Mhysa

text: Just a cook in the Night's Watch. He was angry at the king for something,
name: Mhysa

text: I don't remember.
name: Mhysa

text: When the king was visiting the Nightfort, the cook killed the king's son, cooked him into a big pie with onions, carrots, mushrooms and bacon. That night he served the pie to the king. He liked the taste of his son so much, he asked for a second slice. The gods turned the cook into a giant white rat who could only eat his own young. He's been roaming the Nightfort ever since, devouring his own babies. But no matter what he does, he's always hungry.
name: Mhysa

text: ( chuckles )
name: Mhysa

text: If the gods turned every killer into a giant white rat-- It wasn't for murder the gods cursed the Rat Cook
name: Mhysa

text: or for serving the king's son in a pie.
name: Mhysa

text: He killed a guest beneath his roof.
name: Mhysa

text: ( distant clatter )
name: Mhysa

text: That's something the gods can't forgive.
name: Mhysa

text: ( rats squeaking )
name: Mhysa

text: "The late Walder Frey," old Tully called me because I didn't get my men to the Trident in time for battle.
name: Mhysa

text: He thought he was witty.
name: Mhysa

text: Look at us now, Tully. You're dead, your daughter's dead, your grandson's dead, your son spent his wedding night in a dungeon and I'm Lord of Riverrun.
name: Mhysa

text: ( laughs )
name: Mhysa

text: The Blackfish escaped.
name: Mhysa

text: An old man on the run with no allies.
name: Mhysa

text: I have Tywin Lannister backing me.
name: Mhysa

text: Who does he have?
name: Mhysa

text: As you say.
name: Mhysa

text: They all laughed at me, all those high lords. They all thought they were better than me.
name: Mhysa

text: Ned Stark, Hoster Tully.
name: Mhysa

text: People snigger when I marry a young girl, but who said a word when Jon Arryn married the little Tully bitch?
name: Mhysa

text: You'll be needing a new young girl.
name: Mhysa

text: Yeah. Got that to look forward to. And you, the Warden of the North.
name: Mhysa

text: No more Starks to bow and scrape to.
name: Mhysa

text: Must have been torture following that stupid boy all over the country.
name: Mhysa

text: He ignored my advice at every turn.
name: Mhysa

text: If he'd been a trifle less arrogant... Calling himself the Young Wolf.
name: Mhysa

text: How's that for pomposity?
name: Mhysa

text: ( chuckling )
name: Mhysa

text: Well, here's to the Young Wolf!
name: Mhysa

text: ( howls )
name: Mhysa

text: Forever young.
name: Mhysa

text: ( laughs )
name: Mhysa

text: Will you move to Winterfell now that the war's over?
name: Mhysa

text: At some point perhaps.
name: Mhysa

text: But Winterfell's in ruins.
name: Mhysa

text: Yeah.
name: Mhysa

text: What happened up there?
name: Mhysa

text: I heard the Greyjoy boy seized the place. I heard he killed all the ravens. And after that, nothing.
name: Mhysa

text: I sent my b*st*rd Ramsay to root him out.
name: Mhysa

text: Robb Stark offered amnesty for the ironborn if they gave us Theon.
name: Mhysa

text: Oh. And?
name: Mhysa

text: Ramsay delivered the terms.
name: Mhysa

text: The ironborn turned on Theon as we knew they would. They handed him over trussed and hooded.
name: Mhysa

text: But Ramsay-- well... Ramsay has his own way of doing things.
name: Mhysa

text: Well, the girls weren't lying. You had a good-sized cock.
name: Mhysa

text: What?
name: Mhysa

text: No.
name: Mhysa

text: Pork sausage.
name: Mhysa

text: You think I'm some sort of savage?
name: Mhysa

text: People talk about phantom limbs.
name: Mhysa

text: An amputee might have an itch where his foot used to be.
name: Mhysa

text: So I've always wondered... do eunuchs have a phantom cock?
name: Mhysa

text: Next time you think about naked girls, would you feel an itch?
name: Mhysa

text: Sorry. I shouldn't make jokes. My mother taught me not to throw stones at cripples. But my father taught me
name: Mhysa

text: to aim for their head.
name: Mhysa

text: ( quietly ) Kill me.
name: Mhysa

text: Sorry, what?
name: Mhysa

text: Kill me.
name: Mhysa

text: A little louder.
name: Mhysa

text: ( sobbing ) Kill me!
name: Mhysa

text: You're no good to me dead. We need you.
name: Mhysa

text: You don't look like a Theon Greyjoy anymore.
name: Mhysa

text: That's a name for a lord. But you're not a lord, are you? You're just meat.
name: Mhysa

text: ( groans )
name: Mhysa

text: Stinking meat.
name: Mhysa

text: ( sniffs )
name: Mhysa

text: You reek.
name: Mhysa

text: ( gasps ) Reek!
name: Mhysa

text: That's a good name for you.
name: Mhysa

text: What's your name?
name: Mhysa

text: Theon Greyjoy.
name: Mhysa

text: What's your name?
name: Mhysa

text: Th--
name: Mhysa

text: Theon Greyjoy.
name: Mhysa

text: ( groans )
name: Mhysa

text: Please.
name: Mhysa

text: What is your name?!
name: Mhysa

text: Reek.
name: Mhysa

text: My name is... Reek.
name: Mhysa

text: ( wind howling )
name: Mhysa

text: ( distant gasp )
name: Mhysa

text: ( gasps )
name: Mhysa

text: Hodor.
name: Mhysa

text: ( gasping continues )
name: Mhysa

text: ( growling )
name: Mhysa

text: ( scraping, footsteps approaching )
name: Mhysa

text: ( groaning )
name: Mhysa

text: ( shatters )
name: Mhysa

text: ( gasps )
name: Mhysa

text: ( shouting )
name: Mhysa

text: ( panting )
name: Mhysa

name: Mhysa

text: Don't kill me!
name: Mhysa

text: Who are you?
name: Mhysa

text: Sam! Sam!
name: Mhysa

text: Who are you?!
name: Mhysa

text: Gilly. Don't hurt us.
name: Mhysa

text: Where are you going?
name: Mhysa

text: To Castle Black. I'm a brother of the Night's Watch.
name: Mhysa

text: My brother, he's in the Night's--
name: Mhysa

text: Shush.
name: Mhysa

text: Who's your brother?
name: Mhysa

text: Doesn't matter.
name: Mhysa

text: ( Summer growling )
name: Mhysa

text: You're Jon's brother.
name: Mhysa

text: The one who fell from the window.
name: Mhysa

text: No, I'm not.
name: Mhysa

text: I've been around Ghost enough to know a direwolf when I see one. And I've heard all about Hodor.
name: Mhysa

text: Hodor.
name: Mhysa

text: I'd be dead if it wasn't for Jon.
name: Mhysa

text: If you're his brother, you're my brother, too.
name: Mhysa

text: And anything I can do to help you, I will.
name: Mhysa

text: Take us north of the Wall.
name: Mhysa

text: What?
name: Mhysa

text: Why in the world would you want to go--
name: Mhysa

text: I don't want to. I have to.
name: Mhysa

text: How did you get through the Wall?
name: Mhysa

text: Does the well lead to an underground river? Is that how you came here?
name: Mhysa

text: Come with us.
name: Mhysa

text: There are steps carved into the south side of the Wall. Hodor can carry you to the top.
name: Mhysa

text: We'll walk straight to Castle Black.
name: Mhysa

text: Come with us. There's nothing north but death.
name: Mhysa

text: Sam: If Jon is alive, then Castle Black's where he'll be.
name: Mhysa

text: It's the safest place for you.
name: Mhysa

text: There's nowhere safe any longer. You know that.
name: Mhysa

text: What I know is what I saw. And if you saw it, too, you'd run the other way.
name: Mhysa

text: You saw the white walkers and the army of the dead.
name: Mhysa

text: How do you know all that?
name: Mhysa

text: The Night's Watch can't stop them.
name: Mhysa

text: The kings of Westeros and all their armies can't stop them.
name: Mhysa

text: ( baby fussing )
name: Mhysa

text: But you're going to stop them?
name: Mhysa

text: Please, Sam.
name: Mhysa

text: I have to go north.
name: Mhysa

text: I have to.
name: Mhysa

text: ( seabirds screeching )
name: Mhysa

text: ( distant waves crashing )
name: Mhysa

text: "Balon Greyjoy, Lord of the Iron Islands and invader of the North. I give you until the full moon to order all ironborn scum out of the North and back to those shit-stained rocks you call a home. On the first night of the full moon, I will hunt down every islander still in our lands and flay them living the way I flayed the 20 ironborn scum I found at Winterfell. In the box you'll find a special gift-- Theon's favorite toy. He cried when I took it away from him.
name: Mhysa

text: Leave the North now or more boxes will follow with more Theon. Signed Ramsay Snow, natural-born son of Roose Bolton, Lord of the Dreadfort and Warden of the North."
name: Mhysa

text: Get that out of my sight.
name: Mhysa

text: Theon disobeyed my orders.
name: Mhysa

text: The boy is a fool. He cannot further the Greyjoy line.
name: Mhysa

text: I will not give up the lands I have seized, the strongholds I have taken.
name: Mhysa

text: Get this away from me. He's your son.
name: Mhysa

text: Son?
name: Mhysa

text: He's not a man anymore. He's your son. He's my brother. He's a Greyjoy.
name: Mhysa

text: Watch yourself.
name: Mhysa

text: I've made my decision.
name: Mhysa

text: And I've made mine.
name: Mhysa

text: I'm going to pick the fastest ship in our fleet. I'm going to choose the 50 best killers on the Iron Islands.
name: Mhysa

text: Man: Get those ropes!
name: Mhysa

text: Yara: I'm going to sail up the Narrow Sea all the way to the Weeping Water.
name: Mhysa

text: I'm going to march on the Dreadfort. I'm going to find my little brother
name: Mhysa

text: and I'm going to bring him home.
name: Mhysa

text: What is it?
name: Mhysa

text: Dragonglass.
name: Mhysa

text: We found them at the Fist. Someone buried them a long time ago.
name: Mhysa

text: Someone wanted us to find them.
name: Mhysa

text: Why? What are they for?
name: Mhysa

text: Killing white walkers.
name: Mhysa

text: How do you know that?
name: Mhysa

text: Gilly: The walker came for my baby.
name: Mhysa

text: And Sam...
name: Mhysa

text: But no one's killed a white walker in thousands of years.
name: Mhysa

text: Well, I suppose someone had to be the first.
name: Mhysa

text: Take it, Hodor. And the archer.
name: Mhysa

text: I got lucky with one of them.
name: Mhysa

text: There are more. Many more.
name: Mhysa

text: And for every one of them, the dead men, more than you could count.
name: Mhysa

text: I wish you'd come with us.
name: Mhysa

text: I wish I could. I really do.
name: Mhysa

text: How are you keeping?
name: Mhysa

text: Great. Never better.
name: Mhysa

text: It was just a bit of blood.
name: Mhysa

text: I should have known.
name: Mhysa

text: Every time a highborn asks my name, it's trouble.
name: Mhysa

text: We're not really people to you, are we? Just a million different ways to get what you want.
name: Mhysa

text: I'm not a highborn.
name: Mhysa

text: She called you Ser.
name: Mhysa

text: I heard it.
name: Mhysa

text: A recent state of affairs.
name: Mhysa

text: I was born in Flea Bottom just like you.
name: Mhysa

text: Sure, you were.
name: Mhysa

text: You're my friend. You're here to help.
name: Mhysa

text: I lived below the Street of Flour.
name: Mhysa

text: How far below?
name: Mhysa

text: How close to the Red Keep were you?
name: Mhysa

text: The sh1t that poured from their privy pipes flowed down the side of Aegon's Hill along Tanner's Row and right in front of my front door
name: Mhysa

text: on Gin Alley.
name: Mhysa

text: Gin Alley.
name: Mhysa

text: The Street of Steel, with your armor and your knights?
name: Mhysa

text: Pfft.
name: Mhysa

text: You lived in the fancy part of town.
name: Mhysa

text: And here we are now.
name: Mhysa

text: Two boys from Flea Bottom in the castle of a king.
name: Mhysa

text: Yeah, we've come a long way.
name: Mhysa

text: We're all the same, really.
name: Mhysa

text: She went to great pains to point that out to me.
name: Mhysa

text: If you mistrust fancy people so much, why were you in such a hurry to trust her?
name: Mhysa

text: You're me.
name: Mhysa

text: Never been with a woman. Never talked to a woman, really.
name: Mhysa

text: And then she comes at you-- big words, no clothes. What would you have done?
name: Mhysa

text: She does know her way around a man's head, I'll give her that.
name: Mhysa

text: ( both chuckle )
name: Mhysa

text: So how'd you become a lord?
name: Mhysa

text: Oh, that's a long story.
name: Mhysa

text: Better not, then. I'm a bit busy.
name: Mhysa

text: Many years ago I helped King Stannis out of a difficult situation. He rewarded me with a lordship.
name: Mhysa

text: And this.
name: Mhysa

text: You see?
name: Mhysa

text: Highborns.
name: Mhysa

text: I didn't want to be a lord. I nearly didn't accept.
name: Mhysa

text: Why did you?
name: Mhysa

text: I did it for my son. I didn't want him to step over a river of sh1t every time he stepped through his front door. I wanted him to have a better life.
name: Mhysa

text: Does he?
name: Mhysa

text: He's dead.
name: Mhysa

text: How'd he die?
name: Mhysa

text: Following me.
name: Mhysa

text: ( seabirds screeching )
name: Mhysa

text: ( bells dinging )
name: Mhysa

text: When did you come to this strange country?
name: Mhysa

text: When I was 13.
name: Mhysa

text: You were only a child.
name: Mhysa

text: I stopped being a child when I was nine. My mother made sure of that.
name: Mhysa

text: You've been a good influence on our mutual friend, you know.
name: Mhysa

text: He used to drink from sundown to sunup, visit three brothels a night, gamble away his father's money.
name: Mhysa

text: Now it's just the drinking. And now I'm his wife's servant. I brush her hair and clip her nails and empty her chamber pot. She is a sweet young thing. None of this is her fault. I love that girl. I would kill for her.
name: Mhysa

text: Do you think that makes it easier for me?
name: Mhysa

text: No, I expect not.
name: Mhysa

text: She's young and she's beautiful and highborn.
name: Mhysa

text: We break bread with them, but that doesn't make us family. We've learned their language, but we'll never be
name: Mhysa

text: their countrymen.
name: Mhysa

text: If you let yourself believe that a foreign girl with no name could spend her life with the son of Tywin Lannister--
name: Mhysa

text: I have a name.
name: Mhysa

text: You have one name.
name: Mhysa

text: As do I.
name: Mhysa

text: Here only the family name matters.
name: Mhysa

text: What do you want from me, Lord Varys?
name: Mhysa

text: Diamonds.
name: Mhysa

text: I'd tell you to beware carrying so much wealth, but you know how to protect yourself.
name: Mhysa

text: Get on one of those ships. Sail to Pentos or Lys or Myr.
name: Mhysa

text: You can buy a house with these diamonds, a very large house. Hire servants. Start a new life, a good life, far from here.
name: Mhysa

text: The mysterious foreign beauty.
name: Mhysa

text: You'll have suitors lining up.
name: Mhysa

text: Why do you want me to leave?
name: Mhysa

text: Tyrion Lannister is one of the few people alive who could make this country a better place.
name: Mhysa

text: He has the mind for it, he has the will, he has the right last name.
name: Mhysa

text: And you-- you are a complication.
name: Mhysa

text: I know you love him. And I know it's true love not bought by gold and silver. I'm not asking you
name: Mhysa

text: to leave him for money. I'm asking you to leave because your presence in the capital endangers him.
name: Mhysa

text: This will never be your home, my lady. Find a true home somewhere far from here... while there's still time.
name: Mhysa

text: Lord Varys.
name: Mhysa

text: If he wants me to leave, he can tell me himself.
name: Mhysa

text: Keep up.
name: Mhysa

text: I don't think I can, my lord. It's not easy being drunk all the time.
name: Mhysa

text: Everyone would do it if it were easy.
name: Mhysa

text: ( footsteps approaching )
name: Mhysa

text: Leave.
name: Mhysa

text: So, enjoying married life?
name: Mhysa

text: An unhappy wife is a wine merchant's best friend.
name: Mhysa

text: She doesn't deserve this.
name: Mhysa

text: Deserve? Be careful with that.
name: Mhysa

text: Start trying to work out who deserves what and before long you'll spend the rest of your days weeping for each and every person in the world.
name: Mhysa

text: There's nothing worse than a late-blooming philosopher.
name: Mhysa

text: ( chuckles )
name: Mhysa

text: Will you be facing your marriage to Ser Loras with the same philosophical spirit?
name: Mhysa

text: I won't be marrying Ser Loras.
name: Mhysa

text: I seem to remember saying something similar about my own marriage.
name: Mhysa

text: You're not me.
name: Mhysa

text: You want to make things better for Sansa? Give her a child.
name: Mhysa

text: So you can tell Father it was you who finally talked me into it?
name: Mhysa

text: So she can have some happiness in her life.
name: Mhysa

text: You have children.
name: Mhysa

text: How happy would you say you are?
name: Mhysa

text: Not very. But if it weren't for my children, I'd have thrown myself from the highest window in the Red Keep.
name: Mhysa

text: They're the reason I'm alive.
name: Mhysa

text: Even Joffrey?
name: Mhysa

text: Even Joffrey. He was all I had once. Before Myrcella was born. I used to spend hours looking at him.
name: Mhysa

text: His wisps of hair. His tiny little hands and feet. He was such a jolly little fellow.
name: Mhysa

text: You always hear the terrible ones were terrible babies.
name: Mhysa

text: "We should have known. Even then we should have known."
name: Mhysa

text: It's nonsense. Whenever he was with me, he was happy. And no one can take that away from me, not even Joffrey-- how it feels to have someone. Someone of your own.
name: Mhysa

text: How long does it go on?
name: Mhysa

text: Until we've dealt with all our enemies.
name: Mhysa

text: Every time we deal with an enemy, we create two more.
name: Mhysa

text: Then I suppose it will go on for quite a long time.
name: Mhysa

text: ( man laughing )
name: Mhysa

text: ( man #2 wailing )
name: Mhysa

text: ( both laughing )
name: Mhysa

text: I'm telling you, that's what she did.
name: Mhysa

text: ( wailing )
name: Mhysa

text: ( soldiers laughing )
name: Mhysa

text: Sounded like a cow in heat.
name: Mhysa

text: Aye, not for long.
name: Mhysa

text: That's right.
name: Mhysa

text: Black Walder shut her up right quick.
name: Mhysa

text: None of the Starks had much to say about the end of that meal.
name: Mhysa

text: I'll tell you what, though. The hardest thing was getting that wolf's head to stay on the body.
name: Mhysa
