name: First of His Name

text: It's a pleasure to make your acquaintance, Lady Arryn.
name: First of His Name

text: My name is Al--
name: First of His Name

text: Oh, do take down that hood, child.
name: First of His Name

text: Don't you think I know who you are?
name: First of His Name

text: You think I'd let my intended leave the Eyrie on urgent business without knowing what that business was?
name: First of His Name

text: I let him go so he could bring you here to me.
name: First of His Name

text: My flesh and blood.
name: First of His Name

text: It's wonderful to meet you, Aunt Lysa.
name: First of His Name

text: You mustn't call me that in front of anyone else.
name: First of His Name

text: Of course.
name: First of His Name

text: I understand.
name: First of His Name

text: No one can know you're here.
name: First of His Name

text: It would put us in a very precarious position.
name: First of His Name

text: I would never say a thing.
name: First of His Name

text: The Lannisters want to destroy us.
name: First of His Name

text: They've been trying for years.
name: First of His Name

text: Now they knowwhat it feels like.
name: First of His Name

text: Mummy said they killed your mother and they chopped off your brother's head.
name: First of His Name

text: They did, and my father's.
name: First of His Name

text: They killed my father, too, with poison.
name: First of His Name

text: I wanted to make the little Lannister baby man fly, but Mother said I couldn't.
name: First of His Name

text: Make him fly?
name: First of His Name

text: Through the Moon Door.
name: First of His Name

text: (giggles)
name: First of His Name

text: Lysa: And on top of everything else, they made you marry that filthy troll.
name: First of His Name

text: They did.
name: First of His Name

text: They made us both.
name: First of His Name

text: Lord Tyrion didn't want to.
name: First of His Name

text: Lysa: I don't believe that for a moment.
name: First of His Name

text: Did he force himself on you?
name: First of His Name

text: No.
name: First of His Name

text: We never--
name: First of His Name

text: Lysa: Good.
name: First of His Name

text: Robin, this is your cousin Sansa.
name: First of His Name

text: But you're not to call her Sansa in front of anyone but Uncle Petyr and myself.
name: First of His Name

text: Do you understand?
name: First of His Name

text: Sansa, this is my son Robin.
name: First of His Name

text: It's a pleasure to meet you, Robin.
name: First of His Name

text: Robin, show Sansa to her chamber.
name: First of His Name

text: Take the back stairs.
name: First of His Name

text: Go.
name: First of His Name

text: We'll speak soon.
name: First of His Name

text: What took you so long?
name: First of His Name

text: Arranging for the ascension of King Tommen I, extricating Sansa, getting her here alive.
name: First of His Name

text: She's here. We've spent more than enough time on her for one evening.
name: First of His Name

text: Let's get married tonight.
name: First of His Name

text: Ought we not... inform the Lords of the Vale about the ceremony?
name: First of His Name

text: There's only one Lord of the Vale.
name: First of His Name

text: The others can all hang.
name: First of His Name

text: Lurking and simpering on the stairs like buzzards the moment my husband died, trying to get their claws in me.
name: First of His Name

text: I do think that we could wait until--
name: First of His Name

text: I'm done waiting, Petyr.
name: First of His Name

text: We had our wedding night many years ago.
name: First of His Name

text: Or don't you remember?
name: First of His Name

text: Like it was yesterday.
name: First of His Name

text: What wife would do for you the things I've done for you?
name: First of His Name

text: What wife would trust you the way I've trusted you?
name: First of His Name

text: When you gave me those drops and told me to pour them into Jon's wine, my husband's wine-- when you told me to write a letter to Cat telling her it was the Lannisters--
name: First of His Name

text: (moans)
name: First of His Name

text: The deed is done.
name: First of His Name

text: Faded into nothing.
name: First of His Name

text: Only speaking of it can make it real.
name: First of His Name

text: Tonight it is, then.
name: First of His Name

text: (laughs)
name: First of His Name

text: Let me bathe and dress for the occasion.
name: First of His Name

text: Once I'm presentable, I'll call on the septon immediately.
name: First of His Name

text: I'm warning you.
name: First of His Name

text: I'm going to scream when my husband makes love to me.
name: First of His Name

text: I'm going to scream so loud, they'll hear me clear across the Narrow Sea.
name: First of His Name

text: (Lysa screaming)
name: First of His Name

text: (grunting, moaning)
name: First of His Name

text: (screaming)
name: First of His Name

text: (moaning, screaming continues)
name: First of His Name

text: When will the wedding take place in your mind?
name: First of His Name

text: As soon as decency permits.
name: First of His Name

text: After we've allowed Tommen the appropriate time to mourn his brother and Margaery to mourn her husband.
name: First of His Name

text: A fortnight?
name: First of His Name

text: That seems reasonable.
name: First of His Name

text: No jugglers, no jousting dwarves, no 77-course meals.
name: First of His Name

text: And your wedding to Loras?
name: First of His Name

text: Shortly after Tommen's.
name: First of His Name

text: Shortly?
name: First of His Name

text: A fortnight.
name: First of His Name

text: I know you don't like them.
name: First of His Name

text: I didn't like your husband.
name: First of His Name

text: Used to pat me on the back a lot.
name: First of His Name

text: I didn't trust him.
name: First of His Name

text: We had that in common.
name: First of His Name

text: You don't need to make formal alliances with people you trust.
name: First of His Name

text: Then whom can we trust?
name: First of His Name

text: Ourselves alone.
name: First of His Name

text: The Tyrells are our only true rivals in terms of resources and we need them on our side.
name: First of His Name

text: Robert wasn't particularly rich.
name: First of His Name

text: Robert had me funding him.
name: First of His Name

text: Wars swallow gold like a pit in the earth.
name: First of His Name

text: I suppose that explains why we did so well in the last one.
name: First of His Name

text: Do you know how much gold was mined in the Westerlands this past year?
name: First of His Name

text: Haven't a clue.
name: First of His Name

text: Go on, your best guess.
name: First of His Name

text: Pounds, tons, ounces?
name: First of His Name

text: Doesn't matter.
name: First of His Name

text: The answer is the same.
name: First of His Name

text: That can't be.
name: First of His Name

text: Our last working mine ran dry three years ago.
name: First of His Name

text: Then how do we pay for anything?
name: First of His Name

text: The crown owes the Iron Bank of Braavos a tremendous amount of money.
name: First of His Name

text: How much?
name: First of His Name

text: A tremendous amount.
name: First of His Name

text: There must be someone at the Iron Bank you can speak to, come to some arrangement.
name: First of His Name

text: The Iron Bank is the Iron Bank.
name: First of His Name

text: There is no someone.
name: First of His Name

text: Someone does work there.
name: First of His Name

text: It is comprised of people.
name: First of His Name

text: And a temple is comprised of stones.
name: First of His Name

text: One stone crumbles and another takes its place.
name: First of His Name

text: And the temple holds its form for 1,000 years or more.
name: First of His Name

text: That's what the Iron Bank is-- a temple.
name: First of His Name

text: We all live in its shadow and almost none of us know it.
name: First of His Name

text: You can't run from them.
name: First of His Name

text: You can't cheat them.
name: First of His Name

text: You can't sway them with excuses.
name: First of His Name

text: If you owe them money and you don't want to crumble yourself, you pay it back.
name: First of His Name

text: Vesting the Tyrells in the crown will help a great deal in this respect.
name: First of His Name

text: It's for the good of the family, I understand that.
name: First of His Name

text: I'm not sure my brothers do.
name: First of His Name

text: I know you're building a strong case against Tyrion.
name: First of His Name

text: And as a mother,that is your right.
name: First of His Name

text: But as a judge, I cannot discuss the trial with you.
name: First of His Name

text: I respect that.
name: First of His Name

text: We don't need to discuss it.
name: First of His Name

text: The Lannister legacy is the only thing that matters.
name: First of His Name

text: You've started wars to protect this family.
name: First of His Name

text: Turned your back on Jaime for refusing to contribute to its future.
name: First of His Name

text: What does Tyrion deserve for lighting that future on fire?
name: First of His Name

text: Arya:Joffrey.
name: First of His Name

text: Cersei.
name: First of His Name

text: Walder Frey.
name: First of His Name

text: Meryn Trant.
name: First of His Name

text: Tywin Lannister.
name: First of His Name

text: The Red Woman.
name: First of His Name

text: Beric Dondarrion.
name: First of His Name

text: Thoros of Myr.
name: First of His Name

text: Ilyn Payne.
name: First of His Name

text: The Mountain.
name: First of His Name

text: Would you shut up?
name: First of His Name

text: I can't sleep until I say the names.
name: First of His Name

text: The names of every f*cking person in Westeros?
name: First of His Name

text: Only the ones I'm going to kill.
name: First of His Name

text: (chuckles)
name: First of His Name

text: Hate's as good a thing as any to keep a person going.
name: First of His Name

text: Better than most.
name: First of His Name

text: We come across my brother, maybe we can both cross a name off our list.
name: First of His Name

text: If he were here right now, what would you do?
name: First of His Name

text: I'd tell him to shut the f*ck up so I can get some sleep.
name: First of His Name

text: Go on, get it over with, your list of doomed men.
name: First of His Name

text: I'm almost done.
name: First of His Name

text: Only one name left.
name: First of His Name

text: Go on.
name: First of His Name

text: The Hound.
name: First of His Name

text: Thank you.
name: First of His Name

text: Your mother always had a sweet tooth, you know?
name: First of His Name

text: Really?
name: First of His Name

text: Oh, yes.
name: First of His Name

text: At suppertime, she would go straight for honey cakes, candied almonds, custard.
name: First of His Name

text: Anything sweet.
name: First of His Name

text: Eventually, your grandfather had to assign a septa to watch her at meals.
name: First of His Name

text: Cat was the firstborn daughter after all.
name: First of His Name

text: It was important that she remain desirable so Father could arrange a good match for her and she was starting to get fat.
name: First of His Name

text: My mother fat?
name: First of His Name

text: She never let me have my pudding until I'd finished all my proper food.
name: First of His Name

text: This is before she married your father and moved to the North.
name: First of His Name

text: By the time you were born, your father's austerity had become hers.
name: First of His Name

text: Marriage changes people.
name: First of His Name

text: I didn't mean for you to stop.
name: First of His Name

text: Go on, enjoy them.
name: First of His Name

text: How do you like them?
name: First of His Name

text: They're delicious.
name: First of His Name

text: Where did you get the lemons?
name: First of His Name

text: You can't grow them up here.
name: First of His Name

text: Oh, gods, no.
name: First of His Name

text: Petyr had three crates brought all the way from King's Landing.
name: First of His Name

text: He knew you liked lemon cakes.
name: First of His Name

text: He's so kind.
name: First of His Name

text: He really cares for you.
name: First of His Name

text: Think where you'd be without him.
name: First of His Name

text: In their clutches and tried for murder.
name: First of His Name

text: Yes.
name: First of His Name

text: I'm very lucky.
name: First of His Name

text: He feels responsible for you.
name: First of His Name

text: Oh, I know he does.
name: First of His Name

text: I'm so grateful.
name: First of His Name

text: Why?
name: First of His Name

text: Why does he feel responsible for you?
name: First of His Name

text: Well, I'm half Tully.
name: First of His Name

text: He loved your family so much.
name: First of His Name

text: Loved your mother.
name: First of His Name

text: No.
name: First of His Name

text: That's what you wanted to say.
name: First of His Name

text: He loves you, Aunt Lysa.
name: First of His Name

text: He's married to you.
name: First of His Name

text: Your mother never loved him. Never.
name: First of His Name

text: Cat always went straight for the sweetest thing.
name: First of His Name

text: The most obvious thing. Your Uncle Brandon.
name: First of His Name

text: Your handsome, arrogant, cruel Uncle Brandon.
name: First of His Name

text: He almost killed Petyr in a duel.
name: First of His Name

text: And your mother loved him anyway.
name: First of His Name

text: And now Petyr is risking his life to save you, the daughter of a woman who didn't love him no more than those whores in his brothels.
name: First of His Name

text: Has he told you about them?
name: First of His Name

text: No.
name: First of His Name

text: He hasn't told you about the vile things they do with their bodies?
name: First of His Name

text: The vile things they let him do with their bodies?
name: First of His Name

text: No, never.
name: First of His Name

text: Are you pregnant?
name: First of His Name

text: What? No, I told you. Lord Tyrion and I never--
name: First of His Name

text: I wasn't asking about Tyrion.
name: First of His Name

text: What have you let Petyr do with your body?
name: First of His Name

text: Aunt Lysa, no, I--
name: First of His Name

text: Your young, pretty body.
name: First of His Name

text: Nothing. I'm a virgin.
name: First of His Name

text: Don't lie to me.
name: First of His Name

text: You're hurting me.
name: First of His Name

text: I'll know if you lie.
name: First of His Name

text: I'm a virgin, I swear it.
name: First of His Name

text: He loves you, Aunt Lysa.
name: First of His Name

text: All he says is that I'm stupid.
name: First of His Name

text: I'm a stupid little girl with stupid dreams who never learns and I'm a terrible liar, so I should always tell the truth.
name: First of His Name

text: And I swear to you that he has never touched me.
name: First of His Name

text: Not once, not ever.
name: First of His Name

text: Shh. Shh. Shh.
name: First of His Name

text: It's all right.
name: First of His Name

text: It will all be all right.
name: First of His Name

text: You'll be a widow soon.
name: First of His Name

text: They'll execute that dwarf for murdering the king and you'll be free to marry Robin.
name: First of His Name

text: You'll be the Lady of the Vale.
name: First of His Name

text: Hmm.
name: First of His Name

name: First of His Name

text: (grunting)
name: First of His Name

text: Didn't they teach you how to ride a horse?
name: First of His Name

text: Yes, my lady, when I was young.
name: First of His Name

text: There wasn't much call for it with Lord Tyrion, though.
name: First of His Name

text: He preferred litters.
name: First of His Name

text: Perhaps you should have stayed with him.
name: First of His Name

text: It's not going to be a pleasant journey for you.
name: First of His Name

text: It could take weeks to get to the Wall, depending on the weather.
name: First of His Name

text: That's a long way off.
name: First of His Name

text: Well, Lady Sansa's brother's at Castle Black.
name: First of His Name

text: If I were her, that's where I'd go.
name: First of His Name

text: Feel free to stop at any point.
name: First of His Name

text: Never, my lady. I'm your squire.
name: First of His Name

text: I've made it this far in the world without a squire.
name: First of His Name

text: I don't see why I need one now.
name: First of His Name

text: All knights have squires, my lady.
name: First of His Name

text: I'm not a knight.
name: First of His Name

text: And I'm not a slaver, either. I don't own you.
name: First of His Name

text: I swore an oath, my lady.
name: First of His Name

text: I am releasing you from that oath.
name: First of His Name

text: That means you could leave.
name: First of His Name

text: I know.
name: First of His Name

text: What do you think will happen if you leave?
name: First of His Name

text: They'll say I wasn't a very good squire.

text: On the first night of the full moon, I will hunt down every islander still on our lands and flay them living, the way I flayed
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: the 20 ironborn scum I found at Winterfell.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: In the box you'll finda special gift--Theon's favorite toy.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: He cried when I tookit away from him.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Leave the North nowor more boxes will followwith more Theon.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Signed Ramsay Snow,natural born sonof Roose Bolton,Lord of the Dreadfortand Warden of the North."
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Yes!
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Yara:They skinned our countrymen
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: and they mutilated my brother,your prince.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Your prince.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Everything they've done to him,they've also done to you.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Yes! Yes!
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Yara: As long as they can hurt our prince with impunity,the word ironborn means nothing.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (moaning loudly)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (metal clinking)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (Myranda moaning)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (grunts)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Go left.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (men whispering)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (groans)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Theon Greyjoy.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I don't know-- I'm here for Theon Greyjoy.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Take me to the dungeons.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: He's not in the dungeons.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (dogs panting)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (raspy breathing)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (door opens)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (alarm ringing)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (men shouting)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Last cage on the right.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Thank you.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (gurgles)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (swords clanging)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Man: This way!
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (barking)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (whimpering)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: We're going home.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: No!
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: It's all right.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: It's me, Yara.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: You can't trick me.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Tell him. Tell him you couldn't trick me.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I'm not tricking you, Theon. I'm saving you.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Not Theon! Reek!
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Reek! My name is Reek!
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: First mate: They're here.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: If they catch us in here, we're trapped.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Help me with him.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: No, you can't!
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: You can't!
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: You're Theon Greyjoy.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: No, I don't believe her!
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I know who I am!
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I'm Reek! Reek!
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Loyal Reek!
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Good Reek!
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I've always been Reek!
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (dogs barking)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (Theon whimpering)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: This is turning into a lovely evening.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (shouting)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (snarling, barking)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (groans)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (laughs)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Theon:I'm Reek!
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Loyal Reek!
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Aah!
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Theon!
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Give me my broth You've got bigger balls than he ever did.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: But with those big balls of yours...how fast can you run?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (cage rattling)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (dogs barking)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Make for the ship, now.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: But your brother.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: My brother is dead.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Ramsay: I have a treat for you.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: A reward.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Reward?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Yes, Reek.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Those creatures who came in the night, they wanted to take you away.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: And you didn't let them.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: You remained loyal.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I-- I didn't want them to take me.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I was so scared.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I didn't want them--
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Yes, yes, Reek.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: It's a bath.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: For you.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Remove those rags.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Now.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: The britches, too, Reek.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Take them off.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (whimpering)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (water splashes)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (whimpers)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (gasps)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Do you love me, Reek?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Yes, of course, my lord.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Good.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Because I need you to do something for me.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Something very important.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: There's a castle, you see.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Some bad men hold this castle.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I need your help to take this castle back.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: But how can-- I need you to play a role.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: To pretend to be someone you're not.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Pretend to be who?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Theon Greyjoy.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (goats bleating)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (water splashes)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (water splashes)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (rock thuds)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (roaring)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (bleating)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (roaring)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (speaking Low Valyrian)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: He is a goatherd.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: He says he prayed for your victory against the slave masters.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I thank him for his prayers.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (speaks Low Valyrian)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (speaking Low Valyrian)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: It was your dragons, he says.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: They came this morningfor his flock.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (speaks Low Valyrian)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: He hopes he has not offended Your Grace, but now he has nothing.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Tell this man I am sorry for his hardship.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (translating)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I cannot bring back his goats, but I will see he is paid their value three times over.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (speaking Low Valyrian)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Send the next one in.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Queen Daenerys.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Tales of your beauty were not exaggerated.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I thank you.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Mine is one of the oldest and proudest families in Meereen.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Then it is my honor to receive you.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: My father, one of Meereen's most respected and beloved citizens, oversaw the restoration and maintenance of its greatest landmarks.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: This pyramid included.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: For that, he has my gratitude.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I should be honored to meet him.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: You have, Your Grace.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: You crucified him.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I pray you'll never live to see a member of your family treated so cruelly.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Your father crucified innocent children.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: My father spoke out against crucifying those children.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: He decried it as a criminal act, but was overruled.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Is it justice to answer one crime with another?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I am sorry you no longer have a father, but my treatment of the masters was no crime.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: You'd be wise to remember that.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: What's done is done.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: You are the queen and I am a servant of Meereen.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: A servant who does not wish to see its traditions eradicated.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: And what traditions do you speak of?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: The tradition of funeral rite.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Proper burial in the Temple of the Graces.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: My father and noble Meereenese are still nailed to those posts, carrion for vultures, rotting in the sun.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Your Grace, I ask that you order these men taken down so that they might receive proper burials.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: And what of the slave children these noble Meereenese crucified?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: They were rotting in the sun as well.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Would you have begged me for their right to a proper burial?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Your Grace, I cannot defend the actions of the masters.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I can only speak to you as a son who loved his father.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Let me take his body down.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Let me have him broughtto the templeand buried with dignity so that he might find peace in the next world.
name: The Laws of God and Men

name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Bury your father, Hizdahr zo Loraq.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Thank you, my queen.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: How many more?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: There are 212 supplicants waiting, Your Grace.
name: The Laws of God and Men
The Laws of God and Men

text: Send the next one in.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: These meetings aren't always going to be this early, are they?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I was up late last night.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: So, does this mean I am a master of something now?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Coins, ships?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Lord Tywin and I already determined that I shall be the Master of Ships long before you--
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Lord Tywin, it's a great honor to have been granted a seat on this council. I--
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Tywin: The trial begins this afternoon.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: We only have the morning for affairs of state.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Shall we begin?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Varys: Sandor Clegane has been spotted in the Riverlands, my lord.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: A coward and a traitor.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: My birds tell me the Hound slaughtered five of our soldiers.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I believe the phrase "f*ck the king" was uttered.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Disgraceful.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Tywin: What would it take to make the common soldier stupid enough to try his luck with the Hound?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: 10 silver stags seems a generous bounty.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Make it 100.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: What else?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: More whispers from the east, my lord.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: The Targaryen girl?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Daenerys has taken up residence in Meereen.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: She has conquered the city and rules as its queen.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Conquered with what?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Varys: She commands an army of Unsullied, my queen.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Some 8,000 strong.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: She has a company of sellswords-- the Second Sons.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: She has two knightsadvising her--
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Jorah Mormont and Barristan Selmy.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: And she has three dragons.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Baby dragons.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Larger every year, Your Grace.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Mormont is spying on her for us.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: No longer. He appears to be fully devoted to her.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: As for Ser Barristan, it would seem he took his dismissal from the Kingsguard a bit harder than anticipated.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: He's an old man.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: He wasn't fit to protect my son.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Joffrey didn't die on his watch.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Dismissing him was as insulting as it was stupid.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Don't tell me you're worried about a child halfway across the world.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: A child with two seasoned warriors counseling her and a powerful army at her back, Your Grace.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Lord Varys is right.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I have been to Essos and seen the Unsullied firsthand.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: They are very impressive on the battlefield.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Less so in the bedroom.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Dragons haven't won a war in 300 years.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Armies win them all the time.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: She must be dealt with.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: How, my lord?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: By force?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Eventually, if it comes to that.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Can your little birds find their way into Meereen?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Most certainly, my Lord Hand.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Mmm. Lord Tyrell, be a good man.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Fetch my quill and paper.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (footsteps)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Prince Oberyn.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Lord Varys...
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Only Varys.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I'm not actually a nobleman.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: No one is under obligation to call me lord.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: And yet everyone does.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: You seem quite knowledgeable about the Unsullied.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Did you spend much time in Essos?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Five years.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: May I ask why?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: 'Tis a big and beautiful world.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Most of us live and die in the same corner where we were born and never get to see any of it.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I don't want to be most of us.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Most of us aren't princes.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (chuckles)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: You are from Essos.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Where? Lys?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I have an ear for accents.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I've lost my accent entirely.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I have an ear for that as well.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: How did you get here?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: It's a long story.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: One you don't like telling people.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: People I trust.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: My paramour Ellaria, she would find you very interesting.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: You should come to the brothel and meet her.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: We brought our own wine, not the swill they serve here.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: We have some lovely boys on retainer, but...
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: You did like boys before?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Really?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Girls? Hmm.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I hope you won't be offended when I say I never would have guessed.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Not at all.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: But I was never interested in girls, either.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: What then?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Nothing.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Everybody is interested in something.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Not me.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: When I see what desire does to people, what it's done to this country, I am very glad to have no part in it.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Besides, the absence of desire leaves one free to pursue other things.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Such as?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (keys clinking)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Let me guess, I've been pardoned.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Really?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Father's orders.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Well, we mustn't disappoint Father.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (crowd murmuring)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Man:Kingslayer!
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I, Tommen of the House Baratheon, First of my Name, King of the Andals and the First Men, and Lord of the Seven Kingdoms,
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: do hereby recuse myself from this trial.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Tywin of the House Lannister, Hand of the King, Protector of the Realm, will sit as judge in my stead.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: And with him Prince Oberyn of the House Martell and Lord Mace of the House Tyrell.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: And if found guilty...
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: may the gods punish the accused.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Tyrion of the House Lannister, you stand accused by the Queen Regent of regicide.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Did you kill King Joffrey?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: No.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Did your wife, the Lady Sansa?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Not that I know of.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: How would you say he died, then?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Choked on his pigeon pie.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: So you would blame the bakers?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Or the pigeons.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Just leave me out of it.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (crowd murmuring)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: The crown may call its first witness.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Once we'd got King Joffrey safely away from the mob, the Imp rounded on him.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: He slapped the king across the face and called him a vicious idiot and a fool.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (crowd gasps)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: It wasn't the first timethe Imp threatened Joffrey.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Right here in this throne room, he marched up those steps and called our king a halfwit.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Compared His Graceto the Mad Kingand suggested he'd meetthe same fate.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: And when I spoke in the king's defense, he threatened to have me killed.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Oh, why don't you tell them what Joffrey was doing?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Tywin: Silence.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Pointing a loaded crossbow at Sansa Stark while you tore at her clothes and beat her.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Silence!
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: You will not speak unless called upon.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: You're dismissed, Ser Meryn.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Basilisk venom, widow's blood, wolfsbane, essence of nightshade, sweetsleep, tears of Lys, demon's dance...
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (mumbling)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: blind eye--
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I think you have made your point, Grand Maester.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: You have a lot of poison in your store.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Had, Prince Oberyn.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: My stores were plundered.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: By whom?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Pycelle: By the accused, Tyrion Lannister, after he had me wrongfully imprisoned.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Tywin: Grand Maester, you examined King Joffrey's corpse.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Was it without question poison that killed him?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Without question.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (crowd murmuring)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: This was found on the body of Dontos Hollard, the king's fool.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: He was last seen spiriting Sansa Stark, the wife of the accused, away from the feast.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: She wore this necklace the day of the wedding.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Residue of a most rare and terrible poison was found inside.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Was this one of the poisons stolen from your store?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: It was.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: The Strangler.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: A poison few in the Seven Kingdoms possess.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: And used to strike down the most noble child the gods ever put on this good earth.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: (crowd murmuring)
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Cersei: "I will hurt you for this.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: A day will come when youthink you are safe and happyand your joy will turn to ashes in your mouth and you will know
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: the debt is paid."
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Your own brother said this to you?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Shortly before the Battle of Blackwater Bay.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I confronted him about his plans to put Joffrey on the front lines.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: As it turned out, when the attack came, Joff insisted on remaining at the battlements.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: He believed his presence would inspire the troops.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Tyrion said, "And you will know the debt is paid."
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: What debt?
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I discovered he'd been keeping whores in the Tower of the Hand.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: I asked him to confine his salacious acts to the brothel where such behavior belongs.
name: The Laws of God and Men

text: Lord Royce, we met when you came to Winterfell.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You were escorting your son Ser Waymar to the Wall.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Sansa Stark?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You tell lies right to my face, you little worm?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Lord Baelish has told many lies.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: All to protect me.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Since my father was executed, I have been a hostage in King's Landing.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: A plaything for Joffrey to torture or Queen Cersei to torment.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: They beat me, they humiliated me, they married me to the Imp.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I had no friends in King's Landing... except one.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: He saved me.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Smuggled me away when he had the chance.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: He knew I'd be safe here in the Eyrie with my own blood, my Aunt Lysa.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: The Lannisters have friends everywhere.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Even the Vale.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: He made me swear not to tell anyone my true name.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Your secret is safe with us, my lady.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Royce: Your father grew up right here in these halls.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: We hunted together many times.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: He was a fine man.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Tell us what happened to your aunt, Sansa.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You knew her well, my lords, my lady.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You knew she was a troubled woman.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: She always loved Lord Baelish.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: She told me herself.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: From the moment he arrived at the gates of Riverrun, a boy of eight carrying everything he owned in a little sack.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: She confessed to meshe never loved Lord Arryn.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: She did as her father commanded, as so many of us have.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: When the gods finally allowedher to be with Lord Baelish, she was so happy.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: For a time.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: My aunt was a jealous lady.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: She was terrified that Lord Baelish didn't love her anymore.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: That he would abandon her for a younger woman.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: And then... one day she saw him kiss me.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Lady Sansa.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: It was a peck on the cheek, Lord Royce, nothing more.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Lord Baelish is my uncle now, in truth, by marriage.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: He's always been so kind to me.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I was so happy to be here, to be free.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: All because of him.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: But my aunt turned on me.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: She cursed me.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Called me a whore.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Promised to throw me through the Moon Door.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: When Lord Baelish tried to calm her, she struck him.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: She said she didn't want to live anymore.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: She stood on the edgeof that Moon Door.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: He tried to reason with her.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Promised her she was the only one he had ever loved, but she stepped through those doors and she was--
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Shh.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Shh, it's not your fault, sweet girl.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: It's not your fault.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You could see it in the way she raised that boy.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Feeding him from her own teats when he was 10 years old.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Lord Royce!
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: This is hardly the time.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Apologies, my lady.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: And to you as well, Baelish.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: We treated you a bit harshly.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You want justice, Lord Royce.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I can hardly complain about that.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I want the same.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Not much justice to be meted out in suicide, is there?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: For Lysa, no.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: But for her son?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Only 20 years ago, the knights of the Vale rode behind Jon Arryn, Ned Stark, Robert Baratheon.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: They fought together to overcome the Mad King.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: And since then, Arryn and Royce, Corbray, Waynwood, all the great houses of the Vale watched from the corner.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: A timid boy at a tavern brawl.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Are you questioning our courage?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I want to know which side you're on.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Do you support the Lannisters, the house that executed your friend Ned Stark?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Of course we don't support the damn Lannisters.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: No? Catelyn Stark begged her sister for support and Lysa refused.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: By staying out of the fray, you've allowed Tywin Lannister to destroy his rivals on every compass point.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Who stands against him now?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Who would you have us back, Lord Baelish?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Robb Stark is dead.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I'd have you back Robin Arryn, Lord of the Vale.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Robin Arryn is a sickly little boy.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: And sickly little boys sometimes become powerful men.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: More often they die young.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I adored Lysa with all my heart.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: But she loved her son so much, she became overprotective.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: He needs to learn how to swing a sword.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: How to ride a horse.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Aye, it's time.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Yes, it's time.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Time for him to tour the Vale, to visit all the castles in his domain.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Time for Robin to leave the nest.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (grunts)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Boy:Ser Barristan.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Yes?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Who sent you?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Ser Barristan.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Ser Jorah.
name: The Mountain and the Viper
