name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Have I forgotten a council meeting?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: No.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: What's this?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: A royal pardon signed by Robert Baratheon.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You spied on her.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Who gave you this?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Does it matter?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Have you told her?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I wanted to tell you first, man-to-man rather than go behind your back.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Let me speak with her in private.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You'll never be alone with her again.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Why did the usurper pardon you?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: If we could speak alone.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: No, speak to me here.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Explain it to me.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Who do you think sent this to Meereen?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Who profits?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: This is the work of Tywin Lannister.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: He wants to divide us.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: If we're fighting each other, we're not fighting him.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: The pardon was signed the year we met.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Why were you pardoned?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Unless you're saying this document was forged.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: It is not forged.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Why, then?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I sent letters to Varys, the spymaster of King's Landing.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: What was the content of these letters?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Information.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: What information?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: When you and Viserys arrived in Pentos.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: His plan to marry you to Khal Drogo.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: When you were married.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: When your brother died.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You told him I was carrying Drogo's child?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Yes or no?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Khaleesi.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: - Don't call me that.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Did you tell him I was carrying Drogo's child?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Yes.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: That wine merchant tried to poison me because of your information.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I stopped you from drinking his wine.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Because you knew it was poisoned.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I suspected.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You betrayed me from the first.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Forgive me.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I never meant--please, Khaleesi, forgive me.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You sold my secrets to the man who killed my father
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: and stole my brother's throne...
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I have protected you.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Fought for you.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Killed for you.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: ...and you want me to forgive you?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I have loved you.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Love?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Love? How can you say that to me?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Any other man, and I would have you executed.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: But you, I do not want you in my city dead or alive.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Go back to your masters in King's Landing.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Collect your pardon if you can.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Daenerys, please.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Don't ever presume to touch me again or speak my name.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You have until dusk to collect your things and leave this city.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: If you're found in Meereenpast break of day,
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I'll have your head thrown into Slaver's Bay.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Go.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Now.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (footsteps departing)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Moat Cailin is yours, Father.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Walk with me.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Has there been any word from Locke?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: No.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Unimportant.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: A cripple, a young boy.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: None of the northern lords have seen them.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Dead most likely.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Most of the ironborn have fled the North.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Now more will follow, thanks to you.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Tell me what you see.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Moors, fields, hills.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Tell me what you see.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Nothing.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Not nothing.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: The North.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Ride 700 miles that way, you're still in the North.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: 400 miles that way.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: 300 miles that way.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: The North is larger than the other six kingdoms combined.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: And I am the Warden of the North.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: The North is mine.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Now tell me, what is your name?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Ramsay Snow.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: No, not Ramsay Snow.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Open it.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: From this day until your last day, you are Ramsay Bolton, son of Roose Bolton, Warden of the North.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You honor me.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I swear I will uphold your name and your tradition.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I will be worthy of you, Father, I promise.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Come, Reek, I'll be needing a bath.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (knocks)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Yes?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (door closes)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: First time I saw you,you were just a child.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: A girl from the North come to the capital for the first time.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Not a child any longer.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Why did you help me?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: They would have thrown you through the Moon Door if they found you guilty.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: That's not an answer.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: If they'd have executed you, what would they have done with me?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I don't know.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Neither do I.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Better to gamble on the man you know than the strangers you don't?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: And you think you know me?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I know what you want.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Do you?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Arya: I thought it'd make me happy, but it doesn't.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Not really.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Hound: Nothing makes you happy.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Lots of things make me happy.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Like what?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Killing Polliver, killing Rorge.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: So you're sad because you didn't get to kill Joffrey yourself.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Is that it?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: At least I could have been there to watch.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I wanted to see the look in his eyes when he knew it was over.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Aye, nothing in the world beats that look.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You protected him for most of his life.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You think you could have saved him?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I wasn't the damn wine taster.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Little sh1t deserved to die, but poison--
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: poison's a woman's weapon.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Men kill with steel.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: That's your stupid pride talking.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: It's why you'll never be a great killer.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I'd have killed Joffrey with a chicken bone if I had to.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (laughs)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I'd pay good money to see that.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (groans)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You should have let me burn it.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: It's a fleabite.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: That fleabite's got you walking a lot slower than you used to.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Well, we won't have to walk too much further.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You really think my aunt will pay for me?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Aye, she'll pay.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I've never even met her.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Doesn't matter.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You're her blood.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Family, honor, all that horseshit.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: It's all you lords and ladies ever talk about.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I'm not a lady.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Knight: Who would pass the Bloody Gate?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: The bloody Hound, Sandor Clegane.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: And his... traveling companion Arya Stark, niece of your lady Lysa Arryn.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Then I offer my condolences.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Lady Arryn died.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Three days ago.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (laughing)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (laughing continues)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I've never left home before, Uncle Petyr.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I'm afraid to leave.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You shouldn't be.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: The Lord of the Vale belongs in the Eyrie, Mother said.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: She said it's not safe outside.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: It wasn't safe for her inside.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: People die at their dinner tables.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: They die in their beds.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: They die squatting over their chamber pots.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Everybody dies sooner or later.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Don't worry about your death.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Worry about your life.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Take charge of your life for as long as it lasts.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: That is what it means to be Lord of the Vale.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (footsteps)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Shall we go?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Wine always helps.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I thank you for it.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Trial by combat.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Deciding a man's guilt or innocence in the eyes of the gods by having two other men hack each other to pieces.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Tells you something about the gods.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: How much longer?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Soon.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Do you think Oberyn has a chance?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: The Red Viper of Dorne.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You don't get a name like that unless you're deadly, right?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I've never seen him fight.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Oh, he's going to die.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I'm going to die.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Oberyn believes in himself.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: That's putting it mildly.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: What's the punishment for regicide?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Drawing and quartering?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Hanging?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: - Breaking at the wheel?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Beheading.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Seems rather ordinary.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: And he was my nephew as well, so what is that?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Fratricide is brothers.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Filicide is sons.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Nepoticide.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: That's the one.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Matricide, patricide, infanticide, suicide.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: There's no kind of killing that doesn't have its own word.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Cousins.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Cousins, you're right.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: There is no word for cousin killing.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Well done.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Do you remember cousin Orson?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Orson Lannister?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Of course. Wet-nurse dropped him on his head.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Left him simple.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: - Simple?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Used to sit all day in the garden.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Crushing beetles with a rock.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (both grunting)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (chuckles)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Nothing made him happier.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Nothing made you happier.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You'd think being tormented from birth would have given you some affinity for the afflicted.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: On the contrary. Laughing at another person's misery was the only thing that made me feel like everyone else.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: The joke wore thin, though.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: For you.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You drifted away.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I had other interests.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Yes, other interests.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: But I stayed with Orson.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Why?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I was curious.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Why was he smashing all those beetles?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: What did he get out of it?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: First thing I did was ask him.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: "Orson, why are you smashing all those beetles?"
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: He gave me an answer.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: "Smash the beetles.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Smash 'em."
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (grunting)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I wasn't deterred.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I was the smartest person I knew.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Certainly I had the wherewithal to unravel the mysteries that lay at the heart of a moron.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: So I went to Maester Volarik's library.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Volarik.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Tried to touch me once.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Turns out, far too much has been written about great men and not nearly enough about morons.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Doesn't seem right.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: In any case, I found nothing that illuminated the nature of Orson's affliction or the reason behind his relentless beetle slaughter.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: So I went back to the source.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I may not have been able to speak with Orson, but I could observe him, watch him the way men watch animals to come to a deeper understanding of their behavior.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: And as I watched, I became more and more sure of it.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: There was something happening there.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: His face was like the page of a book written in a language I didn't understand.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: But he wasn't mindless.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: He had his reasons.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: And I became possessed with knowing what they were.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I began to spend inordinate amounts of time watching him.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I would eat my lunch in the garden, chewing my mutton to the music of...
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (grunting)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: And when I wasn't watching him, I was thinking about him.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Father droned on about the family legacy and I thought about Orson's beetles.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I read the histories of Targaryen conquests.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Did I hear dragon wings?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: No.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I heard...
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (grunting)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: And I still couldn't figureout why he was doing it.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: And I had to know, because it was horrible that all these beetles should be dying for no reason.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Every day around the world, men, women, and children are murdered by the score.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Who gives a dusty f*ck about a bunch of beetles?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I know, I know. But still, it filled me with dread.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Piles and piles of them, years and years of them.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: How many countless living crawling things smashed and dried out and returned to the dirt?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: In my dreams I found myself standing on a beach made of beetle husks stretching as far as the eye could see.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I woke up crying, weeping for their shattered little bodies.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I tried to stop Orson once.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: He was twice your size.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: He just pushed me aside with a "kuuh" and kept on smashing.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Every day until that mule kicked him in the chest and killed him.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: So what do you think?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Why did he do it?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: What was it all about?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I don't know.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (bells tolling)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Good luck today.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (door closes)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (crowd shouting)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Looks like very light armor.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I like to move around.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You could at least wear a helmet.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You shouldn't drink before a fight.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You learn this during your years in the fighting pits?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I always drink before a fight.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: It could get you killed.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: It could get me killed.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Today is not the day I die.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (crowd cheering)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You're going to fight that?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I'm going to kill that.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: He is the biggest man I've ever seen.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Size does not matter when you are flat on your back.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Thank the gods.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (horn blows)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: In the sight of gods and men, we gather to ascertain the guilt or innocence of this... man Tyrion Lannister.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: May the Mother grant them mercy.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: May the Father give them such justice as they deserve.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: And may the Warrior guide the hand...
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: - (horn blows)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: ...of our champion--
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Don't leave me alone in this world.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Never.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (crowd cheering)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Have they told you who I am?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Some dead man.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I am the brother of Elia Martell.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Do you know why I have come all the way to this stinking shit-pile of a city?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: For you.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I'm going to hear you confess before you die.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You raped my sister.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You murdered her.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You killed her children.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Say it now and we can make this quick.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (shouting)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Say it.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You raped her.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You murdered her.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (shouts)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You killed her children.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (growls)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You raped her!
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You murdered her!
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You killed her children!
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (grunts)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (crowd cheering)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (groans)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You raped her!
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You murdered her!
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (screams)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You killed her children!
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (groans)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (crowd clamoring)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Wait.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Are you dying?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: No, no, no.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You can't die yet.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You haven't confessed.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Say it.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Say her name.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Elia Martell.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You raped her.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You killed her children.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Elia Martell.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Who gave you the order?
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Who gave you the order?!
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Say her name!
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You raped her!
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You murdered her!
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: You killed her children.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Say it.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Say her name.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Say it!
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (grunts)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (teeth rattle)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Elia Martell.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (screaming)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: I killed her children.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Then I raped her.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Then I smashed her head in like this!
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (screaming)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: The gods have made their will known.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: Tyrion Lannister, in the name of King Tommenof the House Baratheon,First of His Name, you are hereby sentenced to death.
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: (music playing)
name: The Mountain and the Viper

text: ( Theme music playing )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: ( wind blowing )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: ( men shouting )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: What was she like?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: She...
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: she had red hair.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Oh?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: How big were her feet?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: What do you want me to say?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I want you to tell me what it was like to have someone.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: To be with someone.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: To love someone and have them love you back.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: We're all gonna die a lot sooner than I'd planned.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: You're the closest I'll ever get to knowing.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: So you and Gilly never?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: No.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: She just had a baby.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: And she never offered.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: But if she had, you would have?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: You'd have broken your vows?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: The interesting thing is, our vows never specifically forbid intimate relations with women.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: What?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: "I shall take no wife," yes, that's in there.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: There's no denying that.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: "I shall father no children."
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: It's very specific.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: But what do our vows have to say about other... activities is open to interpretation.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I don't think Ser Alliser cares much for interpretation.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Anyway, there's nothing for him to interpret.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: We didn't.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: So what's it like?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: It's... there's this person, this whole other person.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: And you're wrapped up in them and they're wrapped up in you.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: And you...
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: for a little... for a little while, you're more than just you.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: You're... I don't know.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I'm not a bleeding poet.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: No, you're really not.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: What did I get for it?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: An arrow six inches from my heart.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: There'll be arrows for all of us soon, I imagine.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: There will.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: They've already done the worst thing to me they could ever do.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Go get some sleep, Sam.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I'll take this watch.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: ( Screeches )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: ( screeches )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Did I ever tell you about her?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: My Sheila?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Yes.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: That was a night to remember.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Of course, I'd had a good bit to drink.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: ( Chuckles )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Her fangs were sharp, but she knew how to use them.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: And she was nice and soft down below.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: No, she was no ordinary beast.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Many is the man who...
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I know you never f*cked a bear.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: You know you never f*cked a bear.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Right now I don't want to think about the bear you never f*cked.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Right now all I want to think about is each one of these arrows finding its way into a crow's heart.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: We could be waiting here a while.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Good.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: The longer we wait, the more arrows I'll have.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: They came up here to our land and put up a big wall and said it was theirs.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Then they started hunting us down.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: This time, we're the ones doing the hunting.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: You've got a lot to say about killing.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Even more words than arrows.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Back in those villages, I killed just as many of them as you did.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: More, I reckon.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Yes, but none of those were your crow lover.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I probably killed him already.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Styr: So you've said.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: And if not, the only thing left of him is gonna be his fun bits hanging around my neck.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Styr: More words.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Know what I think you do when you see him?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Serve him up a nice juicy slice of ginger minge.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: ( Men laughing )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: You been thinking about that ginger minge?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Wondering what Maybe I have.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Jon Snow is mine.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Anyone else tries to kill him, I'll have an arrow for them.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: And not one of your bald friends is fast enough to stop me.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: And what is it that couldn't wait until morning, Tarly?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Maester Aemon.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: How did you know...
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: That it was you?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Who else but Samwell Tarly would be wasting candles to read in the middle of the night?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Let me help you.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Oh, no need.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I know my way around this library better than any other place in Castle Black.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Thousands of books and no eyes to read them.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Old age is a wonderful source of ironies if nothing else.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: But you didn't answer my question.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: What are you reading?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Maester Faull.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Ah, the wildlings.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I can assure you that the closest Maester Faull ever got to a wildling was this very library.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: But what he says about what they do, it's all true.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: It's exactly what the survivors of their raids report.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Yes, imagine the stories wildlings tell about us.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Love is the death of duty.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I told that to your friend Jon Snow once.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: He didn't listen and neither did you.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Which is why you've abandoned your watch atop the Wall to come here and read about the terrible things that may have happened to the girl you love.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I don't love her.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Yes, you do.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: No.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Yes, you do.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Heard it in your voice when you first brought her to me.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I remember how it sounds.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I was in love once.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: You were?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: You can imagine all manner of horrors befalling that poor girl and her child.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Is it so difficult to imagine that an old person was once, more or less, like you?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I'm sorry, Maester.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I didn't mean it like that.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Do you know who I was before I came here?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: What I could have been if I'd only said the word?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Of course you do.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I met many girls when I was Aemon Targaryen.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: A future king always does.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Some of them were quite forward in their attempts to win my affections.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: One of them succeeded.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I was very young.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Who was she?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Ah.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I could tell you everything about her.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Who she was, how we met, the color of her eyes, and the shape of her nose.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I can see her right in front of me.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: She's more real than you are.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: We could spend all night trading tales of lost loves.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Nothing makes the past a sweeter place to visit than the prospect of imminent death.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Go to bed, Tarly.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Pyp:  Sorry, I can't open the gate for anybody. Orders.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Gilly:  You don't understand. They killed everyone.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Everyone but me and my baby.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: They're out there.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I saw them on my way here.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: They may have seen me. They may have followed me. Please.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Pyp: I'm sorry, I can't.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Gilly:  If they find us out here, you don't know...
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Pyp! Open the gate.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I can't.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Sam, is that you?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Yes.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Thorne gave me strict orders to not open the gate.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Oh, Pyp, open the f*cking gate!
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I never heard you curse before.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Yes, well, best get used to it.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Are you all right?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: ( Panting )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: ( Baby fusses )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Shh, you're all right.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Of course you are, my brave little fella.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: It was horrible.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I'm so, so sorry.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I didn't know until I got back.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Don't let them send me away, Sam.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Never.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I know there's no women allowed.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Anyone who tries to throw you out will be having words with me.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: From now on, wherever you go, I go, too.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: ( Horn blows )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: ( horn blows )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Man: Get ready!
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Man the gate!
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Ready yourselves!
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Make haste!
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Prepare!
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Up on the Wall!
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Quickly! Up! Up!
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: How many? How many are there?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: ( horn blows )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: ( Screeches )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Beyond the trees!
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: It's time.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: ( Men shouting )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: ( horn blows )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Light them up! Light them all!
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: ( Horn blowing )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: ( Men shouting )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Move!
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Pick up the pace!
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Come on, come on.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Here we go, boys, there's one.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Let's go. There's two.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Let's get the next load.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: That's the last of the oil, Ser Alliser.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: 100,000 you say?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Yes, Ser.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: You can say it if you like.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: We should have sealed the tunnel while we had the chance, like you suggested.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: It was a difficult decision either way, Ser.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Do you know what leadership means, Lord Snow?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: It means that the person in charge gets second-guessed by every clever little twat with a mouth.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: But if he starts second-guessing himself, that's the end... for him, for the clever little twats, for everyone.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: This is not the end.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Not for us.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Not if you lot do your duty for however long it takes to beat them back.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: And then you get to go on hating me and I get to go on wishing your wildling whore had finished the job.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: ( Horn blows )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Sam: You'll be safe down here.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I'll check on you as soon as I can.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: You're leaving me again?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I'm not leaving you.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: You're going up there and we're staying down here. That's leaving.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: You said from now on we'd stay together.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I didn't mean in the same room.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: What are you going to do out there?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Help my brothers.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: How?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: You're going to fight the free folk when they come?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: They'll kill you. In Mole's Town, they killed everyone.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I can't just hide here with you while they're fighting out there.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Why not? You won't matter up there.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: You will down here.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I am a man of the Night's Watch, Gilly.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I made a promise to defend the Wall and I have to keep it because that's what men do.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Promise me you won't die.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I promise you I won't die.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: ( Lock clicks )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: ( men shouting )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: ( Horse whinnies )
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: There's a lot more wildlings on the other side of the Wall than this side.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: We've got loads of weapons and things.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: It's the perfect place for us to be.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I've never thrown a spear before.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: I've never held a sword with a proper edge.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: This is no place for me to be.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: You're not afraid?
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: Of course I'm afraid.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

text: There's a band of wildlings coming to kill us.
name: The Watchers on the Wall

name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: We are rescuing my niece, bringing her back to the family, Your niece?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I've been doing this sort of thing a long time.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I'm good at it.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: That's why you're here.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I know.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Why are you here? Why not send 40 of me, or an army?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Unlike most folks, you actually got one.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Because I don't want to start a war.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: That still doesn't explain why you're doing it.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: It has to be me.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: If I'm putting something of a lit together, a one-handed man, who happens to be one of the most recognizable faces in Westeros is not...
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: It has to be me.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You set your brother free, didn't you?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I bet your sister didn't like that.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Varys set him free.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Well... if you ever see the little fucker, give him my regards.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: He murdered my father.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: If I ever see him, I'll split him in two.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And then I'll give him your regards.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: The Iron Bank has called one tenth of the Crown's debts.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Given the expensive rebuilding of...
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: How much can the Crown afford?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: With winter coming, half what they ask.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Less.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You're the Master of Coin.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: How do we pay them?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: House Tyrell could front the gold and the... the Crown will pay us back in time, or I'll have words with my daughter.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You've already given us too much.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: No, we must arrange better terms with the Iron Bank.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Absolutely.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: In person.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Me?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: We must send an envoy to the Iron Bank, someone of importance, to show these bankers our respect.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: As the King's Master of Coin, I can think of no one more qualified.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I will be honored, Your Grace.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: The King has expressed concern about his father-in-law's safety on this voyage.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: He's ordered Ser Meryn to personally lead your escort.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: A valiant Kingsguard?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Please express...
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Safe travels, Lord Tyrell.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Of course, of course, I'll give your regards to the Titan of Braavos.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: The Small Council grows smaller and smaller.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Not small enough.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: May I offer you some wine, Your Holiness?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: No.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: The old High Septon would have asked the vintage.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I could say that our minds are temples to the Seven and should be kept pure.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: But the truth is, I don't like the taste.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: How may I serve?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: All over Westeros we hear about septs being burned.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Silent sisters raped.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Bodies of holy men piled in the streets.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Wars teach people to obey the sword, not the Gods.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Perhaps the Gods need a sword of their own.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: In the days before the Targaryens, the Faith Militant dispensed the justice of the Seven.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Well, the Faith Militant was disarmed more than two centuries ago.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: If I explain the holy purpose to my son, the king, I have no doubt he will sign a decree arming the believers you find worthy.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: An army that defends the bodies and souls of the common people.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: An army and service to the Gods themselves.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And to you, of course.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: As the chosen representative of the Seven.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: An honor I've never expected.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Or indeed, ever wished for.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Which is why you were chosen.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You and I both know how the world works.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Too often the wicked or the wealthiest be on the reach of justice.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: The king himself cannot always punish those who deserve it most.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: All sinners are equal before the Gods.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: What would you say if I told you we have a great sinner in our own midst?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Shielded by gold and privilege.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: May the Father judge him justly.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Help me! Help me!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Aah!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: This is Lord Petyr Baelish's establishment.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Cocksucker!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Boy fucker!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You barbaric filth!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: There's a special place in the Seven Hells for your kind.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Please, please, I'll pay!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I'll pay all of you.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Yes, you will!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Seize him.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Get your hands off of me.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Ser Loras of House Tyrell, you have broken the laws of Gods and men.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Who do you think you are?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Justice.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Why is my brother in a cell?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I--I don't know.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I--I didn't order it.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: We both know who did.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You told me she was returning to Casterly Rock.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Are you saying my mother is behind this?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: She's jealous you're not hers anymore.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Arresting my brother is her revenge.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Aren't you and mother getting along?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Oh, my sweet, sweet King.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Do you have any affection for me at all?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Of course I do.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You're my Queen.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I can't bear to think of my brother locked away in some grimy cell.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I'll set him free for you.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You promise?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I demand that Ser Loras be freed now!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Did I arrest him?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Well, no...
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: But you armed the Faith Militant.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You gave the High Sparrow an army.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I did.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And your wife has every right to criticize.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Can't allow fanatics to arrest the Queen's brother, no matter his perversions.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Then... can I tell Margaery you'll have Ser Loras released?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I told you I am not holding Ser Loras.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You're the King. I'm sure if you speak to the High Sparrow, he'll release the poor boy.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Halt!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: His Holiness is praying. He will not be disturbed.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Give the order and we'll tear out this rebel.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You mean, kill them? Here, in the sept?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You'll be sending them to meet the Gods that they love.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: b*st*rd!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You're an abomination!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You're born of sin!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Filthy b*st*rd!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: We'll find another way.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Abomination!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: My Queen.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: There was no way to free Ser Loras without violence.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You're the King of the Andals, the Lord of the Seven Kingdoms, the Protector of the Realm.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And you let a band of fanatics imprison your brother by law.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I'm going to speak to the High Sparrow.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Are you? When?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I--I don't know.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You don't know?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: He was praying just now.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I have to send word to Grandmother.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Will you come back later?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I need to be wit my family, Your Grace.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Of course.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You think highly of this boy.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Good.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Lord Commander of the Night's Watch.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: A b*st*rd by some tavern slut.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Perhaps, but that wasn't Ned Stark's way.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I should have given you a son.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Not your fault.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Whose then?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I gave you nothing but weakness.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And deformity.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Those scars mean nothing to the Lord of Light.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: My Lady.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Her father is the Lord's chosen King.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And her father's blood runs through her veins.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You march on Winterfell soon.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: We must.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: To beat the snows.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Once before you put your faith in Ser Davos and left me behind.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I hope you won't make that mistake again.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I won't.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I need you.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You only need faith, my King.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And you, my Lady, what do you need?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: To serve my Lord.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Lord Ashford.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Lenny Coalfield.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Lord Smallwood.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Never even heard of these people.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: They haven't heard of you either.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: But we need men and they have some.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: How many men does this Lord *** have to send us?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: More than Lord Weebly.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Not him.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Then who?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I'm sorry, but we need men and supplies.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And Roose Bolton is the Warden of...
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: He murdered my brother.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: We swore to be the Watchers on the Wall.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: We can't watch the Wall with 50 men.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And we can't get more men without help from the Warden of the North.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Apologies, my Lady.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Lord Commander.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: How can I help you?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Come with us when we ride south.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: None of us know the castle as well as you do.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Its hidden tunnels, its weaknesses, its people.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Winterfell was your home once.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Don't you want to chase the rats out of it?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Castle Black is my home now.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Night's Watch takes no part in the wars of the Seven Kingdoms.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: There's only one war.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Life against death.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Come.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Let me show what you're fighting for.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You're gonna show me some vision in the fire.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Forgive me, my Lady.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: But I don't trust in visions.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: No visions.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: No magic.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Just life.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Do you feel my heart beating?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: This power in you, you resist it, and that's your mistake. Embrace it.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: The Lord of Light made us male and female.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Two parts of a greater whole.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You're not joining this power.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Power to make life, power to make light, and power to cast shadows.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I don't think Stannis would like that very much.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Then we shouldn't tell him.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I can't.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Why?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I swore a vow.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I loved another.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: The dead don't need lovers.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Only the living.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I know.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: But I still love her.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You know nothing, Jon Snow.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Are you lonely?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Just bored.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: My father used to tell me that boredom indicates a lack of inner resources.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Were you bored a lot, too?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I know Castle Black is no place for a child.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I like it.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I thought I'd be left at home.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I know mother didn't want to bring me.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Why do you say that?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: She told me "I don't want to bring you."
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: She shouldn't have said that.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Are you ashamed of me, father?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: When you were an infant, the Dornish trailer landed on Dragonstone.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: His goods were junk except for one wooden doll.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: He'd even sewn a dress on it in the colors of our House.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: No doubt he'd heard of your birth.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And assumed new fathers were easy targets.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I still remember how you smiled when I put that doll in your cradle.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You pressed it to your cheek.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: By the time we burnt the doll, it was too late.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I was told you would die.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Or worse.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: The grayscale would go slow.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Let you grow just enough to know the world before taking it away from you.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Everyone advised me to send you to the ruins of Valyria to live out your short life with the Stone men, before the sickness spread to the castle.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I told them all to go to hell.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I called in every maester on this side of the world.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Every healer, every apothecary.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: They stopped the disease and saved your life.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Because you did not belong across the world with the bloody Stone men.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You are the Princess Shireen of House Baratheon.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And you are my daughter.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I thought I might find you here.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Your Aunt Lyanna.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: My father never talked about her.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Sometimes I'd find him down here, lighting the candles.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: They say she was beautiful.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I saw her once.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I was a boy, living with your mother's family.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Lord Whent had a great tourney at Harrenhal.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Everyone was there.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: The Mad King, your father, Robert Baratheon, and Lyanna. She was already promised to Robert.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You can imagine what it was like for me, a boy from nowhere, with nothing to his name, watching these legendary men, tilting at the lists.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: The last two riders were Barristan Selmy and Rhaegar Targaryen.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: When Rhaegar won, everyone cheered for the prince.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I remember the girls laughing when he took off his helmet and they saw that silver hair.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: How handsome he was.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Until he rode right past his wife, Elia Martell, and all the smiles died.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I've never seen so many people so quiet.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: He rode past his wife and he lay a crown of winter roses in Lyanna's lap.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Blue was frost.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: How many tens of thousands had to die because Rhaegar chose your aunt?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Yes, he chose her.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And then he kidnapped her and raped her.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Come.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Let's speak somewhere the dead can't hear us.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text:

name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Dressed for riding?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I am.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Where are you going?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: King's Landing.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: King's Landing?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Cersei sent for me.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: We must not let her sniff out any trouble.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You can't leave me here.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I know how hard it is to live with people you despise, believe me.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: But it won't be for long.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: How do you know?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Stannis Baratheon garrisons at Castle Black.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: He'll march south to King's Landing before the winter snows block his way.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: But first, he has to take Winterfell.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You don't know that.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I do.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Once he liberates these lands from the Boltons he'll rally your father's bannermen to his cause.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: With the North behind him, Stannis can finally take the Iron Throne.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You think he'll defeat the Boltons?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: He has a larger army.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: He's the finest military commander in Westeros.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: A betting man would put his money on Stannis.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: As it happens, I am a betting man.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And if you're right?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Stannis takes Winterfell, he rescues you from the most despised family in the North.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Grateful for your late father's courageous support for his claim, he names you Wardeness of the North.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: But I... I wouldn't...
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Wardeness of the North...
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You are the last surviving Stark.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: He needs you.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: What if you're wrong?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: What if Stannis never attacks Winterfell, or he does and the Boltons defeat him?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Then you will this Bolton boy, Ramsay, and make him yours.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I don't know how to do that.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Of course you do.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: He's already fallen for you.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: His father frightens me.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: He should, he's a dangerous man.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: But even the most dangerous men can be outmaneuvered.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And you learned to maneuver from the very best.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I return before too long.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You'll be strong without me.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: The North will be yours.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Do you believe me?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I expect I'll be a married woman by the time you return.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Breakfast.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: That would have been a sh1t way to die.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: As far as I've seen, they're all shot way to die.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Aye. But y'all ought to give the singers a good ending.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I don't care what's sung about me when I'm dead.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: No?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Two knights, off to rescue a princess.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Sounds like a good song to me.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Sounds like all the rest.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: What about you? What sh1t way would you choose?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: In my own keep, drinking my own wine, watching my son gravel from a fortune.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: How disappointing. I thought you'd have something more exciting planned.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I've had an exciting life. I want my death to be boring.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: How do you want to go?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: In the arms of the woman I love.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: She want the same thing?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Let's go.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: The captain to that ship...
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: What was he, Braavosi?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Pentoshi.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And he's headed to Oldtown.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: As I said.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Why?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: What's to stop him from docking down the coast and telling the locals that Jaime Lannister's in Dorne?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: A bag of gold.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I'm not sure you understand how much people hate your family in this part of the world.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: It was a heavy bag.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And I bet he swore all kinds of oaths to get it.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: But you won't be around if he breaks them.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: How many you count?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Four.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: How many you think you can take?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: One, if he's slow.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Halt!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: f*cked in the arse.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Hiya!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Morning, lads.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Glad we found you.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Who are you?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Cooper.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: This is Darnell.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You're from King's Landing.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Accent gave you away?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Flea Bottom.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Whelped and whipped.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Why are you here?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Our ship capsized in the night.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: We managed to swim ashore.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: It was a near thing, really.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I thought the sharks would get us.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: There are no sharks in Dorne.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I could have sworn those were shark fins.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Dolphins maybe.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Throw your swords in the sand.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Boys, there's no need for this.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Just, point us in the right direction.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: We'll find our way home.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Swords in the sand!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Now!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: That one should be slow enough.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Nice move!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Luck.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You had a wonderful teacher.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Always wanted a Dornish stallion.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Beasts can run a day and night without tiring.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: We'll ride to the Water Gardens with a nice breeze in our face.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: But first we need to bury these bodies.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Birds have to eat too.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Corpses raise questions, questions raise armies.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: We're not here to start a war.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Do you know how long it will take us to dig all those holes?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I can't dig very well with one hand.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Not at all, really.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Nama...
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Nym, Obara.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Will it be war?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Prince Doran will weep for your father, but nothing else.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: We must avenge Oberyn ourselves.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Without Doran we have no army to march against the Lannisters.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: We don't need an army to start a war.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Queen Cersei loves her children.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: ...and we have one of them.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: We may have a problem.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: A ship's captain, who found me in Planky Town, claiming he had information to sell.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: He told me he smuggled Jaime Lannister into Dorne.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: He's come for Myrcella.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: If he gets to her before we do, we lose our only chance for revenge.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You must choose...
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Doran's way and peace, or my way... and war.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I'm with you. Always.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Nym?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Obara?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: When I was a child, Oberyn came to take me to court.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I'd never seen this man, and yet he called himself my father.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: My mother wept, said I was too young, and a girl.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Oberyn tossed his spear at my feet and said "Girl or boy, we fight our battles. But the Gods let us choose our weapons."
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: My father pointed to the spear, and then to my mother's tears.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I made my choice long ago.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Thank you.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Who are you?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Your captor.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Do you have wine?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: No.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I can't sleep without wine.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Then stay awake.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You're going the wrong way.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: My sister's in Westeros.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Westeros...is west!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: We're heading east...
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I'm not taking you to your sister.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You said you were taking me to the Queen.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I am.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Queen Daenerys Targaryen.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: She's the Queen I serve.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: What a waste of a good kidnapping.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: So happens I was heading there myself!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: What business would you have with the Queen?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Gold and glory?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Oh, and hate.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: If you've ever met my sister, you'd understand.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: So... now that it's clear we're on the same side.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: A high born knight from the North of Westeros, down on his luck in Essos.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Dragon epaulettes?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Bear sigil breast plate.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You're Jorah Mormont.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I have to ask... how, exactly, were you serving your Queen in a whore house, half a world away?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Is it possible, that you were running?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Why would you be running?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And why would she have sent you away?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Oh, wait!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You were spying on her, weren't you?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: It's all coming back to me!
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I was drunk through most of the Small Council meetings, but it's all coming back.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: You passed notes to Varys's little birds.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: She found out, didn't she?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Found out, and exiled you.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And now you hope to win back her favor with a gift.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: A risky scheme...
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: One might even say, desperate.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Do you think Daenerys would execute me, and pardon you?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I'd say the reverse is just as likely.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Everyone looks happy enough from up here.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: What?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I was thinking of all the times your brother made me go with him down from the Red Keep, into the streets of King's Landing.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Why?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: He liked to walk among the people, he liked to sing to them.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: He sang to them?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Yes.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Rhaegar would take a spot on the Hook or the Street of Seeds and he'd sing.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Just like all the other minstrels.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And what did you do?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I made sure no one killed him.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And... I collected the money.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Well... he liked to see how much he could make.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: He was good?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: He was very good.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Viserys never told you?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: He told me Rhaegar was good at killing people.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Rhaegar never liked killing.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: He loved singing.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: And what did you do with the money?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Well, one time, we gave it to the next minstrel down the street.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: One time, he gave it to an orphanage in Flea Bottom.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: One time... we got horribly drunk.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Your Grace.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Hizdahr is here, waiting in the audience chamber.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: How many others are there?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Fifty... a hundred.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Will you be joining us, Ser Barristan?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I think I can protect you from Hizdhar Zo Loraq.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I think I can protect me from Hizdhar Zo Loraq.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Go, Ser Barristan.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Sing a song for me.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Your Grace.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: All men must die.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: But not all can die in glory.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Glory?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Why else do men fight?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Why did your ancestors cross the Narrow Sea and conquer the Seven Kingdoms?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: So their names would live on.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Those who find victory in the fighting pits, will never become kings... but their names will live on.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: It's the best chance they'll ever have.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Is that what you used to tell men before you set them to butchering each other for sport?
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Your Grace, today is the traditional start of the fighting season.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I do not recognize this tradition.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Traditions are the only thing that will hold this city... your city, together.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Without them, former slaves and former masters have nothing in common.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: Nothing but centuries of mistrust and resentment.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: I can't promise this is the answer to all our problems... but it's a start.
name: The Sons Of The Harpy

text: When I have refused the throne, Aerys reigned, whom they called the Mad King.
name: Kill the Boy

text: You're Aemon Targaryen.
name: Kill the Boy

text: What happened to your face?
name: Kill the Boy

text: Greyscale.
name: Kill the Boy

text: Everyone advised me to send you to the ruins of Valyria, to live out your short life with the Stonemen.
name: Kill the Boy

text: Two of my sisters had it. They were covered with it. The acted like animals.
name: Kill the Boy

text: Hide! Hide!
name: Kill the Boy

text: Put him in chains.
name: Kill the Boy
